173501.name: PaNiC STaTioNS
173501.description:
Intended for families who enjoy strategy-based games, PaNiC STaTioNS is a card game suitable for 2 to 4 players age 8 to 80.

The cards are first set out in a square to form the playing area. Some of the cards are kept back to ensure that it is more difficult to predict what you will land on. The cards are initially face-down and Tokens are placed on the cards.

The aim of the game is to collect 10 Tokens and then be the player who turns the last card face-up.

Each player has two Pawns which are moved around the cards according to the role of two dice. During the first phase of the game Tokens are collected when a player lands on the cards. The card is then turned face-up and any instructions followed. For example it could be a "Booby-Trap" card which forces your Pawn out of play. In which case you need to roll a 6 to bring it back in to play.

During the second phase of the game most of the Cards will have been turned-face up and most of the Tokens collected. It now becomes more important to keep both Pawns in play to give you some flexibility in choosing which cards you land on. You and your rivals will be trying to force Pawns out of play, trying to steal Tokens, and generally attempting to turn the last card face-up. The cards have various effects which assist (or hinder) you in this. Many of the cards interact with each other. For example if a rival's Pawn is on the "Philanthropy" card (which obliges him to give away 2 Tokens every time somebody else's Pawn goes out of play) it could be a good move to land on "Maelstrom" which forces all Pawns out of play. Most of the cards have effects that can be used to advantage in this way.
Each turn you also have the option of rolling the "Panic Die" which gives you other alternatives. You may choose to do this, for example, if your initial dice roll was particularly disadvantageous of if another player is about to win. You do however have the chance of losing half your Tokens - but even this can be turned to your advantage if you realise how.

173503.name: GaLakTik TakTik GT01 Basic Set
173503.description: Choose your favorite Empire and Starship and command it in a pitched battle with enemy ships. Exciting new combat system can be learned during your first battle. Battles usually last less than an hour. The combat system can be quickly learned, but can take a lifetime to master. The game readily adapts itself to tournament and campaign play, with or without a Game Master. Starships and data also provide ready-made "allies" or "bad guys" for existing Sci-Fi and Adventure Games. Additional D6 and D10 speed play.

173504.description:
The Greatest Day: Sword, Juno, and Gold Beaches, Battle for Normandy: Volume One, is the first volume in a three volume series covering the battle of Normandy in June of 1944. It not only introduces a new theater but also provides version 2.0 updates for the GTS rules. Assaults have been streamlined, the artillery rules have been improved, and various other changes have been made to make this version of GTS an even better gaming experience.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 hours in daytime / 8 to 12 hours nighttime
Hex: 546 yards / 500 meters
Units: Platoon to Company

Game Inventory:
Four 22 x 34" maps (Maps 1, 2, 3 & 4 - 3 dual-side printed)
Eight 8 x 11" maps (1-sided)
Sixteen dual-side printed countersheets (2,816 5/8" counters)
One 36-page Grand Tactical Series Rules of Play booklet
One 12-page Grand Tactical Series Rules Summary booklet
One 60-page The Greatest Day Exclusive Rules booklet
One 68-page The Greatest Day Scenario booklet
One Turn Record Chart & Weather Table (1-sided)
Two Terrain Effects Charts (2-sided)
Two Terrain Effects Chart Notes & Charts and Tables (2-sided)
Twelve Divisional Display Cards (6 Allied & 6 German, 1-sided)
Three Beach Naval Display Cards (1-sided)
Four 10-sided dice
173504.name: The Greatest Day: Sword, Juno, and Gold Beaches

173506.name: 7TV On Location
173506.description:
On Location is a 110+ pages supplement for Crooked Dice's Spy-Fi miniature game that introduces rules for playing in 6 new environments: space, desert, underwater, artic, in the dark, airborne).

In addition to these, the supplement features new gadgets, casts, episodes, etc.

173507.name: The Cultist
173507.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are things that the mightiest wizards dare not speak of, and even the gods themselves dare not confront: Great Cthulhu, the Black Goat, the Crawling Chaos, the Unspeakable One.

It is said that long ago They ruled and terrorized the world, possibly even other worlds and dimensions. Something must have happened to Them, because all that remains now are cyclopean ruins, servitor races, and sanity-eroding records. They slumber in death-like states, or are imprisoned outside of space and time.

For now.

They stir in Their sleep. They test the boundaries of Their prisons. Eventually They will wake and free themselves. Eventually They will return. What then? Will They crush the cities of man underhoof, devouring everyone they find? Will the world be transformed in accordance to Their whims, or will it be reduced to a blackened cinder?

The only sure thing is that They’re going to win, and it’s better to be at Their side then in Their path. Granted They’ll likely crush or devour you anyway, but it can’t hurt to hedge the odds in your favor.

Given all the other Lovecraftian content I've created over the years, I'm honestly surprised it took us this long to make a cultist class. You start out being able to requisition resources from your cult, summon monsters, perform dark rituals, and knowing things that people just shouldn't know.

As you level up you get to choose how you grow: do you become more influential in your cult; do your monsters become bigger and better; do rituals become easier to pull off; do you delve ever deeper into secrets best left forgotten?

In addition to a revamped character sheet layout (I had to in order to fit everything on the sheet), there's also a digest-sized pdf that includes:

The cultist (obviously), along with 20 advanced moves.
Some new bits of gear, including magic scrolls that anyone can use, and an ancient tome that lets you uncover forgotten or unknowable secrets at the possible cost of your sanity.
Two magic items: the flute of the outer servitor and silver key.
The child of the goat compendium class.
Four Lovecraftian monsters: the dark young, flying polyp, hound of Tindalos, and thulhid.
A deeper look at your cult, cultist moves, and items.

173508.name: Mythic Cloud and Storm Giants
173508.description:
From publisher blurb:

Titanic Rulers of the Skies!

Storm and cloud giants are the stuff of legends. Far more sophisticated than their brutish and earth-bound kin, these majestic giants are most at home far above the clouds, where they are rumored to live in giant castles and golden cities miraculously suspended in the air. As legendary as these sky titans are, however, there are a few among them that are even more masterful and impressive than the rest of their race. These are the mythic cloud and storm giants.

This book presents game statistics for mythic cloud giant and mythic storm giant, both of which have unique abilities never seen elsewhere. Mythic cloud giants (CR 14) can cause her foes to fly skyward when she strikes them, slamming them back down to the earth for extra damage. Further, she can transform clouds, causing them to become as solid and substantial as rock, and can summon clouds (including magical clouds, such as cloudkill) to nearby places. Not to be outdone, mythic storm giants (CR 17) can hurl thunderbolts at their foes, and wield blades made of pure lightning. As if that weren’t enough, their dominion over storms extends from the air to the sea, and they can create deadly whirlpools to swallow their foes.

173509.name: Hordes!!!
173509.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gostor: Hordes!!! down provides A framework to add mobs and minions to your Pathfinder RPG games to create some truly epic battles without spending hours creating them or running them
Short on time? Missing players for an important part of the game? Lacking Preparation? Your Players decide to follow up on a random lead you haven't prepared? This book is for you!

173510.name: Not Bolted Down
173510.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gostor:Not bolted down provides a system-agnostic light framework for creating interesting treasure items in role-playing games. So your villains do not merely have piles of gold lying around their lair. This book has simple charts that allow you to create more than ELEVEN MILLION unique combination of items, know not just WHAT it is, but how it is made, what it depict, why is it unique and has a great value. This book has all!

Short on time? Missing players for an important part of the game? Lacking Preparation? Your Players decide to follow up on a random lead you haven't prepared? This book is for you!
This supplement is completely system agnostic and can be used with any game system.

173511.name: Need of the Many
173511.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sanguine Covenant seeks a minor artifact to protect towns from massive attacks. However, not all is as it seems at Midsanborg Castle, and choices will have to be made. Does the need of the many…?

Access to Classes of NeoExodus: Machinesmith will enhance this adventure.

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5 and 7 (character levels 3-8).

173512.name: Cities of NeoExodus: Gytha
173512.description:
From publisher blurb:

This sourcebook - the first by FOE - was written to support and enhance the experience for the upcoming story arc, "The Battle for Gytha". Material in this book is legal for the NeoExodus Legacies campaign.

In this book, you get: two pieces of fiction; the history of Gytha starting with the days of the First Ones' Empire to the rise of Cazimir the One-Eye; detailed adventure locations both around and in the town itself; five organizations present in town; seven very important NPCs who can be friend or foe to the PCs; character options: three archetypes, a new feat, information on firearms in the Janus Horde, unique items found in Gytha, eight pre-made NPCs from horde cannibals to untrained villeins; and four new monsters to terrorize your players.
This book is bursting with great stuff to enhance your legacy or advance your own game.

173513.name: DI6DENT (Issue 0 - Sep 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Ce que nous savons de Mountain Falls
Inspi: Prince of Persia: les sables oubliés
Le Match: Metal Adventures vs Dark Heresy
Panoroma de la presse roliste Française
Quelque chose de pourri au royaume du Jylland
Y'a pas que le JDR dans la vie: Willy Favre
173513.description:
User summary:

Issue 0. Only available as a Free PDF download.

In this issue:


The match: Metal Adventures vs Dark Heresy
Interview with Willy Favre
Thema: are RPG the black duck of the press - a look back at French RPG periodicals
Module for dK2: "ce que nous savons de Mountain Falls"
Module for Hellywood: "Scoop toujours"
Module for Brain Soda: "Jeudi 12 la préquelle"
Review: Yggdrasill
Module for Yggdrasill: "Quelque chose de pourri au royaume du Jylland"
Inspiration: The movie Prince of Persia: The sands of time.
Players, electrify the table: improve your PC for a better game

173514.description:
This is a fantasy boardgame with true dungeon exploring mechanics. It has dinamically generated dungeons which will be completely different from game to game. In it we are little meeples bound to recover the Sacred Relics of the Meeple Kingdom so it does not fall into Darkness.

Every turn, each player has a choice of actions: moving through the dark dungeons, opening chests, setting traps to hinder their opponents and fighting corageously against hordes of the evil beings that want to banish any sign of goodness.

The game is easy but not simple, and it's loaded with fun and casual illustrations. Its rules and art make it into a good game for players and non-players alike, even for kids. You can even play alone, because single player mechanics for one character are included in the base game.

Its streamlined AI makes fast and pleasant games, lasting between 15 and 20 minutes per player.
173514.name: Meeple Quest
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 73: Tuesday, October 4th

173533.name: Civil War II
173533.description:
Civil War 2 is the definitive grand strategy game of the period. It is a turn based regional game with an emphasis on playability and historical accuracy. It is built on the renowned AGE game engine, with a modern and intuitive interface that makes it easy to learn yet hard to master.

This historical operational strategy game with a simultaneous turn-based engine (WEGO system) that places players at the head of the USA or CSA during the American Civil War (1861-1865).

You take the part of the military and political leadership, trying to lead your nation to victory, in the midst of some of the toughest operations of the Civil War. You will build, organize and command your armies over one of the largest maps of the USA ever made for a Civil War game. There are a host of real military leaders to appoint with their own strengths and weaknesses and choosing the right man for the job is crucial. However you are not just a military leader and must make vital economics and political decisions. These can have far reaching effects and you can even influence foreign intervention from the French & British who were constantly intervening in America for power and prestige.

Source: The Developer Website.

173534.name: Phobos
173534.description:
Materials

25 square tiles that are dark on one side and light on the other
4 Othello disks, two of the disks are marked on their dark and light sides with a red dot at their centers.

Setup

Arrange the 25 tiles, light side up, into a 5x5 grid. Next place the two disks with the red dots light side up on two diagonally opposed corner tiles, do the same for the remaining two disks.

Play

One player plays with the two disks that have the red dots and the other player the two without.

Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn, you must,

1) Move one of your disks one space either diagonally or orthogonally onto an empty tile and then

2) Flip an empty light sided tile that is orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the disk last moved or remove an empty dark sided tile that is orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the disk last moved.
Restrictions

- A light sided disk moves on empty light sided tiles and after a move you must flip an adjacent light sided tile to its dark side.

- A light sided disk may be moved to a dark sided tile by flipping the disk to its dark side and after the move you must remove an adjacent dark sided tile from the board. From this point on the disk is a dark sided disk and cannot be flipped back.

- A dark-sided disk moves only on empty dark sided tiles and after the move you must remove an adjacent dark sided tile from the board.

Object

The player last to move wins.

173535.name: Ridspelet
173535.description: Choose your horse, roll the dice. A race to the finish line.

173536.description:
“2GM Tactics Wargame” (WWII TWG) is a full-fledged strategy card war-game where units are represented by cards and you’ll be in command of your army. You’ll have to build your deck to achieve the goals you’ve been tasked for. Gear up your troops for the battle; deploy all type of units: armor, artillery and transport units; request air support and deceive your enemy. Lead Patton or Rommel to the final victory; seize buildings; destroy your enemy and conquer the battlefield! Play historical scenarios: go ashore in Normandy, defend Monte Cassino or dig in the Ardennes!

You can play 2GM TWG in two ways. You can play a “Battle Royal” - players will establish a number of points, they will set up the battlefield prior commencing the battle and the goal is to destroy your opponent’s Head Quarter; or you can play a “Scenario” – historical or not – with a predefined set of rules to deploy units and the terrain, and pre-established conditions of victory.

In a player’s turn you’ll gain a number of “Action Points” that will be used to deploy new units on the battlefield and to employ other supporting cards. These Action Points will increase by several ways as the game evolves.

“Objectives” to achieve the victory during a game are very diverse: from destroying your opponent’s HQ to capture the battlefield or inflict a specific number of kills to your enemy. Seizing or bombing a building, capturing enemy’s supplies, rescue a flag objective or hold a position for a number of turns are other ways to achieve the victory.

The game includes three different decks: one for the American Army, one for the German Army and a third double-sided deck to represent different types of Terrain.

Each side’s deck is composed by cards representing unique types of units and supporting cards. Different types of units - infantry, vehicle, armor, aircraft and transport -, all with their own specific capabilities and with additional equipment to be deployed.

Supporting cards are assorted: you may find “Equipment”, “Promotion”, “Mines”, and “Diversion”, among others.

Terrain deck includes anything that is needed to make every single battle a unique experience.

Additionally, you´ll find Help and Summary cards along with Flag Generals that will improve your army with their command abilities; 2d10 and more than 100 counters (damage counters, victory points, etc.) and additional equipment to gear up our units depending on the situation.

From the Draco Ideas web site:

2GM Tactics Wargame es un completo juego de cartas de estrategia, tipo juego de guerra, en el que las cartas representan unidades y en el que nos pondremos al mando de nuestro ejército.
Construye tu propio mazo para conseguir los objetivos asignados. Equipa a tus tropas para la batalla. Despliega Tanques, Artillería y Transportes. Solicita apoyo aéreo. Confunde a tu enemigo. Dirige a Patton o Rommel hasta alcanzar la victoria, toma edificios, destruye a tu enemigo, y conquista el campo de batalla.
Juega escenarios históricos, desembarca en Normandía, defiende Montecassino, atrinchérate en las Ardenas.

A 2GM TWG se puede jugar de dos maneras. Se puede jugar una Batalla Campal a un determinado número de puntos establecido por los jugadores, quienes colocarán terreno en el campo de batalla antes del inicio de la contienda y donde el objetivo será destruir el Estado Mayor enemigo; o se puede jugar un Escenario o Escenario Histórico con reglas de despliegue de tropas, terreno y condiciones de victoria preestablecidos.

En su turno de juego cada jugador, ganará un determinado número de Puntos de Acción que servirán para desplegar unidades sobre el terreno y utilizar diferentes cartas de apoyo.
Estos puntos se verán incrementados por distintos medios a medida que se desarrolle la partida.
Los Objetivos para conseguir la victoria en las batallas son muy variados. Desde destruir el Estado Mayor del enemigo, a tomar el campo de batalla, causar un determinado número de bajas al enemigo, destruir un edificio colocando una bomba o tomarlo, acabar con un objetivo determinado, robar suministros al enemigo, rescatar un objetivo importante, o mantener una posición un determinado número de turnos.

El juego incluye tres tipos distintos de mazos.
Un mazo de cartas perteneciente al ejército Americano, otro mazo perteneciente a los Alemanes; y un tercer mazo de cartas de Terreno a doble cara.
Cada mazo de ejército está compuesto por cartas de unidades y cartas de apoyo. Cuenta con distintas unidades de Infantería, Tanques, Artillería, Aviones y vehículos de Transporte; cada uno de ellos con distinto equipo adicional con el que desplegarse y diferentes capacidades especiales.


Las cartas de apoyo son muy variadas. Distinguiendo entre cartas de suministros, de equipo, cartas de Promoción, minas, mejoras para el impacto, cartas de distracción y anulación de órdenes,…
El tercer mazo de Terreno incluye todo lo necesario para hacer cada batalla única.
Además, se aporta al juego cartas de resumen y ayuda. Distintos generales que mejorarán nuestro ejército, dos dados de diez caras y más de 100 fichas de juego, entre contadores de heridas, puntos de acción y diferente equipo adicional con el que equipar a nuestras tropas según nuestras necesidades.
173536.name: 2GM Tactics

173537.name: Fliegende Zeilen
173537.description:
In Fliegende Zeilen, players have to create new texts (e.g. a poem or commercial slogan), based on lines from famous poetry.

First, the type of text is picked, than the quote for inspiration is determined randomly. In a limited timeframe, players compete to produce the wittiest text, awarding points to the creations of the others. Highest total wins.

173538.name: 30 * 30 Fantasy
173538.description:
designer summary

This is a collection of 30 tables applicable in a fantasy game with 30 entries each table.

173539.name: Crystal Kingdom Dizzy
173539.description:
Crystal Kingdom Dizzy is an adventure video game featuring the character Dizzy released in December 1992 by Codemasters. The Oliver Twins—who were heavily involved in the design and programming of previous Dizzy games—had less involvement with this one.

The game is the last title to date in the core Dizzy series.

At £9.99, this was the first full-price Dizzy game released for home computers; previous games had been released at budget prices (£2-3). This elicited some criticism, as despite the much higher tag, the game was no bigger or more complex than its much lower-priced predecessors.

The Spectrum version of the game knocked Rainbow Islands from the top of the UK sales chart, and prevented Street Fighter II from being number one. This version was voted number 70 in the Your Sinclair Readers Top 100 Games of All Time.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crystal Kingdom Dizzy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

173541.name: PlayStation TV
173541.description:
PlayStation TV (abbreviated to PS TV), known in Japan and other parts of Asia as the PlayStation Vita TV or PS Vita TV, is a microconsole, and a non-handheld variant of the PlayStation Vita handheld game console.

Instead of featuring a display screen, the console connects to a television via HDMI. Users can play using a DualShock 3 or DualShock 4 controller, although due to the difference in features between the controller and the handheld, certain games are not compatible with PS Vita TV, such as those that are dependent on the system's microphone, camera, or gyroscopic features.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation TV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

173543.name: Tomb Raider: The Prophecy
173543.description:
Tomb Raider: The Prophecy is an action-adventure video game released in November 2002 for the Game Boy Advance, part of the Tomb Raider franchise. It was developed by Core Design and Ubisoft Milan, and published jointly by Eidos Interactive and Ubisoft.

The game is based around an ancient prophecy written in the Tome of Ezekiel, which tells of three magical stones, used by various powerful rulers around the world. Lara must find these stones before a cult known as the Teg-du-Bhorez can collect them all and use them to revive a mystical being known as the Great Grey One, thus bringing about the end of the world. Throughout the game Lara searches for the stones and thinks that she has found them. However, she realises that she was mistaken and has to come back to defeat the game's villain.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tomb Raider: The Prophecy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

rpgissuearticle: Aide de Jeu Whog Shrog: Renegats
Un Jour Viendra Où Les Schtroumpfs Seront Les Maîtres Du Monde

Magic weapons for In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas
The history of Sartar by Greg Stafford (RuneQuest)

173547.description:

This Quick Start Guide includes:

● Character creation.
● Magic and Technology system known as Talents.

● … and more!

Play in your setting, grab one of ours, or use the included adventure to start a dark fantasy campaign and experience the flexibility of the Entropic Gaming System that allows the game’s
mechanics to conform to your character concept!

Heavy Metal, Croc's new game
Mors Ultima Ratio, Demonix Remix: the new expansions for In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas
Cyberkampft for Berlin XVIII

173549.name: Letter Chess
173549.description:
Letter Chess is a solitaire word game that combines Word Search and Chess. Players move letters like Chess pieces to string together words that connect horizontally, vertically and diagonally on a 7-by-9 grid. To score big assemble long words and make sure you have a end of game strategy to clear the board.

Setup: 48 Letter tiles are randomized on a 7-by-9 grid. At the start of the game there are 15 empty squares near the center of the board. The center horizontal row is always empty. Bordering the center row, two rows are made up of four empty squares and three letter squares (like a parapet which is the alternate name). Use any word game you may own to play the game.

Game Mechanics: The main object of the game is to assemble words on the grid. Eligible words must have letters connected on the board horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. Acceptable words must be at least three letters long. Words cannot be played more than once per game and proper nouns are not allowed. Individual letter tiles cannot be used twice in the same word (such as “o” twice to spell book or “d” to spell dad).

During a single turn, a player can move multiple letters together to construct words. All letters moved during a turn must be used to construct a word that round. Consonants can move any number of squares horizontally, vertically or diagonally (like a Queen in Chess) to an empty square. When moved, however, consonants cannot jump over other letters. Vowels can move two squares horizontally and one square vertically, or two squares vertically and one square horizontally (like a Knight in Chess) to an empty square. Unlike consonants, vowels can jump over other letters. After a word is constructed those letter tiles are removed from the board and play continues. The game ends when all letters have been used or no more plays are left. Lastly, the letter “Y” moves as a consonant even if used as a vowel.

Scoring: Letter Chess uses simple formulas to tally a score at the end of the game. So when playing keep a pencil and paper nearby. Vowels count as 2 points and Consonants count as 1 point. The letter “Y” counts as one point even if used as a vowel. A word is tallied by multiplying the letter score by the letter count. For example, “murals” has a tally of forty because there is a letter score of eight (two vowels and four consonants) and a letter count of five (8x5=40). There is a bonus score when all the letters are cleared from the board. The bonus is calculated by multiplying the number of rounds by 10 and subtracting that amount from 200 (arbitrary number). For example, a whole board was cleared in twelve rounds then 200-(12X10)= 80 points. When letters remain on the board with no more moves left those letters are tallied as a word and subtracted from the score. For example if the letters “I, X and O” remain on the board. The letter score is 5 and letter count is 3 which equals 15 minus points.

At most there are 16 rounds per game assuming all words are 3-letters long. In Letter Chess, a high score is in the 400’s and a low score is around 200.

173550.name: Adventure Time: Card Wars
173550.description:
Floop the Pig! It’s Adventure Time CARD WARS!

Play the game inspired by the Adventure Time episode, “Card Wars”! Summon creatures and cast spells to battle your way to victory.

Source: The Developer Website.

173551.name: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (4th Edition)
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (4th Edition)
173551.description:
user summary

RPG entry of the core book.

The core books is separated in three sections (100, 130 and 98 pages).
The fist section is the "In Nomine Satanis" background where players learn the evil side of the game with demons background.
The second section describes the core rules common to both sides.
The third section is accessible by reverting the book upside down and starting to read the last page as it was the first page. This section describes the "Magna Veritas" side with background on angels and good side.

173552.name: Plasma (Issue 4 - Mar 1991)
rpgissuearticle: Aides de Jeu JRTM et Rolemaster
Nous irons, nous verrons, et nous vous en parlerons
Y'a moins bien mais c'est plus cher
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
173552.description:
(translated) from the cover:


The anti RPG integrist comic.
Aventures: Heavy Metal, Car Wars, Berlin XVIII, In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas
Players aids: Whog Shrog, Rolemaster, MERP

173553.name: Customer Clues
173553.description:
Customer Clues is a re-theme of Clue distributed to U.S. Bank Employees as a training tool. It plays nearly the same as Clue, but adds a deck of Mystery Product Cards. These cards have questions about bank products, sales techniques, etc. that must be answered when players land on certain marked spaces on the board.

Like Clue, players move from room to room making guesses as to the cards in the mystery envelope, but in this rethemed version they move around a bank branch, and must deduce which product was sold to which customer in which room. As mentioned above, as players move around the board, they may land on spaces which will force them to answer questions about bank accounts, policies and procedures.

173554.name: MUJO
173554.description:
“MUJO” is a puzzle game based around the gods of Greek myths. Players seek tiles of the same color, racing to build a bigger and bigger collection. The bigger your collection the more threats to your tiles appear, making you decide to use your collection or risk increasing it further… The rules are simple, but the game keeps you guessing and gives you much to enjoy. The unique and beautiful graphics are also a key feature. The Android version of this game is currently in development.

Source: The Publisher Website.

173555.name: 1944: Battle of the Bulge
173555.description:
User Summary

Worthy successor of Desert Rats vs. Afrika Korps and D-Day, this third title of Monte Cristo's WWII RTS series presents the last winter of war in the European theatre from opposing perspectives across 20 new missions and 10 multiplayer maps. The level maps have been designed with historical accuracy, developing them from authentic strategic maps, geographic information and images from the battles themselves. 1944: Battle of the Bulge also introduces 15 new units (Nebelwerfer, Sdkfz 251, Jagdpanther, Jagdtiger, Sturmtiger, Hummel, Sherman 105mm, Calliope, Me262, P47 Thunderbolt and many others.
3 different Campaign games and authentic winter athmosphere.

173556.name: Spelligator
173556.description:
Description from the Box:
Be the best at word building! Stack your Spelligator with as many words as you can to win! Challenge your friends to see who can build the highest stack of words!


Spelligator is a children's game designed to teach simple vocabulary, spelling and phonics. Each player has a plastic "Spelligator" with three shaped spaces on its back. Players then take turns turning over letter tiles, each of which can fit only in the beginning, middle or end space. Each tile is printed with either a single letter, a blend or a digraph. If the player can add the tile to his or her Spelligator's back to make a new word, it is added. If not, the tile is turned back face down. When all the tiles are used or no more words can be made, the player with the highest stack on his or her Spelligator's back wins.

173557.name: Find the Rhyme
173557.description: Find the Rhyme is an educational matching game for young children, designed to teach the concept of rhyme. The game consists of 20 pairs of rhyming picture cards, each of which is cut like a puzzle piece on one edge, so that each card only fits with its designated pair, and when fit together will form a rhyming phrase (e.g. "a dragon in a wagon"). Anywhere from six to twenty left-side cards are laid out in a line. Each player takes a turn choosing a right-side card and trying to match it with one left-side card to make a rhyme. If the match is correct, the player keeps the pair. If not, the tile is returned. Play continues until all pairs are matched and the player with the most pairs wins.

boardgamecompilation: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small – Even More Buildings Big and Small
Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small – More Buildings Big and Small
173558.description: A collection of two expansions for Agricola: Chłopi i ich zwierzyniec released in one box - More Buildings Big and Small and Even More Buildings Big and Small. These cannot be bought separately in a Polish translation.
173558.name: Agricola: Chłopi i ich zwierzyniec – Jeszcze więcej budynków do zwierzyńca
boardgameexpansion: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small

173559.name: Mouse-O-Mania
173559.description: Mouse-O-Mania is a roll-and-move game included as a pull-out insert in the children's book "Geronimo Stilton: A Christmas Tale." Players must roll dice and move along a track, trying to get Geronimo Stilton to his Christmas party. Along the way, players land on spaces referring to events in the book. These spaces may move them forward or back or cause them to gain or lose turns. The first player to get Geronimo Stilton to his Christmas party by landing on the end of the track by an exact roll wins.

173560.name: Lemonade Stand Board Game
173560.description:
Build a lemonade stand and let it flourish or flounder with Lemonade Stand Board Game. 2 to 6 players can learn the basics of business by caring for their own virtual lemonade stand. Kids can purchase their own ingredients, set their own prices, and choose a location for their business. As they move across the board, they'll face challenges like weather, advertising, and customer experience. A fun game for the whole family. Includes instructions, dice, cards, and boards. Ages 7 and up.

All players begin the game by building their virtual Lemonade Stand and buying ingredients to make lemonade to sell
As players move around the board they learn about the many factors in running a business
Learning that it's all about location, advertising, weather, selling price & customer experience
Fun for kids and parents

173561.name: The Kenya Safari Game
boardgamepublisher: The East African Wild Life Society
173561.description:
The Kenya Safari Game is a roll-and-move game that simulates a traveler exploring the sights and tourist attractions of Kenya. Players start from a pre-chosen base in the capital city of Nairobi. They draw a variety of different-colored cards, each of which represents a different type of site or tourist attraction they must visit or an animal they must photograph on safari. They then roll two dice each turn to move around the board by a roads, trails, trains and airplanes to visit the required locations. The first player to complete all their photography assignments and see all their designated sights returns to his or her Nairobi base and is declared the winner. Special rules allow players to take flights or extra turns when rolling doubles.

Although this is primarily a roll and move game an element of strategy is introduced by the fact that players must visit a variety of sites in a variety of areas and may travel by various routes. Players who plan the most efficient routes from place to place may gain an advantage.

173562.name: Kruisslag
173562.description:
The goal is to be the first player to get all his ten stones to the opposite side of the board. One player moves his stones from to left to right, the other from bottom to top.

Two dice are thrown and the sum of both may be used for one dice or the separate numbers for two. When you end your move on top of your opponent's stone, that stone is moved back to its starting position.

173563.description:
Uprising is a game for two players that depicts, in a very abstract way, the growth and development (or containment and suffocation) of a popular movement in revolt against an oppressive government. The Rebel player, who starts the game with little apparent power but a great deal of information, is in conflict with the Government player, who has power (with his assortment of Agents) but very little information on the Rebel’s resources and capabilities.

The pieces represent small groups (Insurgents and Agents), support organizations (Sympathizers), and nonexistent things or misleading information (Dummies).

The map (a field of 91 hexes) is perhaps the most abstracted part of the design, in that it does not represent physical distance, but something more like organizational proximity. With the Rebel pieces starting on the outer perimeter, and the Agents starting in a tight group around the Nexus, it can be displayed how far the revolt must go and how much larger it must grow in order to challenge the government for ultimate power. However, being out in the margins allows time to organize and gather strength....
173563.name: Uprising

173564.description:
This game depicts, in a very abstract way, the essence of insurgent warfare. The game is for two players, the State (representing the existing government or leadership of a country or organization) and the Insurgent (representing the opposition to that government or leadership). The State has powerful forces but little information; the Insurgent has complete information but little actual power. Whichever side overcomes its disadvantage wins (the State by gaining information on the Insurgents and killing them; the Insurgents by penetrating to the centre of State power).

The Insurgent wins by capturing the Capital. This is accomplished by having, at the end of any his player-turns, Insurgent pieces occupying either four connected spaces in the Inner Circle (that is, there are at least four Insurgent-occupied spaces in the Inner Circle that also share a border with one or two other Insurgent-occupied spaces in the Inner Circle), or occupying any six of the twelve spaces of the Inner Circle.

The State player wins by killing 12 Insurgent pieces (so making an Insurgent victory impossible).

Originally designed in 2011 for an online game site, from an idea by Michael Freeman.
173564.name: Army of Shadows

173566.description:
From the publisher:

The north wind blows in from the rugged domains north of Conan's homeland. With Asgard to the east and Vanaheim to the west, these two territories compose the frozen tundra that is Nordheim. The men of these lands are toughest of the tough, hardened by cold and battle. Blood spilling across the pristine snow as different tribes fight for supremacy.

Despite the uneasy relationship between the Cimmerians and the Aesirs, Conan earns their respect through strength of arms and embarks on more than one adventure across these glistening lands.

Join Conan and his companions as they cross swords with the Vanirs, pursue the Frost-Giant's daughter, do battle with a necromancer defiling the burial grounds of wars past and more in the Third expansion for Conan.

Featuring scenarios written by Croc, author of Claustrophobia and many roleplaying games, and his son Sippik!

This set contains:


Niord, Aesir Hero
5 Aesir warrior allies
10 Vanir warrior Minions
Atali, the daughter of Ymir, the frost-giant, Leader
Atali's Brothers, 2 frost giant monsters
5 Monstrous Crow minions
1 double sided game board (Frozen battlefield and deep winter forest)
4 scenarios written by Croc and Sippik
Token, tiles and Character sheets.
173566.name: Conan: Nordheim Expansion

173567.name: 9'ers
173567.description: A variation of Fan Tan. 54 cards; 1-9 in 5 colours / 3 'joker cards' / 6 'give or take 2 cards'. On a turn, a player either plays a card or draws a card. Played cards are placed on the table next to previously placed cards. The new card has to be of an immediately higher or lower value and of the same suit, or it has to be of the same value and from another suit. Players can only play 1 card per turn. A joker card can be played at any time and at any place while a 'give or take 2 card' (used to have another player take 1 or 2 extra cards or to remove 1 or 2 cards from the table) can be played at any time except as a player's last card. When a 'give or take 2 card' is played it goes back into the stack of cards and the stack is shuffled again. The first player to have no card left wins.

173568.name: LOOK
173568.description: Players can learn and test spatial perception. A map is seen from above. Players play simultaneously. A 'view card' is shown and all players no try to determine as quickly as possible from which area of the map this 'view card' could be seen from. The first player to grab the pawn and place it on a spot can check the back of the 'view card' to see if it was correct. If the player was right he/she can keep the 'view card'. The player with the most 'view cards' after all 48 cards have been collected wins.

173569.name: Casus Belli (Issue 42 - Dec 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Les Provinces du Lac des Hautes Eaux
173569.description:
(translated) from the cover:


Laelith: the High Lake provinces
Profession: Guardian of the arcana
Family portrait: Série Europa

173570.name: Plasma (Issue 5 - May 1991)
rpgissuearticle: Aide de Jeu: les prégénériques en 9 questions
Nous sommes venus, nous avons vu, ça nous a plu
Thérèse a le feu au cul
With a little help from my friends
Y'a moins bien mais c'est plus cher
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
173570.description:
(translated) from the cover:

A very hot issue


Heavy Metal
Car Wars
Berlin XVIII
In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas
Whog Shrog
Zone

173571.name: Plasma (Issue 6 - Jul 1991)
rpgissuearticle: Mon beau navire, ô ma mémoire
Nous sommes venus, nous avons vu, ça nous a plu
Y'a moins bien, mais c'est plus cher
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
173571.description:
(translated) from the cover:


Heavy Metal
Car Wars
In Nomine Satanis
Magna Veritas



And the integrist anti-rock comic.

173572.name: TacDex: Super Mario
173572.description:
From the box: Players duel to the finish while the Battle Marker determines if high or low card wins each battle. Special Action Cards add new challenges to game play so that no two games are ever the same!

TacDex: Super Mario uses gameplay similar to well-known card game War, with players revealing cards simultaneously to try to claim cards owned by the opponent, but a battle marker determines whether a high or low card wins a particular battle and players each have special action cards to add new twists to the conflict.

173574.description: 1836jr is a mini 18xx game based on either 1830: Railways & Robber Barons or 1856 (and requiring components from 1830 or 1856) set in the Netherlands and Belgium.
173574.name: 1836jr

173575.name: The World of Jessie Shimmer
173575.description:
From the Introduction:

In Spellbent, Shotgun Sorceress, Switchblade Goddess, and Devils' Field, author Lucy A. Snyder presents the perilous adventures of witch-in-training Jessie Shimmer, who travels to hell and back to rescue her lover and mentor, Cooper Marron - while facing demons and vengeful deities alike.

173576.name: The Low Templar
173576.description:
From publisher blurb:

A warrior may become so skilled at maintaining his or her own private agenda, while at the same time serving the institutions of the state that they become low Templars. Under a sanctified veneer, they walk a wavering line between heroism and thuggery. It is only the hand of destiny that decides on which side they shall fall.

Prestige Class: Low Templar.
Build Classes: Fighter, Ranger, Rogue.

Role: A low templar is an opportunist able to adapt to changing situations. A mix of skirmisher and front-line fighter, he can hold the line or maneuver to ambush or retreat. Outside of combat, he can be a diplomatic courtier or a slinky scoundrel.

173577.name: Green Gargoyle
173577.description:
From publisher blurb:

Villainous takes hostile forces from Zenith Comics and pushes them straight toward your gaming table. In this issue, The Green Gargoyle stands watch, ready to do away with any whom he deems a threat. Is this monster lashing out at anyone who crosses his path or is there something more to the story?

173578.name: The Witch Hunter II (New Hybrid Class)
173578.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new hybrid character class, the Witch Hunter II. The Witch Hunter II combines the abilities of the inquisitor and ranger to hunt down and eradicate those that use the dark arts for their own evil ends.

173579.name: Gunslinger Feats
173579.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gunslinger Feats brings you 12 mythic feats for your favorite gun-toting gadabout, gritting their way through the toughest situations and ready for a showdown. These feats are ideal for gunslingers like Deft Shootist and Signature Deed, but many are also suitable for any ranged combatant from Amateur Gunslinger to Greater Snap Shot!

173580.name: "D" is for "Demons"
173580.description:
From publisher blurb:

Infernal Power!

This entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at demons, devils, and infernal powers, including:

Demonic dimensions
Demonic cults
Demonic qualities
Five demon archetypes
Demon summoning
The Hellfire Control power

173581.name: Temple of the Black Oracle
173581.description:
Designer's Summary:

Temple of the Black Oracle is a low-level adventure. With a little tweaking it could even be a 0-level adventure. The locals having been noticing chickens and livestock missing or being drained of blood. Chowder, a local nuisance, was chasing some of the children away by the old Cursed Cave.

Chowder, a mage by trade, fancies himself a priest. He's chosen to worship a black pudding that he has formed a relationship. He offers it blood from the animals and it seems to respond to the offerings. Together they form a horrifying sight. A thing of nightmares.

It is up to the party to rid the area of this escalating threat. This could be the first step in a long adventuring career. Or the last.

From the Background:

The local region is missing many chickens. In recent weeks, cattle have been found drained of blood. And a group of children said they were chased by old man Chowder. Chowder has been problematic in the past. He's not been seen for a season. Some say he's worshiping the Black Oracle in the Cursed Cave.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

173582.name: TENZI
173582.description:
User Summary

Race against the clock and try to roll all 10 dice of same number. Just like the dice game TENZI. With 3 different ways to play, the fun never ends. Challenge your friends and see who can get the fastest time!

173583.name: Liber Influxus Communis
173583.description:
From publisher blurb:

LIBER INFLUXUS COMMUNIS: the Book of Collective Influence

Adapt. Overcome. Survive! The Book of Collective Influence brings 14 Pathfinder classes.

Breathe new life into to your game with material from the twisted minds of game designers of the some of the top third party publishers.
Adapt them to your game. Overcome all obstacles. Survive against anything your GM throws at you!

Battle Lord: Marshal the field of battle by conduction drills to your allies.
Conduit: Absorb magic and blast your enemies.
Demiurge: The enlightened scholar that pulls ideals from the Perfect World to create facsimiles.
Medium: Act as a host for a spirit companion.
Metamorph: Evolve into the perfect species.
Mnemonic: Monks that modify the memory of their aggressors, causing them to second guess.
Momenta: A minor jack of all trades that plays the sidekick and motivates his allies from the sidelines.
Mystic: Bend the elements with martial prowess and direct them at your enemies.
Pauper: Carry the weight of world on your shoulders and use it to penalize your foes.
Survivor: Cut from the rawness of life experience and muscle through the worst of situations.
Synergist: The success of your allies cycles through you, as you empower your allies.
Umbra: Born from the heritage granted by the planes, you take control of your bloodline.
Warloghe: Their heretic practices bonds these spellcasters with twisted spirits.
FEATS! New feats available to all classes. Featuring new teamwork and style feats
15+ pages full of archetypes & character options
Haunts, Hazards, Magical Pollution - OH MY!
Contains templates: magically breed Arcbrood and magical touched Arcane-Infused
Spelltouched FEATS!




This 182 page PDF book includes feats and archetypes to be worked into your Pathfinder games.

Adapt. Overcome. Survive.

173584.name: The Mad Cynic
rpg: Spooks! Welcome to the Great Beyond
173584.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mad Cynic has struck! A lifetime of repressed cynicisms will turn anyone insane and for Riley Hebst, he has finally reached his breaking point. An errand brings the player characters to the Great Library of Necropolis but their quest gets hijacked by a lunatic. The library is put on the defensive and refuses to let anyone leave until the situation is dealt with.

The Mad Cynic is a sample adventure for the tabletop role-playing game, Spooks! Welcome to the Great Beyond. The adventure is FREE to download. Feel free to donate funds which will be used to add artwork to the adventure including a full-color cover.

173585.name: Farmers Market
173585.description:
Plant. Grow. Harvest. Sell. Farmers Market is a game themed around supplying customers with what they desire at the local farmers market. During the game, players will plant corn, wheat grain, potatoes seeds, wait for them to grow so they can harvest them. Milk can be drawn from Cows, and the rare chicken can also be found annoying the players if they don't supply a customer who needs one or build a coop. After the goods are ready, they can be transported to the River Street Farmers Market for consumption.

Other options in the game include advancing the technology to get a greater harvest, adding Chickens to a Coop, planting long-growing watermelons (the hit of the day), and attending State Fairs, entering your vegetables into the largest such and such competition (in theme only).

Deck manipulation is the main mechanism in farmers market. Players each have their own deck of staple cards. Unlike a normal deck builder, during the game, only a few cards will be added to their deck (plant), and most that have been added will also be removed the next time it shows up (growth-to-harvest). More of a Deck Freeloader system or cards "just passing through" the Deck.

173586.name: Dead Living Magazine (Issue #1 - 2015)
rpg: Spooks! Welcome to the Great Beyond
173586.description:
From publisher blurb:

Congratulations, your dead - still - and the afterlife is just getting more and more interesting. Dead Living Magazine, Issue 1 follows one of literatures most well-known horror writers - Edgar Allan Poe. Inside you'll find new NPCs such as Virginia Clemm Poe, The Valravn Kiara and the angel Abyness; new equipment and magic Items inspired from Poe's works such as the Gold Bug, the Brick of Amontillado, the Ebony Clock, the Mask of the Red Death and the Pendulumn of the Pit; and denizens such as ghasts, ice angel, plague imps and valrans.

The Masque of the Red Death storyarc introduces the Red Death and his plans for both Edgar and Virginia Poe as he manuevers to snuff the Hereafter into darkness. Can the valravn Kiara protect them from the grip of entropy? You tell us...

This is one of several short magazines to help introduce additional content to your games and eventually showcase fan-made material.

Dead Living Magazine, Issue 1, is a must have for the Poe enthusiast.

173587.description:
Escape: Zombie City – Expansion 1 – The Survivor Chronicles is the first expansion for Escape: Zombie City, and it adds two unique modules that you can use separately or together to bring your games in entirely new directions.

The first module in this expansion adds new challenge tiles to the city. Before you can escape, you’ll need to solve whatever challenges you encounter within the city. You may need to confront a large horde of zombies, escort your elderly grandfather from the retirement home to the safety of the church, or even clear a barricade blocking your path.
Alternatively, you may add unique characters to the game with the second module included in The Survivor Chronicles. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a character, ranging from the grandma to the policeman. Each character has two unique powers, and you choose one of these powers to use throughout the game, giving you a special edge in your fight against the undead.

Module 1: Tasks
Complete the task before escaping the city

rock concert: defeat a zombie horde
retirement home: escort grandpa to the church
barricade: clear the road
workshop: drive the van to the workshop and fix it
the pit: consume the energy drink and the pill bottle and fix the hole in the road
circus: all players visit the circus and draw a card




Module 2: Characters
Each of the 6 characters gives you a special ability that you can use as often as possible.

the tough policeman
the clever nerd
the fearless grandma
the shopping queen
the vendor
the construction worker




The Survivor Chronicles contains:
Rules
Six challenge tiles
Seven characters with bases
Four challenge tokens
Twelve Character cards
173587.name: Escape: Zombie City – Expansion 1 – The Survivor Chronicles

173588.name: The Enchanted Isle
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
173588.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: The Enchanted Isle

The Enchanted Isle has been the site of bloody battles for as long as anyone remembers. The humans are the newest race to claim dominion over the land and they have many powerful heroes among them, each carrying mighty relics or arcane implements. When your players visit the Isle, watch out for these Wild Cards!

173589.name: Monsters of the Isle
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
173589.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Monsters of the Isle

The Enchanted Isle has a long history of non-human inhabitants. Monstrous beings from Giants to Fomorians have called the island home—and still do. Kings and wizards, queens and witches—your players are bound to encounter these 17 characters when they visit the Enchanted Isle.

173590.name: Village of the Isle
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
173590.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Village of the Isle

Living on an isle that has been wracked by war, the villagers of this town just look to get on with their lives. But under the toil of the day-to-day routine are secrets and dangers that few know about.

173591.name: Viper Grav Bike
173591.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is the Viper, a small Grav Bike, in three variations.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as illustrations.

173592.name: Barbarians of Lemuria: Mythic Edition
173592.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Second Age of Man is a savage time of sorcery and bloodshed, where strong men and beautiful women battle with warlords, priests, magicians and gladiators to carve a boody path to the Throne of Lemuria...

Barbarians of Lemuria is a heroic role-playing game set firmly in the sword-and-sorcery genre. Lemuria is a post-apocalyptic world thousands of years in the future and unrecognisable to anyone from today. The continent has returned to an almost prehistoric state – a land of steaming jungles, vast untamed wildernesses, horror-filled swamplands, and sunbaked deserts. Massive man-eating beasts roam the unexplored regions of Lemuria and beyond, from island-sized sea serpents capable of sinking wargalleys, to the huge jungle-dwelling dinosaurs that can swallow a man whole.

173593.name: Guide to Rocket Rangers (Ubiquity)
173593.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strap on your rocket-pack, grab your guns, and take to the sky to help defeat the vile Nazi horde! Set a few years ahead in the Hollow Earth Expedition timeline, this supplement presents a fictional military unit that lets your heroes blast around the skies in the fashion of The Rocketeer.

Contains details on and stats for the elite US Rocket Rangers, their SS counterparts, and two new weird science weapons, plus adventure seeds and full rules for using rocket-packs in your Ubiquity games.

173594.name: Ori and the Blind Forest
videogameexpansion: Ori and The Blind Forest: Definitive Edition
videogamehonor: 2014 Game Critics Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Gamescom Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Gamescom Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
2015 CVA Best International Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Platformer Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best PC Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Video Game Visuals/Artwork Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best XBox One Game Nominee
2015 Golden Joystick Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
2015 Golden Joystick Xbox Game of the Year Winner
2015 The Game Awards Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2015 The Game Awards Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Score/Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Debut Game of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Winner
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Winner
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Sound Design of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Emotional Games Best Artistic Game Nominee
2016 Emotional Games Best Soundtrack Nominee
2016 Emotional Games Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Winner
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Winner
2016 SXSW Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Artistic Style of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
videogamecompilation: Ori and The Blind Forest: Definitive Edition
173594.description:
The player controls Ori, a white guardian spirit. Long ago, Ori fell into the forest and was adopted by a bear-like creature who raises Ori as its child. A malevolent entity, Kuro, appears and takes Ori's mother from him, forcing Ori to explore the forest on his own. Initially, Ori is very weak and can only jump about. During the game, Ori meets Sein /saɪn/, who will both guide Ori on his adventure and attack enemies. As the player gains experience, they may choose new abilities for Ori and Sein, allowing Ori to explore more of the game world.

In addition to save points scattered in the game, players can create "soul links" at any time they choose to serve as checkpoints. However, soul links can only be created using special resources collected during gameplay; the needed resources are not in abundant supply, forcing players to create them only when necessary.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ori and the Blind Forest", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

173596.name: Casus Belli (Special Issue 5 - 1992)
rpgissuearticle: Il était une ou deux fois...
173596.description:
(translated) from the cover:

Mega III a complete role playing game of the special agents in parallel universes.

Includes the new version of the rules, detailed background on the Galactic Assembly and the GM screen.

User summary

With the exception of the adventures, this content is also part of Mega III, le jeu de rôle des messagers galactiques.

173598.name: Bible Master
173598.description:
If you are not familiar with the Bible Master card game, it is an easy to learn card game designed to challenge your knowledge of Scripture.

Players win verse cards by filling in the blanks with word cards like the ones below. Action cards keep the game challenging with wild cards, skips and more! The winner is the player with the most verse cards at the end of the game.

Our first version “Salvation” includes Bible verses focused on the Gospel. As your family plays, you are reinforcing Scripture memory in a fun yet challenging way.

There are 12 verse cards, 14 action cards and 28 word cards in the 54 card deck.

Why the Salvation theme?

1 Peter 3:15 says, "But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:"

Through testing the game play I learned that there are some Christians who have been Christians for years that don't know some of the foundational scriptures used in this game.

My goal is to help players of all ages be ready to share the hope of the Gospel by helping them memorize scriptures that will allow them to share their faith with confidence.

The initial production run will be in the King James version. Though others may be available in the future.

173599.name: The Most Princess in the World
173599.description:
User summary:

The players are all princesses wanting to become the most princess princess in the world. They must collect accessories, dresses and education so that they will gain fame from being rescued by heroes when the demon lords attack. They also need to watch out for weight-gaining food and tea parties, and be careful not to nag too much.

The game centers around making "negative" bids for the available cards for the current round. Players bet "nagging points" to gain the card they want; however these nagging points are negative VP.

When someone gains a demon lord card, all players are captured and the game is interrupted by a hero rescue auction, in which the players bid for what hero to be rescued by. Depending on the hero and the player's stats, players will gain fame by being rescued. When three demon lords have been defeated, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

173600.name: Channeling
173600.description:
Channeling is a game of tactical spellcasting. Each match represents a battle between channeling wizards - be it a schoolyard quarrel at the academy, the real stakes struggle of a magical war or a grand clash on the very edges of reality.

The players draw cards from a shared deck of spells, but each sorcery cast and summoned magical entity becomes unique combination between its original form and the channeling abilities of the caster.

There are different modes of play - in the most basic one that's recommended for learning, each player may cast trough the four basic elemental channels (Flame, Rock, Frost and Lightning) before dabbling in asymmetrical duels where the same elements are randomly drawn and duels utilizing advanced channels and player powers.

173604.description: Heroes of Normandie: Gazette #1 is the first issue of a quarterly gazette that contains new scenarios, rules, and punchboards with new units, surprises, and other items. Gazette #1 has four pages of text with special rules for mines and minesweeping items and two "Explosives" scenarios as well as one "Mines and Minesweepers" punchboard that features four cannons (1 GE, 2 US, 1 UK).
173604.name: Heroes of Normandie: Gazette #1

173605.name: Vowel Bingo
173605.description:
From the instructions:
"Vowel Bingo is a fun-filled way to strengthen and reinforce vowel skills. Each playing card contains eight labeled illustrations of objects having long or short vowel sounds in their names. The purpose of game play is to match each object's game with its correct vowel."

Vowel Bingo is similar to standard bingo, but in order to place their markers, players must know and match short and long vowel sounds. Each player has a card with as series of pictures labeled with the corresponding words. The caller calls out a vowel sound--long a, for example--and players must search their card for a word/picture with a long a in the word. When a player has a complete row, their card is checked by the caller to make sure the vowels are identified correctly. If so, the player wins. If not, play continues until someone has a correct row.

173606.name: Forge of the Giant God
173606.description:
From the publisher:

"In search of powerful weapons to wield against the Storm Tyrant, the adventurers follow a map found in the lair of the hill giant Grenseldek, which leads them to the tomb of legendary giantslayer Nargrym Steelhand. Armed with these weapons of legend, the adventurers then head into the treacherous Mindspin Mountains in search of the valley where the Storm Tyrant is recruiting giants for his army. The heroes must sneak past the legions of giants inhabiting the winding valley before making their way to the horde’s headquarters—an ancient temple dedicated to the giant god Minderhal. Once there, they must awaken a mighty artifact and disband the mustering army before the giants can be unleashed on the world!

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path continues the Giantslayer Adventure Path and includes:

“Forge of the Giant God,” a Pathfinder adventure for 7th-level characters, by Tim Hitchcock.
A gazetteer of the Mindspin Mountains, one of Avistan’s largest mountain ranges, by Mark Moreland.
A close look at the faith of the giant god Minderhal, by Sean K Reynolds.
A tale of escape and trickery in the Pathfinder's Journal, by Greg A. Vaughan.
Four new monsters, by Benjamin Bruck, Tim Hitchcock, and Sean K Reynolds."

173609.description:
The struggle between movie studios escalates! Lawyers poach actors, while producers offer key roles to their own relatives. This lowers overall profits, of course. All hope is for the new professionals. Gaffers and singers, choreographers and PR specialists will help you to earn the missing millions, by winning the festivals in Moscow, Cannes and Venice!

This expansion adds more cards to Hollywood. You need Hollywood to play this expansion.
173609.name: Hollywood: Season of Festivals

173610.name: Rune (Issue 38 - 2015)
rpgissuearticle: People of Albion! - Your King needs you...
People of Albion! - Your Queen Calls You to Arms!
Site Rules of Lorien Trust & Locko Park
What to bring to an event
173610.description:
User Summary:

This issue includes information on the four large events for 2015: the Spring Moot, the Great Erdrejan Fayre, the Summer Moot, and the Gathering.

Rules updates:

Ritual circle times have been reduced from 10-15 minutes to 10-13 minutes.
Beguile rules have been updated and clarified.
New Occupational Skills (from awakened races) are detailed.
Corrupters' Guild OS List published.




Pages for articles below are in line with the PDF version (which has two pages per sheet). Pages are not numbered.

173611.name: Classes of Pulp: Noble Savage
173611.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pulp character class for use with Castles & Crusades or Amazing Adventures.

173612.name: Centaur
173612.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

173613.name: Charioteer
173613.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

173614.name: Faun
173614.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

173615.name: Monk
173615.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

This class is available in Labyrinth Lord: Advanced Edition Companion. It has been modified slightly to fit the rest of the Classes of Fantasy series.

173616.name: Mystic
173616.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

173617.name: The Hand of Nakresh
173617.description:
From publisher blurb:

No Treasure is Safe!

Forty-Fingered Nakresh is the simian demon-god of wizards and thieves, whose eight hands grasp all there is to take. The five infamous crime lords who lead the cult of the Lowest Left Hand of Nakresh plot the most audacious and spectacular thefts imaginable to appease their god—and to outdo each other!

Demon Cults: The Hand of Nakresh includes:

5 cult leader NPCs with stats: Lord Vermin (CR 10), Master Kiprak (CR 11), Mognyr Dunestalker (CR 10) and his hyenadon mount, Sister Starkfeather (CR 13) and Zheita the Magicmonger (CR 15)
Plots and adventure hooks for party levels 1 to 12
New magic items: monkey’s paw of fortune, shrieking aklys and ley line absorber
New scattered images spell, and a gargantuan new vehicle: the clockwork siege crab!
Using the Hand of Nakresh in the Midgard Campaign Setting




The Five Exalted would relish the opportunity to match wits with your PCs. Show your players a new challenge with Demon Cults 4: The Hand of Nakresh today!

173618.name: If Wishes Were Fishes
173618.description:
From publisher blurb:

Back in the mystical land of Tengoku, the party finds themselves called on a quest by a not so coy Koi named Coy. With the island in danger, a walking and talking fish running the risk of gill cancer thanks to his new cigar habit, and a missing enchanted gem, the land Far East of Brattleburg may soon find itself going south! Can the heroes restore the balance, solve the mystery of the world fish, and eat their takeout noodles before they go cold? Find the answer in "If Wishes were Fishes!"

From Episode 31 - If Wishes were Fishes

With a new year comes new GagMen and we start off this year with a big fish story. Taking it back to our Asian story “The Tao of Ato”, we journey back to the mystical island of Tengoku to chase down a magical gem and fight the worlds biggest goldfish. With nothing more than an incoherent plot and a bottle full of Mountain Dew the GagMen will take on this deadly fish and this time they aren’t going to be floundering around. Though we have a few laughs for the halibut.

173619.name: 100 Oddities for a Wizard's Library
173619.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to 100 Oddities for a Wizard's Library, third entry in Skirmisher Publishing's ever-expanding series of curiosities designed to fill the empty corners of your campaign worlds!

Oddities may clutter a shelf or lie forgotten in a corner but are not defined by where they are so much as what they are and are unusual by their very nature. A dead rat in the basement of an abandoned building is not an oddity, but the same dead rat with its eyes sewn shut is. Oddities make you think about why they exist, how they ended up there, even what the hell they are, questions that are key to an engaging and invigorating roleplaying experience.

Oddities are intended to aid GM creativity and turn possibly bland areas or gaming episodes into something more. The goal of this publication and the others in this series is to make things more fun and to take your imagination in directions it might not otherwise have gone.

173620.name: Shadows in Focus: City by Shadow - Cheyenne
173620.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Minefield of Opportunity

The number of ways you can step wrong in Cheyenne are higher than a lot of shadowrunners can count. There are political, ethnic, tribal, and racial divides, and stepping on the wrong side of them can not only end your job prospects, but it can put you in a hastily dug hole in the ground. Move quickly and be agile, though, and you can slip through the snares that trip up lesser runners, accumulating the street rep and nuyen that will put you at the top of the runner heap.

Cheyenne is the second book in the Shadows in Focus: Sioux Nation series, providing details about a Sixth World location steeped in tradition, conflict, and both technological and Awakened dangers. With location details, information on power players, and more, Cheyenne will help flesh out the Shadowrun setting for players and build adventures and campaigns for gamemasters.

173621.name: Track Pack 1
173621.description:
From the Instructions:

To use a Track Pack, discard the Jacks and Kings from your deck (trust us, you can have plenty of fun without them!), leaving the numbered cards, aces, queens, and jokers. The numbered cards are used for Random Events - you can keep that pile separate.

The ten remaining cards are used for the Track Pack, and are easy or beneficial (Queens), challenging (Aces) or murderous (Jokers). Each time a card is drawn it is discarded; the same leg never appears twice!

Alternatively, you can roll a ten-sided die; however, you may have to reroll duplicate results.

User Summary:

This Track Pack includes random track legs for the following six courses:

Les Angeles - Bright lights, fast cars, and hot girls, this is street racing at its finest!
Dry Heat - Keep your cool when things get hot, or you'll blow more than your radiator!
Palm Tree City - Welcome to Palm Tree City, where it's bikini season all year long!
Nature's Bounty - Take in the fresh air, pick up the farm girls, and get down and dirty on back roads!
Tropic Heat - Welcome to the jungle, baby!
Northern Exposure - Time to hit the slopes and find those ski bunnies!

173626.description:
BACKGROUND: The Falklands Ablaze is a solitaire semi-historical simulation of the Falklands War (May – June 1982). The Game begins shortly after the Argentinians capture the Port City of Stanley after a surprise attack. The British have mustered their Task Forces and have arrived just of the northern coast of the Falkland Islands. The British must now establish a Beach Head and advance their forces towards Port Stanley to defeat the Argentinian Forces and liberate the British Settlers.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the British Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your forces and naval squadrons to capture Port Stanley, Port Stanley Airfield and 10 other Argentine controlled Settlements before the Campaign Deck is depleted.

GAME FEATURES: The Falklands Ablaze contains many colorful counters including ground forces, ships and aircraft. The Game includes rules for Ground, Sea and Air Combat.

The Falklands Ablaze can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
173626.name: The Falklands Ablaze

173627.description:
The first pair of expansions from AoS Team 2015.

The set contains 2 new maps that takes place in Fukushima and Chernobyl.

The main twist is that hexes are worth money, but they will be destroyed in the mid game.
173627.name: Age of Steam: Fukushima/Chernobyl

173628.description:
The second pair of the AoS Team 2015 releases.

When the first map takes place in the human body with two cycles of O₂ and CO₂; the organs are becoming blue or red, changing the players' strategies.

The second map takes place in the brain with synapses.

ONLY for experienced players!
173628.name: Age of Steam: Human Body/Synapses

173629.description:
Wallachia 20 features two complete games covering a pair of important major battles fought during the Russo-Turkish War of 1806 – 1812 for control of the key Danube river port of Rousse in the province of Wallachia.

Rousse 20 simulates the earlier of these two engagements, fought on 22 June, 1811. In this battle Ottoman forces advanced northwards, towards the present day Bulgarian-Romanian frontier. Russian infantry and cannons were able to stall the polyglot Ottoman army, and although they managed to eke out a marginal victory their commander, General Kutuzov, chose to yield the key town of Rousse to the Ottomans, convincing them they had won a great victory. The Czar was not pleased.

Slobozia 20 focuses on the latter battle of 2 October 1811. In this engagement Kutuzov conducted a surprise march which cut off and surrounded the bulk of the Ottoman army, trapping it on the northern (Bulgarian) shore of the Danube. The result was a decisive Russian victory that permitted negotiations to end the war. This had the dual advantage of allowing Russia to transfer key reserves to oppose Napoleon’s invasion of Russia in 1812, and also prevented Austria from contributing more forces to support the French invasion.
173629.name: Wallachia 20

173630.name: The Gallows
173630.description:
The Gallows are ready! Mages accused of wickedness are prepared to meet their end. It's high noon and yet the sky darkens as if it too knows what the future brings. Today, all of mages on the gallows will face their final fate. One by one the wicked will be executed until only one remains...

...and you want that one remaining to be your client. That's right you're a lawyer and the mage you are protecting is a secret.
