Your job is to protect your mage by making sure all the other mages on the gallows are executed first. Of course, the other lawyers are also secretly protecting one of the mages.

In The Gallows each player is secretly defending one of the characters in the center. On your turn you add one vote token to any character and then move one vote token from a character to a different character. Once a character has enough votes they are executed. Whoever had the most votes on a character when they are executed scores the conviction worth one point. When only one character remains in the middle, whoever was protecting them scores an acquittal worth lots of points.

Play consists of players trying to manipulate the votes so they score convictions and prevent their own defendant from getting convicted.

173631.name: Jadetech: Blue Jade
173631.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Jadetech: Blue Jade is the third in a six-part supplement series for the Jadepunk: Tales From Kausao City roleplaying game.

In this digital supplement, you will find everything you need to outfit your Jianghu hero with Jadetech devices that utilize blue jade. You will also learn the history of blue jade, how it is refined, and how it is used in daily life throughout the world. Filled with plot hooks for your games, this is more than just an equipment supplement - it's an add-on for the setting of Jadepunk.

In addition to many new device assets, Jadetech: Blue Jade also reveals a new creature to the setting: jade tainted frost wolves, and introduces definitive healing rules into Jadepunk's specific brand of Fate Core rules.

Jade is at the core of the Jadepunk setting. If you are a fan of Jadepunk, you are not going to want to miss the Jadetech series.

173632.name: Paladin
173632.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

This class is available in Labyrinth Lord: Advanced Edition Companion. It has been modified slightly to fit the rest of the Classes of Fantasy series.

173633.name: #Harshmode Monday (#15 - Feb 16, 2015)
173633.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Monday the creative team from Harsh Realities will offer up small pdf documents to showcase the vast capability of the Sixcess game mechanic!

Each #Harshmode Monday will feature an NPC, Creature, Location, Adventure Seed, or any number of other interesting and useful bits for your gaming table!

boardgameintegration: The Red Dragon Inn: Gambling? I'm In!
The Red Dragon Inn: Gambling? I'm In!
173634.description:
The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is a fast-paced, light-hearted card game for two or more players. You and your increasingly mighty party of adventuring companions have spent all day slogging through the dungeon, killing monsters and taking their stuff. Now you’re back in town, healed up, cleaned up, and ready to party at the Red Dragon Inn. Drink, gamble, and roughhouse with your friends. But don’t forget to keep an eye on your gold. If you run out, you’ll have to spend the night in the stables. Oh… and try not to get too beaten up or too drunk. If you black out, your friends will continue the party without you… after they loot your body for gold, of course! The last conscious adventurer with gold wins the game!

The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is a standalone game for 2-4 players. It expands on "The Red Dragon Inn" family of box sets and single-character expansions called Allies. You can mix and match characters from any of these sets, letting you build the party composition of your choice! Each of the box sets includes four unique characters, a drink deck, gold pieces, and all the parts for 2-4 players to play right out of the box. Each of the Allies expansions includes a character deck as well as gold pieces and bits so you can add another character to a box set (thus making a 2-4 player collection playable by 2-5 players).

Sera the Fleetfooted: Sera is a stealthy rogue whose speed and agility allow her to take down roomfuls of bad guys before they even know what’s happening. The dungeon’s beefiest monsters are no match for her flying daggers! She didn’t get so skilled by slacking off, though. Even while she’s partying, she continues training to make sure she’s always at the top of her game.


The Good: She hones her skills by sparring with her friends.
The Bad: Sometimes she does this without warning them first…


Lizwick the Collector: Lizwick is a consummate problem solver with an unrivaled collection of gear. Her wondrous Bag of Holding contains rare and peculiar items of all descriptions. She is always on the lookout for the next amazing whatchamacallit to add to her collection. Lizwick has gotten The Party out of many a jam with the clever application of the wrong tool at the right time.


The Good: Lizwick’s collection is the envy of academies, guilds and hoarders alike!
The Bad: …and they’d like their stuff back.


Joran the Trickster: Joran’s penchant for pranks earned him a student “sabbatical” from the Mage’s Collegium. Fortunately, Zot saw some potential in the boy, and decided to take him adventuring for some valuable field experience. The young mage’s humor has proven to be mostly harmless to his new friends. He puts his clever brain to good use by pulling fast ones on the bad guys.


The Good: Joran’s talent for misdirection makes him the perfect weapon against enemy spell-casters.
The Bad: It also makes him the perfect weapon against his friends’ gold, their sobriety, their patience…


Zakhan the Drunken Master: Zakhan’s father is a solemn elven noble and a guru of meditative martial combat techniques. His mother was a rowdy barbarian warchief with a penchant for throwing wild parties. This unique heritage has allowed Zakhan to hone a seemingly reckless hybrid fighting style of his own. His opponents who underestimate his “drunken” martial arts do so at their own peril!


The Good: Zakhan’s drunken fighting techniques make him a formidable foe.
The Bad: Sometimes he’s actually just drunk.


But wait, there's more! The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is also a massive storage solution for all previous sets (with room for more). You get a massive storage box plus dividers, new play mats for all previously released characters, updated tokens and more! Check it out:


6 Unique Decks (4 40-card Character Decks, 1 18-card Item Deck, 1 30-card Drink Deck)
29 Character-specific Player Mats (with replacements for all previous sets!)
35 Cardboard Deck Dividers
1 Cardboard Chi Marker
4 Glass Fortitude Markers
4 Glass Alcohol Content Markers
9 Remastered Cardboard Fortitude Markers
9 Remastered Cardboard Alcohol Content Markers
55 Remastered Gold Coin Tokens
9 New Platinum Coin Tokens
10 Foam Spacer Blocks
2 Cloth Drawstring Bags
Ziptop Baggies
Rules for playing The Red Dragon Inn
173634.name: The Red Dragon Inn 5
boardgameexpansion: The Red Dragon Inn: 2016 Promo Drink Cards for Slugcrew
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Brother Bastian
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Cormac the Mighty
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Erin the Ever-Changing
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Halden the Unhinged
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Keet and Nitrel
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Ozrik the Adept
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Pooky
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Witchdoctor Natyli
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Wrench
The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Zariah the Summoner
The Red Dragon Inn: Eve's Mystery Mead
The Red Dragon Inn: Kickstarter Drink Cards
The Red Dragon Inn: Season 2 Promo Drink Cards for Slugcrew
The Red Dragon Inn: Season 3 Minor Reward Drink Promos
The Red Dragon Inn: Slugcrew 2013 Minor Reward Promo Drink Cards
The Red Dragon Inn: Chronos the Time Mage

173635.name: Arcology
173635.description:
The boardgames sets in the Small City trilogy and expands the concepts of the game in the future.

Arcology is a 3D city boardgame that adds the mechanisms of Small City to the game Town Center already released in 2012-2013-2014

The game is divided into 8 seasons where the players try to raise the highest city by minimizing the pollution generated by the factories. To the concept of adjacency already developed in Card City and Town Center, the players will use the Residential-Shops-Leisure cubes in order to host the most citizens as possible...

Players will also allocate a job to their citizens and will move them in the 3D structure...

173636.name: Star Wars Yatzy
173636.description:
As in Yatzee you throw five dice. You can throw each die 3 times and you score by getting certain combinations.

In Star Wars Yatzy you don´t have a fixed set of combinations, but instead you draw mission cards. Each player have two mission cards and they draw a new if they have less than 2 cards. you dicard a card if you finish a mission. If you don´t use all your throws you can add one mission card.

When one player have finished 8 missions the game ends and the player with most points wins.

173637.name: Monopoly:  80th Anniversary Edition
173637.description:
Buy, buy, buy at every location, location, location and celebrate the 80th anniversary of the classic game of Monopoly!

This anniversary version of the classic fast-trading property game features tokens from the 1930s all the way to the 2000s! With a retro gameboard and cards, the game takes you back to when it all began, but you still have to build your houses and hotels and see if you can bankrupt everyone else. You better keep an eye on your money, because you never know when the dice will land you with a massive rent bill to pay. Sometimes staying In Jail can be the safest place to be, but only after your properties are primed to make you money. You've got to buy, sell and negotiate to win at this 80th anniversary version of Monopoly!

Features:

Monopoly game commemorates the 80th anniversary of the fast-trading property game
Includes tokens from the 1930s through the 2000s
You’ll buy, sell and trade to win
Build houses and hotels on your properties
Chance and Community Chest cards can change your fortunes
Ages 8 and up
For 2 to 8 players.

173638.name: Grave Robbin' Graduates
173638.description:
You and your humble lab partner are competing in the 197th Creature Faire. To win this competition, you must rob graves and hospitals for body parts and organs to make your creation. But, don’t get to greedy - collecting extra body parts and organs will make the townsfolk angrier. If they get too angry they will storm the castle. Beware of your fellow competitors also as they can steal from you and anger your mob by spreading vicious rumors.

Be the first to complete your creature and bring it to life with electricity, proclaiming… It’s Alive!

173639.name: Imperial Harvest: Merchants & Magic Expansion
173639.description:
Components:
• 1 Rules card
• 3 new character cards (Merchant, Dryad, and Wyvern)
• 8 Merchant Deck cards (introduces new item mechanic)
• 8 wood Imperial Servant (gold) character tokens
• 8 wood Northern Raider (silver) character tokens

173640.description:
Your favorite fast-paced push-your-luck dice game is back with an all-new expansion! Introducing Ninja Dice: Kage Masters! In this expansion for Ninja Dice, you play as a kage, a ninja leader with mastery in the special techniques and hidden skills of your clan. Choose from 5 different kage masters to play as, each with their own master die, character card, and special abilities unique to that kage master! Includes 5 custom kage master dice, 5 character cards, 1 rules sheet, and ability tokens. Requires core game to play. Core game sold separately.

This exciting new expansion to Ninja Dice adds 5 unique playable characters, each with their own dice and special abilities! Core game sold separately.
173640.name: Ninja Dice: Kage Masters
boardgameexpansion: Ninja Dice: Team Location Card Expansion

173641.name: Stiga Bowling
173641.description: A bowling game where you spin a gyro on a sloping field against the pins

173642.name: The Motebringer: An Edgewalker Archetype
173642.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some edgewalkers reject the philosophy of balance espoused by the majority of their peers, electing instead to focus their attentions on the powers of light and radiance. For their part, the rest of the edgewalkers don't really seem to mind. After all, how can one toe the path between two extremes if those extremes didn't exist?

Like edgewalkers, motebringers understand that light and darkness are two sides of the same coin. Unlike edgewalkers, motebringers believe that one of these halves is inferior to the other. Totally locked out from selecting darkness-based waypoints, the motebringer specializes in light-based waypoints and the shaping of physical material from nothing more than a glimmer of radiance.

The motebringer's iconic ability is the creation of a radiant shawl, effectively a sheet of light worn in the shoulders slot. Each morning, the motebringer can customize his radiant shawl with a number of infusions, which grant offensive, defensive, and utility abilities to it. Effectively, the motebringer gives up access to half of the edgewalker's talents in exchange for a cape that can and will rival artifacts by the time 20th level rolls around.

Product Features

The Motebringer edgewalker archetype [Requires The Edgewalker: Wielder of Light and Darkness]
30 infusions for use with radiant shawls

173643.name: WyrmRider
173643.description:
WyrmRider is a 2 player microgame in the one page "postcard" style

Setup: One player places the 3 wyrms anywhere on the 6 spaces on their side of the board. The other player places the 4 riders anywhere on the six spaces on their side. Players may orient the counters in any direction.

Play: Beginning with the wyrm player, each player takes a turn by rotating, moving and combatting.

Rotating - A player may rotate their counter 60° clockwise or counterclockwise.

Moving - The player may then move any counter 1 hex in distance in any direction, maintaining the counter’s current orientation. If the player chose not to rotate a counter they may instead move a counter 2 hexes in distance.

Combatting - After rotating, and/or moving, a player may attack one adjacent piece of the opposing player with any of their counters. A player may only attack in the directions indicated by the red arrows (arrows must point perpendicular to an adjacent hex side). Players each roll one six-sided die, the attacking player gains a +1 to their roll.

If the attacker’s roll is greater than the defender, the defending piece is removed.

If the defender has more than one counter adjacent to the attacking counter and they have lost combat, they may immediately combat once as a new attacker, before the start of their normal turn. The +1 rule applies.

Win: A player wins by moving one of their counters on to the
opposing player’s home space.

173644.name: The Butcher
173644.description:
From publisher blurb:

The butcher carves flesh and makes sure everyone eats, regardless of what that takes.

The Carcass is a roleplaying story game where players take on the roles of the last members of a dying post-apocalyptic tribe. The tribal leader is dead, the community in tatters, and the future a mystery. What will become of you in this barren wasteland?

173645.name: Breachworld Player Race Folio #2: Hollow Mage
173645.description:
From publisher blurb:

The frail, almost skeletal frame of a Hollow Mage belies the miracle of life that lies beneath the skin. Relying as they do on primal energies to nourish them, Hollow Mages reinforce the fact that the vastness of space-time is filled with beings of infinite variety, not just of appearance, but of nature.

These amazing and powerful beings are the definition of uniqueness. Even Hollow Mages that choose simple lives as farmers or merchants are likely to know at least a couple of Feats, even if not learned Epics. Those that devote themselves to the study of manipulating Aether are well known as some of the most powerful Epics on post-Fall Earth. They have an innate talent for space-time Feats in particular.

The second in a series of mini-expansions for the Breachworld RPG, the Hollow Mage is a unique and new character race, fully integrated into the fabric of the world.

Included in this supplement:

Hollow Mage character creation stats
Detailed background and origins
Discussion of disposition and culture
Detailed description, with new illustrations
Two new Perks and one Complication for use within the RPG
Five quick-stat Hollow Mage characters

173646.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – The Final Frontier
boardgameimplementation: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Tower of Doom
173646.description:
Star Trek The Next Generation The Final Frontier Action Game.

The Ferengi are up to their capitalist ways again. They have overrun the engineering room and are going after the energy matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. They are trying to steal the dilithium crystals to sell on the open market. These crystals are the energy system on the U.S.S. Enterprise. They would secure at least 5000 bars of gold pressed latinum for the Ferengi, and would turn the Starship Enterprise incapable of warp travel. Your mission is to defend the engineering room against the Ferengi and not let them get away with any of the crystals. Your mission is clear...Engage!

PLAY SUMMARY:

Get your scoops ready to catch the Ferengi as they leave the five Jefferies tube openings, as the phasers are pulled from the matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. Catch a Ferengi and get a piece of your Starship Enterprise. Catch the dilithium crystal by mistake and you loos a piece of your U.S.S. Enterprise. Be first to complete your scoring disk and you win.

173647.name: Smack it!
173647.description: A combination of War and Slapjack. Players place cards on the table, then duke it our War-style when a challenge card comes up, or try to slap the pile when a Smack It card comes up. Whoever has the highest card for a challenge, or is the first to slap the pile on a Smack It, gets the pile. Players who run out of cards are out of the game. As a twist, eliminated players may slap card piles to remove cards from play completely.

173648.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Treasures of all types — yet the hard part is not capturing the ship's bounty, but dividing it fairly among the pirates! Players take turns splitting each round's booty into shares for the other players. Different types of treasures have different values, and of course there's the hidden items to keep people guessing. Will you be the quartermaster to give everyone their fair share – but giving yourself the best share?

Each round in Booty, cards representing treasures are revealed. Some are worth points immediately, some items cancel others, some give you a chance (but not a guarantee) for a big payday. The quartermaster, a job that travels from player to player, divides the treasures into shares and also includes the order of picking treasures in the next round. Balancing what you need, what others might want, and trying to get a little extra into your treasure pile is the key to success!

The building cards provide many special benefits that allow for a broad range of strategies every time you play.
173648.name: Booty
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 77- Millennium Blades and Inside the Podcast Studio Year 3

173649.description:
Game description from the publisher:

You know there is money in chocolate, but it doesn't just grow on trees. You need to control the links in the production chain to get your cut of the cash, to make sure the cocao flows through your businesses instead of your competitors'.

Sometimes you need to help your customers and suppliers to help yourself. If you are wily, you can figure out a way for your competitors to do the work for you. Create monopolies, cut off the supply chain, disrupt other players' finely honed plans — do whatever it takes to become King Chocolate.

The fruit of the cacao tree goes through six steps to become chocolate. You can control only a few of these steps, so you must work with your fellow chocolate makers to keep the chocolate flowing through the production chain. It sounds cooperative and friendly — but did we mention that the chocolate maker with the most money wins? Things always get complicated when money is involved.

To ensure your portion of the production process is used the most so that it earns you cash, occasionally you'll help your customers and suppliers. At the same time, you will attempt to crush your competitors, force others to help you, and manipulate the supply chain.

You'll do whatever it takes to become the king of chocolate.
173649.name: King Chocolate
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
boardgamepodcastepisode: If You Buy One Game - The Farming Edition

173650.description:
Description from the publisher:

Steam: Map Expansion #5 delivers a way to store your precious cargo in one place, with this box coming with two maps in its hold: India (3-5 players) and Southeastern U.S. (2-6 players). In addition, it comes packed with a variety of mini-expansions that can be played with your other Steam maps. New Action Tiles — The Surveyor, The Midnight Express, The Local Payoff, and Corporate Charity — can be added to your games to change the dynamic of previous maps, while the Gray Market Goods expansion adds a level of mystery to your goods supply and creates dual goods.

Steam: Map Expansion #5 includes the previous mini-expansions that were found only as promos: Demanding Suppliers, City Growth Special Contracts, and the Five Way Town as well as more track tiles, new complex hard curve tracks, and a Universal Display board to be placed beside your expansion maps rather than having to play your expansion on top of the original board.

Finally, in addition to a box that's designed to hold all other Steam expansions, Steam: Map Expansion #5 includes an updated omnibus of all the previous expansions' rules with more in-depth examples.
173650.name: Steam: Map Expansion #5

173651.name: Catan Geographies: Georgia
173651.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Settle the wilds of Georgia in our latest Catan Geographies expansion: Catan Geographies: Georgia! These alternate maps provide alternate rules and serve to spice up your Catan adventures!

173654.name: Prince of Persia: Revelations
videogameseries: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
173654.description:
A port of Warrior Within done by Pipeworks, renamed as Prince of Persia: Revelations, [...] released on December 6, 2005 for Sony's PlayStation Portable. The port includes additional content including four new areas not available in the original release.

Source:Wikipedia Article.

173655.name: Kings of the Realm
173655.description:
Publisher blurb: An ancient evil devoured their homeland and forced the Trinity to set sail in search of a second chance at life. In their vast numbers, they have settled in Vinland, a place of hope. Now, in their desperate struggle for survival against all odds, they find not only new dangers beyond their camps but within their own numbers as well. The Trinity are divided as they scramble for control of their new home, wage war amongst themselves and confront uncertainty in the face of impending annihilation…

One huge world
- Join millions of players in a massive MMO world
Unlock Epic Heroes to lead your armies
- Unlock and recruit epic Heroes who will lead your armies into battle. Including a Google Play exclusive, the legendary Commander Sadon!
Single and Mulitplayer Action
- Engage in single player and multiplayer battles
Alliances
- Form alliances with your friends and engage in Alliance versus Alliance warfare
Loot & Crafting
- Collect hundreds of materials and use them to craft powerful and unique items to equip your heroes
Strategy
- Capture strategic points on the map, and use your power and alliances to become the King of a realm
Regular Events
- Daily and weekly events to take part in for awesome rewards, including unique items

Source: The Developer Website.

173656.description:
COMPONENTS
Base set contains 54 unique Cards, Token Punchboard, the game's Board and Rulebook. The Extended version contains 84 unique cards, as opposed to 54 cards in the regular set.

OVERVIEW
Gomora : Downtown is a Neo-noir card game for 2-4 players. It can be played 1vs1, 2vs2 (co-op mode) or Free for all. The game is for ages 15+ and it lasts 15-45 minutes.

You are a detective in the city of Gomora. You will take a path between good and evil in a corrupt city full of eccentric and controversial characters. Nothing can be taken for granted. Your goal is to try and solve perplexing crimes that implicate multiple powerful interests. Gomora's criminal underbelly is after you....so hurry up detective.

This game consists of 84 cards each with a unique photo-realistic artwork. There are 4 tokens representing the 8 Detectives and a game board with 4 locations to move around in order to find clues and complete your case.

HOW TO PLAY
When your turn starts you draw a card or you store cards under your case. Then you have to move to a different location and play it's ability if you wish to. The third step allows you to play your cards. Alternatively you can rest during the third step so that you recover one life point. After you are done playing cards, make sure to keep only 4 cards in your hand and you turn is over.

PROLOGUE
How did you get here? What did you do? Why are they after you? In the city of Gomora the rules are made by those who rule the streets, and those who govern the masses are in their back pocket. The city is corrupt to the bone. Nothing is clear and no man knows what is true and what is fiction, which is convenient for some. Pacifism is not an option. If you pretend to be “good”, you‘ll probably end up in a ditch, or worse. If you pretend to be “bad”, vengeance will be upon you sooner or later. The only way forward is to lurk in the shadows, stay unseen until the day you’ll do what needs to be done. Believe in what you feel rather than what you see, because in this town nothing is what it seems.
Every day in Gomora is a struggle for survival and as far as I know… today is not a good day for you to die.

Show them what you 've got detective..

STORY
Bloody Sunday 6am.... Agent's Kiran and Mark have just arrived in the crime scene three miles away from Casino Montenegro.
Mark:- Morning Mike...so what’s the story?
Officer Mike:- Good day to you Sir...
Mark:- It doesn't seem like one...but please continue.
Officer Mike:- It looks like this poor guy has been shot several times by a Niner last night. The doc said the hit was around midnight.
Mark:- Any evidence gathered?
Officer Mike:- Not yet Sir. We are still examining the surroundings. Just got here half an hour ago.
Kiran:- Ok then we will be down town taking our breakfast so if you have any news from the morgue or the crime scene contact Gloria in 4237. We will take it from there (Agents walking away).
Deputy Jones: (shouting)- Agent Kiran...!!
Kiran:- Yes how can I help you Deputy Jones (walks towards him).
Deputy Jones:- May I have a word with you in private?
Kiran:- Sure...lets walk.
Deputy Jones:- I have found this note. The guy was holding it but in a way that if somebody placed it there...in his grip.
Kiran:- And why are you giving that to me old friend (smiles)?
Deputy Jones:- Just take a look and you'll understand why (Deputy Jones grasps Kiran’s shoulder).
After a while in the car
Mark:- (after a few minutes of silence) What's wrong man? Come on spit it out...
Kiran:- It's nothing... Old Jones just wanted to give me some guidelines... Not a big deal.
Mark:- Sure thing...now pass me over that note he gave you.
Kiran:-(surprised) Ok Mark you win....the note was from Fox. I guess we will have to cover that up again....any ideas?
Mark:- (speaks with emphasis) And again she strikes without warning....that crazy b#*@$.
Kiran:- You know that this will start a war right?
Mark:- This was Viny's little brother there… I am prepared for everything....
173656.name: Gomora: Down Town

173657.description:
This is the fifth set in the Wooden Viking Pieces series, which provides deluxe wooden pieces for Catan and its expansions. The large game pieces are modeled on buildings and ships from the Viking era. They replace the pieces that come with the game.

Includes pieces for 6 players.
173657.name: Catan: Explorers & Pirates – Wooden Viking Pieces

173658.name: Trail of the Giant
173658.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini Quests by Survive RPG offer compelling 2-4 page adventures that are great for a one-off session, convention play or for use as a side quest to your campaign. Mini-Quests is designed for any D20 fantasy system.

In TRAIL OF THE GIANT the characters must follow the trail of carnage and slay a rampaging Giant. A straightforward, if tall, task that leads to the discovery of a far more sinister plot. Will they survive?

173659.name: Subway Station
173659.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 56 x 20 inch Battlemap of a Subway Station, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“You already paid for your passage? Well that was just for the subway ticket. Nobody gets through our station at night unharmed without paying our protection fee. ”

Subway Station is a subterranean map of a modern subway terminal.

Subway Station is intended for use in modern or near future science fiction settings. Subway Station uses the same subway lines from our Trains: Modern product allowing Game Masters to fit the subway cars from that product on this map seamlessly. For more futuristic science fiction settings, use our Metro Station map product instead.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Late Night Shakedown: The group either arrives via subway train or is waiting for a subway train to arrive at the subway station in the central area when they are approached by subway gangers that demand protection money from them. These subway gangers prefer to sit in the chairs in the dim subway walkways while sizing up and identifying people they think they can accost successfully. The group has to decide how to approach the situation through paying the fee to avoid a fight or by intimidating or fighting the extortionists.

173660.name: Deckarspelet
173660.description:
480 questions about prominent whodunit books, TV series, movies and real events.

Categories are chosen by a toss of the dice and the first player to 15 points wins the game.

173661.description: The Hieracosphinx Seti-Ram is the competitive prize for Month 4 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
boardgameversion: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Hieracosphinx Expansion Pack
173661.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Hieracosphinx Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

173662.name: Blue Water Fleet
173662.description:
Two fleets clash in a fast paced and exciting game of naval and air combat for two players - or up to four players if two sets of the game are used, Each player tries to find his opponent's ships, hidden within sea cards - and sink them before his opponent do the same.

The game is played with two sets of 'sea' cards arrayed in 5 stacks of 7 cards each - a total of 35 sea cards for each player/fleet, in those cards the players must hide 6 ships: Battleship, Cruiser, Aircraft carrier, two destroyers, submarine and two Mines cards, the ships and mines can be placed in any order and possition within those 5 stacks.

During the game the players use a selection of three types of action cards, attack cards (red) Recon cards (blue) and Fleet cards (green), at each round players start with six cards on their hand, their composition (how many cards from each type they will have) is given by the 'formation' their fleet is following, for example: the recon formation will give more recon cards to a player than attack and fleet cards while a more aggresive formation (Full attack) will give to the player more attack cards than recon and fleet.

While the players only have six action cards on their hands at the start of each round discarding any that they use during the round and drawing new ones to replenish their hand (according to the formation they are in) they also have the 'Hangar deck' space, where they may land aircraft cards (some cards within the action decks are 'Aircraft cards') the hangar deck can have up to 6 aircraft cards and those cards can be used to attack and or to defend the fleet from attacking aircraft, a land/resupply system of not-ready / ready aircraft in the game simulates the whole process of landing aircraft supplying them and taking them off to accomplish missions.

Game Contents:
70 sea cards.
63 attack cards.
63 recon cards.
63 fleet cards.
lots of damage counters.
2 formation dials
2 formation pointers
2 hangar space decks.
Rulebook
game was ranked 6th in the Epitrapezio contest (Greece 2015)

173663.name: Phineus: The Role-Playing Game
173663.description:
From publisher blurb:

A RPG for the RPG enthusiast!
Handcrafted by gamers for gamers. It allows the GM and players to be anything they want in any world they want.
All you need is the book, some dice and a world of imagination!

This is the second edition of the Backwaters of Mysticism rules set.

173664.name: The Sacrifice to the Troll God
173664.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sacrifice to the Troll God is an introductory adventure for the MurderHobos RPG, suitable for characters level 1-3.

In this adventure, the murderhobos take on the challenge of rescuing a villager who's been kidnapped by a local tribe of trolls. Something's strange, though; the trolls stagger and scratch at pus-filled wounds.

The adventure includes a cave lair, three fully-statted monsters, and a full complement of treasure to be claimed after the PCs slaughter the trolls.

173665.name: Rewind
173665.description:
From publisher blurb:

REWIND!

Propelled into the past from a possible future, Rewind is ready to take on your heroes! Armed with the ability to turn back time, she's looking for trouble in your campaign city!

173666.description:
It was a time of wealth and intrigue. A turbulent time, when wars were fought over religion and territory. A time when artists, architects and writers explored the nature and potential of man and a time when horizons were broadened so far, that a whole new world was discovered!

In Renaissance Wars you play the game as a Renaissance Luminary... someone whose influence and fame has transcended his own time! Using only your unique Luminary powers, the cards in your hand and cunning strategy, you will battle up to 3 opponents to accumulate the wealth and power necessary to dominate each era of the game.

But be careful... because when you least expect it, something may occur that completely upsets the balance of power and may destroy even the most carefully laid plans!

The base game contains 6 playable Luminaries - William Shakespeare, Martin Luther, Fillipo Brunelleschi, St. Ignatius of Loyola, Christopher Columbus and Francis Bacon - all of which come with their own unique Luminary Mats, cards and portaits. Up to 6 more Luminaries will be available in Special Editions.

Unique Event and Intrusion cards are randomly seeded into the game during set-up, so you never know exactly what you may encounter!

Featuring beautiful art and history, Renaissance Wars explores the people and events that made the Renaissance one of most interesting, creative and important historical eras.
173666.name: Renaissance Wars

173667.description:
Sub Runners is a historical-fiction Pacific submarine adventure.

STORY

In 1942, As VJ day looms near, Maximillion Erhardt directs a secret submarine full of Chinese gold to secret locations to secure retirement gold for Nazi SS. Gary Shaft, a captain in the American Navy, is on the hunt for the submarine and, most importantly, the gold. Meanwhile, Hajime Yamamoto stockpiles ammunitions and weapons to mine the incoming American Fleet.

A generation later...

America Shaft looks on as her son Kirk dives deeper than he has ever swam before checking on a local tip about the Nazi Gold. The modern spy and government infiltrator, Olli Valentiner, manipulates the local governments, listing the Shafts as enemies of state. In other news, a string of murders has occurred across Asia as the twins, Hero and Kira Yamamoto leave their mark on the traitors who lost their family’s wealth.
GOALS

Sub Runners is a card-driven deduction game for three players. Players take on the roles of three families: The Erdharts, The Shafts, or The Yamamotos. Players gather resources across the world trying to complete their initial goals. The Erhardts: to make three gold deposits, The Yamamotos: to sink the search Corvette, and The Shafts: to sink the submarine. Once the submarine has been mined, Heinrich dies, or the submarine completes three drops, it crashes somewhere in the vast ocean.

The final goals now come to bear. The Shafts must find the crash in the ocean and then recover the gold. The Yamamotos may recover the gold or kill all the other players. The Erhardts may kill the other players or defend the crash site until one of the play decks has been exhausted to win.
173667.name: Sub Runners

173668.name: Black Hand
173668.description:
Black Hand is a bluffing and deduction microgame for 3 to 6 players. In it, players take on the role of members of the Black Hand, the secret society responsible for the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand and the beginning of World War I. The aim is to correctly guess the correct combination of assassination weapons (pistols, knives, bombs, and poison) required to kill the Archduke. There’s a hitch in the plans, however—there are traitors hidden within the Black Hand, who work for the Crown and are looking to uncover the assassination plot! Players are secretly divided into those loyal to the cause and traitors who seek to thwart the plot to assassinate the Archduke. Players have to determine who they can trust and who is hiding an ulterior motive!

This game was designed to be entered into the 2015 BGG & Geekway to the West Microgame Competition. It is played with 46 mini-cards (each mini-card is half the size of a poker-size playing card).

173669.name: Backstab: A Macabre Card Game
173669.description: In Backstab: A Macabre Card Game, players battle the demented, disgusting and deranged from macabre characters to diabolical traps! Using action cards, players try to beat each encounter they face. If successful, they get a coin; if not, they lose a card. Players may also confiscate coins from their opponents by attacking them with backstab moves. The first player to rack up 25 cents wins!

173670.name: Pitch'n Goal
173670.description: Pitch'n Goal is a flicking sports simulation along the lines of Pitch'n Dunk, Pitch Bowl, or Caveman Curling. Just as those games simulate their respective sports, this one simulates soccer (known as football everywhere but the USA). Discs represent the players and the ball. The game sports variants for 3–4 participants and star players with special abilities. The first team to score 2 goals wins the game.

173671.name: Eagle Eyes
rpgitemversion: Los Ojos del Águila PDF version
rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
173671.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sharpen your blade. It’s time to hit the mean and dusty streets of Rome.

Experience Roman noir firsthand in Eagle Eyes, the latest Fate World of Adventure from Pete Woodworth. Battle cynicism, corruption and murder in the shadow of the Coliseum. Play Eagles, the Senate's private investigators, and use every means at your disposal to get at the truth behind everything from "ordinary" murders and robberies to high treason, noble intrigue, military coup attempts, and perhaps even the strange and terrible excesses of the Emperors.

Life is cheap and the dust of Rome soaks up a lot of blood, but the rewards for those that survive are beyond the dreams of lesser men.

Eagle Eyes requires Fate Accelerated or Fate Core to play. This 43-page supplement contains:

An in-depth look at the setting of ancient Rome in Fate
A twist on Fate Accelerated approaches that allows characters to invoke Roman deities
GM advice on dealing with characters of different social classes and group dynamics
System constructs for conspiracies and mysteries in Fate
Adventure seeds to get you started gaming




Eagle Eyes. Some things cannot be left unseen…

173672.name: Stock Ticker
173672.description:
User Summary

Stock Ticker is a Java reiteration of the classic board game of the same name.

The player begins with $5000 cash and can buy and sell units of stocks in the gold, silver, bond, industry, oil, and grain sectors.

Two rounds of die rolling occur between the buying and selling phase in which stocks move up or down or pay out dividends if doing well.

A player can compete with others to attain the most cash at the end of the game or play solo and work to beat a personal record.

173673.description:
Legendary Showdown: Machines and Magic combines the worlds of Girl Genius & Gunnerkrigg Court to create comically epic battles!

The worlds of Girl Genius and Gunnerkrigg Court are about to collide in a legendary showdown! Legendary Showdown: Machines & Magic is a game of comically epic battles where each player uses strategy, sabotage, and one-upmanship to develop a secret battle plan. This lighthearted and easy-to-learn tabletop game is designed to be enjoyed by experienced gamers and newcomers alike. Haven’t read the comics before? No problem! No background reading is required to help your characters win battles and be the last one left standing! Let the mass chaos, devious strategies, and humorous battles begin!

Who is this Girl Genius?
Girl Genius is a three-time winner of the highest honor awarded for works of science fiction and fantasy: the prestigious Hugo Award. The webcomic follows Agatha Clay, a seemingly mild-mannered mechanic who discovers she has inherited the abilities of a spark (a feared mad scientist with the natural ability to understand complex sciences and wield them for their own chaotic purposes). Even more shocking, Agatha discovers that she is the descendent of a long lost line of sparks whose unparalleled skills and insanity made them legends in their own time. Cleverly written and beautifully illustrated by Kaja and Phil Foglio, Girl Genius is full of adventure, romance, and plenty of MAD SCIENCE!

What is this “Gunnerkrigg Court” of which you speak?
This highly praised comic is the work of the celebrated author and artist, Tom Siddell. The story follows Antimony Carver as she attends an isolated boarding school called Gunnerkrigg Court. Antimony soon learns that the Court is no ordinary school - the teachers are hiding ancient conspiracies, it is bordered by a forest full of dangerous monsters, and the school is inhabited by strange creatures and students with special abilities. In the course of her adventures, Antimony befriends an ancient trickster god, discovers her own supernatural powers, and begins investigating the dark secrets of the court.

Why do we love these comics so darn much?
If you aren’t already faithful readers, allow me to let you in on a little secret: these comics rock. The stories are masterfully crafted, the art is top notch, and the characters are instantly endearing. It's no wonder that these comics have won so many rewards and attracted such loyal fans. We also appreciate that both comics feature characters who make great role models. For example, Antimony Carver and Agatha Clay are some of the strongest and most intelligent women you could hope to meet and their friends will stop at nothing to stand by their sides.

How to play the game that will... change your life:
Each player is dealt a total of five characters from the worlds of Girl Genius and Gunnerkrigg Court. These characters line up in anticipation for their chance to battle. During the round, you try to equip characters in your line with powerful weapons and bonuses while equipping characters in other players’ lines with faulty or otherwise terrible equipment. You can also give yourself secret advantages or sabotage your opponents. When the round ends, the characters at the front of each line will engage in a (legendary) showdown. But the madness doesn’t stop there! You can rearrange your line and the lines of your opponents to change who will be competing in the final battle. The round suddenly ends when all players but one (the poor chap) are ready to fight. At that point, each player reveals his or her battle strategy and the winner is decided.
173673.name: Legendary Showdown: Machines and Magic

173678.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXIII - Mar 2009)
173678.description:
From the Introduction:

Another Ashford Valley issue, this time covering some of the slang in the valley, from the towns to the countryside as well.

173679.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXIV - Mar 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Thugs and Mad Inventors Out in the Noonday Sun
173679.description:
From the Introduction:

So I've had some Ashford town adventures for my Ashford Valley setting chat-game and I plan on another five adventures, this time set in Clifton. Here's the first one!

173680.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXV - Mar 2009)
173680.description:
From the Introduction:

I think I've got a good second scenario for the Clifton adventures, so please let me know what you think.

173681.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXVI - Mar 2009)
rpgissuearticle: When Last We Saw Our Intrepid Heroes....
173681.description:
From the Introduction:

Continuing in Clifton town, this third adventure has the PCs following clues to a hidden chamber filled with undead!

173682.description:
An additional promo scenario card to make up for a printer error in the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles, Island of Empty Eyes deck.

The Land of the Blind
Scenario

Villain: None
Henchemen: Shipwrecks

During This Scenario:
Shuffle 6 Gholdako henchmen into the blessings deck. After you advance the blessings deck, if the top card of the blessings discard pile is a Gholdako, put it on top of a random open location deck. When you would banish a Gholdako, display it next to this card instead. To win the scenario, all 6 Gholdakos must be next to this card.

Reward:
Gain a ship feat in a class in which you have checked off a ship.

Players
1 ----- Harbor
1 ----- Riptide Cove
1 ----- Ghol-gan Ruins
2 ----- Docks
3 ----- Floating Shipyard
4 ----- Coastline
5 ----- Merchant Marina
6 ----- Seaside Warehouse
173682.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – "The Land of the Blind" Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set

173683.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXVII - Mar 2009)
173683.description:
From the Introduction:

A fourth adventure for the town of Clifton in my Ashford Valley setting. I've been working pretty hard on these, so let me know what you think. I welcome all feedback!

173684.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXVIII - Mar 2009)
173684.description:
From the Introduction:

This is the final Clifton adventure for my Ashford Valley setting.

173685.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XXXIX - Mar 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Stuff That Dreams are Made of
173685.description:
From the Introduction:

Here is the first of five Tradetown adventures for my Labyrinth Lord chat game Ashford Valley setting.

173686.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XL - Mar 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Hot Blooded! Check it and See
173686.description:
From the Introduction:

I've got another Tradetown scenario, this time taking place in the Furnace ward, for my Ashford Valley Labyrinth Lord chat game.

173687.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLI - Mar 2009)
173687.description:
From the Introduction:

Here is the 3rd Tradetown adventure for you. And an old enemy returns!

173688.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLII - Mar 2009)
173688.description:
From the Introduction:

Tradetown adventures #4 deals with the truly horrifying - relatives!

173689.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLIII - Apr 2009)
173689.description:
From the Introduction:

Here's the last Tradetown adventure, taking the PCs through danger and secrets and a lead to the next series of adventures in Sooton.

173690.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLIV - Apr 2009)
173690.description:
From the Introduction:

The first of the Sooton adventures for my Ashford Valley campaign setting is a continuation of the mystery from issue #43.

173691.name: Kings of the Sea
173691.description:
From the back of the book:
In this supplement for Yggdrasill, our Norse heroes take to the sea in search of the coveted title ‘Saekonungar’ – King of the Sea! Pirate or trader, mercenary or master of your own ship, captain or pilot, the northern seas offer themselves up to those brave enough to claim their destiny, drawn by the salt smell of the wind and the crack of the sails.

173692.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLV - Apr 2009)
173692.description:
From the Introduction:

The second Sooton adventure is a further continuation of the mystery from issues #43 and #44.

173693.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLVI - Apr 2009)
173693.description:
From the Introduction:

This third Sooton adventure deals with some of the old-time runestone carvings of the Ashford Valley's first peoples.

173694.name: Terror Of the Skies: Wrath Of Fate
boardgameexpansion: Terror Of The Skies! The Airship Pirate Board Game
173694.description:
Wrath Of Fate Expansion for Terror Of The Skies
35 new cards to add to the fun of your core set, including:


4 new hero cards from The Wrath Of Fate (Lilith Tess, Timony the Clockwork Ballerina, Gyrod the Automaton, and Doctor Calgori)
7 new weapon cards and new hero weapon rules
plus 24 more quests, actions, and events!

173695.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLVII - Apr 2009)
173695.description:
From the Introduction:

This 4th Sooton adventure deals with missing children and the revenge of yet another old enemy of the PCs.

173696.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLVIII - Apr 2009)
173696.description:
From the Introduction:

The last Sooton adventure for my Labyrinth Lord Ashford Valley setting deals with pushing the PCs to see if they'll break apart.

173697.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLIX - Apr 2009)
rpgissuearticle: No Plan Survives Contact with the Enemy
Some Days the Bear Gets You
173697.description:
From the Introduction:

The next two issues are a two-part conclusion to the Ashford Valley campaign. I started this campaign by writing 30 adventures in groups of 5. The sets of adventures should have advanced the PCs to higher levels. If played in order, the PCs should have reached 2nd level by the end of the High Bridge Road adventures, 3rd level for the Deep Forest Road, 4th for Ashford, 5th for Clifton, 6th for Tradetown and 7th for Sooton. That will make the PCs pretty powerful. However, I designed each adventure to be able to be played by 1st through 3rd level PCs, so it is necessary (and fairly obvious) that each adventure be increased in difficulty by the GM. All this was done to come to this point - the necromancer's end game.

This issue will outline the plans and goals of the necromancer, while next issue I'll talk about the necromancer himself and some of his minions that the PCs haven't met yet.

173698.name: Switching to Guns (Issue L - Apr 2009)
173698.description:
From the Introduction:

This final issue completes the Ashford Valley campaign. The PCs will finally meet the necromancer and his close minions, probably in an attempt to re-take Clifton from his evil clutches. Enjoy!

173699.name: Everlasting Summer
173699.description:
Meeting Semyon, the game's main character, you would've never paid attention to him. Just an ordinary young man with thousands, even hundreds of thousands of those like him in every ordinary city. But one day something completely unusual happens to him: he falls asleep in a bus in winter and wakes up... in the middle of a hot summer. In front of him is "Sovionok" – a pioneer camp, behind him is his former life. To understand what happened to him, Semyon will have to get to know the local inhabitants (and maybe even find love), find his way in the complex labyrinth of human relationships and his own problems and solve the camp's mysteries. And answer the main question - how to come back? Should he come back?

Source: The Developer Website.

173700.name: Beardos
173700.description: Are you a facial hair aficionado? Do you think you know famous beards? Well then, this is your chance to impress! Players are given clues, one at a time, from the player wearing the beard card. The quicker you guess the famous beard, the more points you'll score. Can you Name That Beard?

173703.name: Four by Five Magic
173703.description:
From the Introduction:

For Magi, Magic is nothing more than the speaking of two (or more) Words of Power in a magical language said to predate the elves. Magi cannot be multi-classed or dual classed.

Magi begin play at 1st level knowing three Words of Power - either Two Actions and One Realm, or Two Realms and One Action. They learn one new Word of Power every three levels (3,6,9,etc).

173704.name: Sergeants D-Day: Jagdtiger expansion
173704.description:
For everyone willing to back D-Day Sergeants at the $250+ dollar "Heavyweight" Level, they will receive a KickStarter Exclusive Reward of being the only people ever allowed to purchase the Jagdtiger and Pershing Tank expansions.
Expansion is called Sergeants Hell on Wheels Jagdtiger. A special signed copy of the Hell on wheels rules and a certificate allowing you to buy additional Jagdtigers and persihing tanks is included.

173705.name: Sergeants D-Day: Pershing expansion
173705.description: For everyone willing to back D-Day Sergeants at the $250+ dollar "Heavyweight" Level, they will receive a KickStarter Exclusive Reward of being the only people ever allowed to purchase the Jagdtiger and Pershing Tank expansions.

173706.name: Sergeants D-Day: US Glider Assault bundle
173706.description:
The US Paratroops had a heavy infantry component in the form of Glider Troops. They are armed differently from the Parachute Soldiers. Contains: 12 soldiers, 288 cards and 11 panels.

2 US Paratrooper Sergeants trained as specialist Assault Leaders armed with M1 Garand and M1A1 Thompson. Each Sergeant comes with 32 cards, and 1 - marker set.

2 US Paratrooper BAR Assault sections each with 2 trained specialist Assault Gunners armed with one BAR and 1 M1A1 Thompson. Each section comes with 32 cards, and 2 - marker sets.

2 US Paratrooper Grenadiers sections each with 2 trained specialist Assault Grenadiers armed with one M1 Rifle Grenade and one M2 Carbine with Rifle Grenade. Each section has 32 cards, and 2 - marker sets.

1 US Paratrooper Scouts section with 2 trained specialist Scouts armed with one M1 Rifle and one M1A1 Thompson. The section has 32 cards, and 2 - marker sets.

1 Glider Assault Tactics module

1 Paratrooper Infiltration Tactics module

173707.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier bundle
173707.description:
The German Fusilier bundle comes with two pairs of “Fusilier Assault Troops,” each with one MP40 and one MP44, plus two Fusilier MG Teams.

All eight of the Fusilier Soldiers are trained “Specialists” and come with 16 cards each (normal privates come with 8 cards).

Plus, the set includes a custom Fusilier Sergeant (Leader) Specialist who is armed with an MP40 and has 32 cards. You can name your leader subject to editorial review. (Normal Leaders have 16 cards.)

That totals nine Soldiers, plus the Fusilier Assault Equipment and Tactics Module.

173708.name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Sergeants expansion
173708.description:
The US Paratrooper M1 Garand armed leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant. The M1A1 Thompson armed leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant.

Contents:


2 Sergeants armed with a M1A1 Thompson and M1 Garand
32 Cards, 6 Soldier cards, 26 Action card
2 Hidden Movement markers
2 Soldier markers

173709.name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Rifle Team expansion
173709.description:
The US Paratrooper Rifle Team is the cornerstone of any infantry division. With four soldiers carrying M1 Garand rifles, these troops excel at long range fire support and movement. They are versatile enough to enter any combat situation.

Contents:

4 private soldiers with M1 Garand rifles
32 Cards, 4 Soldier card, 28 Action cards
4 Hidden Movement markers
4 Soldier markers

173710.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Sergeants expansion
173710.description: The German Light Infantry Mauser 98 Leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant. The MP40 Leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant.

173711.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Rifle Team expansion
173711.description: The soldiers in the German Light Infantry Rifle Team are the backbone of low VP cost manpower.

173712.name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Scout Section expansion
173712.description:
First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 2 soldiers and 32 cards

173715.name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratroopers BAR Team expansion
173715.description:
The US Paratrooper BAR Team is effective as a firebase, or maneuverable enough to give you a tactical edge. The portable and powerful Browning Automatic Rifle is devastating at any distance. Along with the M2 Carbine, which is a light weight, medium ranged weapon and the two M1 Garands for additional long range fire support this is a perfect team to send into unknown battle conditions.

Contents:


1 private soldier M1918A2 Automatic Rifle
8 Cards, 1 Soldier card, 7 Action cards
Hidden Movement marker
Soldier marker

1 private soldier M1A1 Thompson
8 Cards, 1 Soldier card, 7 Action cards
Hidden Movement marker
Soldier marker

2 private soldiers with M1 Garand rifles

173716.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Skirmishers Section expansion
173716.description:
The German Light Infantry Skirmisher Specialist troops are a new addition to the SMG soldier line. These skirmishers are gritty troops who operated on the enemy front lines to assault and disrupt. These soldiers come with their basic playing cards but also 8 new Specialist cards that may include Story, Command, React and all new Equipment cards. These soldiers are a welcome addition to any players roster.

CONTENTS:
1 - German MP40 armed Standee with base and markers
1 - German Mauser98 armed Standee with base and markers
2 - sets of Soldier, Core, Rank and Specialist Cards (16 cards)

(Contains 2 soldiers and 32 cards)

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

173717.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Assault Team expansion
173717.description:
The German Light Infantry Assault Team brings to bear awesome automatic fire-power for assaults on the enemy. Featuring a MP40 and Panzerfaust armed soldiers, this team is a welcome addition to any assault.

CONTENTS:
1 - German MP40 armed Standee with base and markers
1 - German Mauser98 w/ Panzerfaust armed Standee with base and markers
2 - German Mauser98 Rifle armed Standees with bases and markers
4 - sets of Soldier, Core and Rank Cards (8 cards)

(Contains: 4 soldiers and 32 cards)

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

173718.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry MG-42 Team expansion
173718.description:
The soldiers in the German Light Infantry MG42 Team are a great firebase, equipped with a powerful light machinegun.

Contents


1 private soldier MG42

Hidden Movement marker

173719.name: Sergeants D-Day: Chapter 4 Merderet Fields
173719.description:
The fields near the Merderet River are flooded, leaving winding paths mixed with deep pools that hamper movement.

Includes: 16 Story cards and Map Tiles 65, 66, 67, 68, 69, 70, 79, 80

(Contains; 8 tiles and 16 cards)

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

173720.name: Sergeants D-Day: Chapter 5 Bunker with a View
173720.description:
The Bunker with a View is a double Story expansion that adds bunkers, trenches and wire to your battlefield.

Entrechments and improved fighting positions were well prepared in Normandy. Clearing them is a real challenge.

Includes: 16 Story cards and Map Tiles L17, 139, 140, 141, 142, 143, 144, 145, 146, 147, 148, 149, 150

(Contains; 16 tiles and 32 cards)

173721.name: Sergeants D-Day: Chapter 6 Carentan
173721.description:
Carentan is a double Story expansion that adds urban fighting to D-Day Sergeants.

Carentan is a key objective to the allied plan - and both sides know it. Fighting house to house is the only way to take it.

Includes: 32 Story cards and Map Tiles U1 - Rue Sebline and Eglise Notre-dame

(Contains; 16 tiles and 32 cards)

173722.name: Sergeants D-Day: Chapter 2 La Fière Bridge
173722.description:
Your objective, La Fiere Bridge, has an exposed approach which requires deception and accurate shooting to capture.

The war rages across Normandy with the La Fière Bridge expansion. The story continues with 2 Landmarks and 8 new map pieces. New story cards includes People Events for Carter and Thielen from the D-Day Sergeants starter set.

Includes: 16 Story cards and Map Tiles L9, 71, 72, 77, 78

The new locations introduce difficult terrain with extensive cover. The heavily wooded terrain and flooded fields slow movement. The La Fière Bridge flooded pasture present a challenging pair of Landmarks to control.

173723.name: Sergeants D-Day: Chapter 3 La Fière Manor
173723.description:
A large stone house with highwalls, La Fiere Manor offers excellent sight lines to the town, bridge and countryside.

Includes: 16 Story cards and Map Tiles L10, 73, 74, 75, 76

(Contains; 8 tiles and 16 cards)

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

173724.name: Sergeants D-Day: Chapter 7 Brecourt Manor
173724.description:
Brecourt Manor is first of three chapters that tell the story of Brecourt Manor and the clearing of a battery of artillery.

Brecourt manor is a provincial stone manor house that commands a good view of the countryside. Taking it will be murder.

Includes: 16 Story cards and Map Tiles L18, 161, 152, 153, 154

(Contains; 8 tiles and 16 cards)

173725.name: Sergeants D-Day: US Parachute Battle Patrol Tactics expansion
boardgameexpansion: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Day of Days
173725.description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 16 cards and 5 panels

173726.name: Sergeants D-Day: US Parachute Infiltration Tactics expansion
boardgameexpansion: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Day of Days
173726.description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.
First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 16 cards and 6 panels

173727.name: Sergeants D-Day: US Glider Assault Tactics expansion
boardgameexpansion: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Day of Days
173727.description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 16 cards and 6 panels

173728.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Battle Patrol Tactics expansion
boardgameexpansion: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Day of Days
173728.description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.

boardgameexpansion: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Day of Days
173729.description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.

173730.description:
The Sergeants Tactics Modules are usable with both Sergeants Miniatures Game and D-Day Sergeants.

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 16 cards and 6 panels

173731.name: The Siege
173731.description: The board for The Siege features a 3D castle. The castle is easy to assemble and fits snugly back into the box without the need to dismantle it. The game is asymmetric – one player (or a team of up to three) attacks the castle, and the other player (or team) is defending it. Knight models come in six colours. All knights are armed with either swords or maces. The blue ones always attack the castle, and are the only team to have two catapults. The red ones always defend. Four of the red knights have bows and arrows instead of melee weapons. The remaining four teams are black, orange, yellow and green. The number of knights in different teams is not always the same. There are always more defenders than attackers. Combat is conducted in duels. Mace wielding combatants have the upper hand, but the outcome is decided by rolling the dice. Each player is trying to overpower their opponents by outnumbering them in isolated combats. Apart from the knights, the box also includes a king, a queen, a princess, a wizard, a dragon and a squire. These models are used in special scenarios.

173732.name: Anything To Declare?: The International Game of Smuggling and Detection
173732.description:
You are the owner of a shipping line required to unload containers in a port, and move around the board collecting cargoes for delivery to a warehouse. As well as this, you must control movements of your lorry and also use your own customs security piece to follow and challenge containers carried by other players.

The bluff element in the game centres around decisions on whether to pay premiums to insure cargoes moving through the docks, and once at the lorry park you must decide whether to declare goods for payment or not.

Strategy elements include decisions on which piece you will move on each turn, or whether you use you throw to hire a forklift or crane. The detection element involves guessing whether all your opponents are as innocent as they pretend or if they are not declaring their full cargo.

173733.name: Hinaga Monastery
173733.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A Japanese - style temple monastery complex, set in hilly terrain. A rocky stream makes it's way through a valley before passing under a wooden bridge, winding past cherry blossom trees. The temple is reached via a set of steep stone steps that pass devotional statues on the way to the main gate. The monastery complex is surrounded by a low wall, and contains several buildings linked by wooden-columned corridors.

Uses: Visit the warrior-priests and monks who live in the temple, work as a Ninja to infiltrate the complex and assassinate the Samurai general who is visiting, seek understanding from the wise priests who dwell in the hillside monastery.

Download includes:

250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)




Note: Whilst the download looks large, it consists of several separate files - just download the versions you need.

A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

173734.name: Fighter: Nuances
173734.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fighter: Nuances offers more than 30 flavorful mechanic options to extend the range and scope of the Pathfinder Fighter Base Class both in combat and generally; it also includes a new archetype - the Mystic Fighter, as well as advice on, alternative uses for and approaches to the options contained herein.

173735.name: Tools of the Trade: The Witch Hunter
173735.description:
From publisher blurb:

This promotional issue introduces offers several new tools that any aspiring witch hunter may use when battling the practicioners of the dark arts. Although designed primarily for the Witch Hunter classes presented in issues #11 and #12, these items may be used by most characters when dealing with witches.

173736.name: Modern Events #1
173736.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM’s Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM’S COOKBOOK: Modern Events #1 offers twenty random happenings in a modern city.

173737.name: Modern Events #2
173737.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM’s Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM’S COOKBOOK: Modern Events #2 offers twenty more random happenings in a modern city.

173738.name: Inns & Taverns #1
173738.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM's Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM'S COOKBOOK: Inns & Taverns #1 is designed to provide you with some quick and easy ideas for dropping in one of the most frequented destinations for adventurers; the inn or tavern. Three samples and detailed (The Rusty Shield, The Hook and Net, and The Cozy Coffin) and twenty sample inns names and twenty sample tavern names are provided.

173739.name: Dungeon Jumpstarters #1
173739.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM’s Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM’S COOKBOOK: Dungeon Jumpstarters #1 is designed to provide you with 20 quick and easy ideas to get the party into the dungeon.

Maybe the adventure you had planned went off the rails, or you’re just having an off night, whatever the case sometimes you just need to get the adventurers back underground for one of those ubiquitous dungeon crawls.

173740.name: Superhero Plot Hooks #2
173740.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM’s Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM’s Cookbook: Superhero Plot Hooks #2 provides eleven hooks for your four-color superhero roleplaying game

173741.name: Superhero Plot Hooks #1
173741.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM’s Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM’s Cookbook: Superhero Plot Hooks #1 provides eleven hooks for your four-color superhero roleplaying game

173742.name: Cyberpunk-Genre Plot Hooks
173742.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM’s Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM's Cookbook: Cyberpunk-Genre Plot Hooks provides fifteen hooks for your high-tech, low-life roleplaying game.

173743.name: Old War Horses (Issue 1 - Apr 2009)
173743.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to my latest 'zine, Old War Horses. Named, obviously, after all the old gamers I've known. We've been through many battles and seen great heights of play in all our years but we're not ready yet to go into the West. This 'zine will cover probably about 48 to 50 issues (as my last two 'zines have done - One Thousand and One Nights and One Night and Switching to Guns) and will continue with a lot of good gaming content. Please let me know what you think as I always welcome feedback.

173744.name: Superhero Subplots #1
173744.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the scenario, the ongoing quest, provides the meat in any campaign, a good Gamemaster needs more ingredients to add substance to the adventure, she occasionally needs to spice up slower parts of a gaming session. With that in mind Big Finger Games offers the GM’s Cookbook line of pdfs.

GM’S COOKBOOK: Superhero Subplots #1 is designed to provide you with guidelines for developing subplots for your superheroic campaign. A detailed sample subplot is included as well as a 3-page worksheet for developing and tracking subplots.

Superhero subplots are a staple of comic book storytelling. They are secondary to the main plot but allow a writer or, in the case of a roleplaying game, the GM and player to explore elements of the characters that aren’t normally featured. Subplots allow you to put some flesh on the bones of a hero, adding some dimension to the character’s personality.

173745.name: Ranger
173745.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

This class is available in Labyrinth Lord: Advanced Edition Companion. It has been modified slightly to fit the rest of the Classes of Fantasy series.

173746.name: Treant
173746.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

173747.name: Lizardfolk
173747.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

173748.name: Ogre
173748.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

173749.name: White Box Companion: Rules for Optional Player Character Classes
173749.description:
From publisher blurb:

Simple Doesn't Mean Boring

The White Box Companion supplements Swords & Wizardry White Box by providing house rules its original classes and introducing five new classes: Bard, Druid, Paladin, Ranger and Thief. While none of these classes were around in 1974, White Box Companion streamlines each of them and adds new options for players while keeping the same simplicity and elegance of Swords & Wizardry White Box. All in an easy to read 16-page digest format!

173751.description:
You’re a Robotics repair expert working for a robot toy factory who’s been called in to rewire the CEO's personal robot found wondering the halls. You begin to examine the robot when suddenly the robots "self destruct" countdown timer starts to countdown from 16 minutes and your heart rate just went into overdrive. Upon further inspection you notice the Robot is controlled by an encrypted code sequencer and you need to figure out how to connect your Code Analyzer to the Robot’s timer. Your new high-tech Code Analyzer is used to bypass the Robot's timer and prevent the robot from destroying is massive program! To do this you must figure out the wiring sequence from the mass of wires in front of you and rewiring the robot to include your code analyzer, which will eliminate the timer and allow you to over-right the Robot's "self destruct" timer! You have less than 16 minutes to figure out the wiring sequence and connect your Code Analyzer. If you can figure out this circuit and connect each of the four individual wires from the robot's timer to your code analyzer, you will safely stop the timer and eventually defuse the Robot's "self destruct" timer; saving your job as well as the bosses robot! Countdown to disaster begins…

Countdown to Disaster is a combination tile placement, card management game and race against the clock style game. Your Code Analyzer has [4] color coded wires “Red, Green, Blue and Yellow” which must be connected to the timer of the robot so as to be able to bypass the timer and prevent the robot from erasing its program! These connections will be made through the [16] wire routing tiles on the game board. The robot itself is amass of wires, which is represented by the 4x4 grid of wire tiles on the game board that are routed in different directions to try and prevent you from defusing the robot. Your goal is to figure out the four individual wire routes to connect your code analyzer to the robot's timer. You must figure out a complete connection route for each wire from the code analyzer to the robot's timer before the timer runs out and robot's memory wipes!
You have special wiring tools that allow you to manipulate the wires and create or change the route of each existing wire or wires. With your tools in hand you can swap wires vertically and horizontally 1, 2, or 3 spaces. You can also rotate the direction of a specific wire or wire group up to 270 degrees. The last tool allows you to actually cut out “replace” a wire or wire group with a new wire or wire group from the bottom four tiles! When you replace a wire or wire group you can rotate the tile to the position of your choice.
173751.name: Countdown to Disaster

173752.description:
The Cookie is a quick card game that will make you use your detective skills or just take risks. You will be secretly playing as one of the six extraordinary characters, trying to figure out who your target is and staying unexposed at the same time (because one of the players is after you! Pam-pam-paaaaaaam).

Each player will have a target character who they'll need to attack and another character, who'll try to attack them. This is defined by the special reminder card.
As the game proceeds, each participant will be playing character cards from their hand, giving opponents hints that help them to figure out who their character is. When the player makes up his mind, he can play a special Sword card to attack his target (the player who represents the character he hunts) or a special Shield card to protect himself from someone, who, as he thinks, might attack him. At the end of the round players score victory points for attacking or defending from the right character.
173752.name: The Cookie
boardgamepodcastepisode: RDTN Episode 83 – Fortress Around Your Heart – Stronghold 2nd Edition Review and a bunch more

173753.description:
BACKGROUND: Viking Conquerors is an adventure game for 1-4 Players, where players assume the roles of young Viking Huskarls (minor Chieftains) during in the Middle Ages. Each Player creates a Viking Character in search of Wealth, Adventure and Renown. To survive and thrive in the harsh and unforgiving world of Medieval Europe, the Player Vikings must take part in Raids, Blood-Feuds, Exploration, and Conquest. As your Viking gains experience and renown they can improve their attributes and Social and Military Status to eventually become Jarls (Earls) or even a King!

GAME OBJECTIVE: The Objective of each Player Viking is to Gain the most Territories and Renown Points in order to increase your Social and Military Standing. Player Vikings start out as Huskarls, a minor Chieftain with right to own a Ship and in control of one Territory.
