GAME FEATURES: Viking Conquerors features many, many colorful game counters, rules for brutal man-to-man combat resolved in a fast and fun manner, and loads of Viking lore.
173753.name: Viking Conquerors: An Epic Game of Viking Adventure.

173754.name: Smoking Gun
173754.description:
Smoking Gun is the winner of the 2015 BGG Microgame Design Contest!

Smoking Gun, a noir tale of crimes, secrets, and investigations. Players take on the role of detectives, piecing together a central case in which their reputations (and even their lives) are at stake. In the end, only one detective will crack the case and become the hero... but at what cost?

This microgame consists of only 18 cards (plus player references), 12 of which are used in a given game. Players can enjoy one game, lasting 5-10 minutes, or a series of games, using the included "The Long Night" mode.

A complete Print & Play file (3 pages of cards, black and white, double-sided), including rules, is available.

173755.name: Aquaducts
173755.description:
Aquaducts is part of the 2015 BGG & Geekway to the West Microgame Prototype Design Contest! If you'd like to vote for it, please go to http://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/186510.

In ancient times, the aquaduct was an engineering marvel, bringing fresh water into cities choked with pollution and waste. You are a fledgling engineer with big plans for the future. If you can build aquaducts to every part of your city, provide much-needed amenities, and gain the people's favor, you will go down in history!

This microgame consists of 24 cards, played as tiles in a city layout. Players get only one run through the deck, and must use their limited resources to expand, navigate, and build their city. The game features 4 difficulty levels (based on the size of the city), and offers great strategic gameplay with very few components.

A complete Print & Play file (3 pages of cards, color, single-sided), including rules, is available at http://bit.ly/1ECXIZk. Players will also need a standard 6-sided die of any size or color.

173756.description: The Chimera Torquo is the competitive prize for Month 5 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
173756.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Chimera Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

rpgitemversion: Landscape GM Screen Insert(s) POD Version
173757.name: The Strange GM Screen
173757.description:
User Summary

The Strange Content for Hammerdog GM Screen. PDF or POD to be utilized with Hammerdog landscape GM screen.

173758.name: Machinations: The Nova Praxis GM's Companion
173758.description:
Publisher Blurb

Machinations expands upon the Nova Praxis setting, delving deeper into the Coalition and Houses while also introducing several new factions. Machinations also offers new gameplay options, campaign advice, campaign examples, and a ready to run introductory scenario. This GM's companion is littered with plot hooks and inspiration for new and experienced Nova Praxis GMs.

173759.description:
Cauldron is a competitive board game set in a fantasy world. Taking on roles of powerful mystical characters like the Druid, the Shaman or the Wizard, players will brew potions to grow their magical power, while casting spells to stop others from getting ahead. Cauldron is a resource management game that plays with 2-5 players aged 10+ in 1 hour.

Play revolves around a central set of fields, producing potion ingredients each season (frog legs, spider webs, dragon eggs etc). Each player has potions - way to combine ingredients to score Magik (game's victory points and currency). Players take turns harvesting ingredients, brewing potions and attempting to steal ingredients from competitors. Each player also has a hand of spells - one-time effects that help the player or hinder opponents. Each character has variable powers that modifies the way basic actions are resolved.

After all ingredients have been harvested, players have a chance to invest some of their Magik to buy additional potions, spells or add fields to the game board. Balancing investment with advancement is a crucial part of the game.

The game proceeds until one of the player reaches 35 Magik - that player is the winner. The game has an element of luck and conflict present but the majority of it revolves around resource management, planning and balancing short and long term investment.
173759.name: Cauldron

173760.name: Vampire: The Requiem 2nd Edition Condition Cards
173760.description:
Publisher Blurb

Part of the Vampire: the Requiem 2nd Edition rules, Conditions add an additional layer of consequence and reward to certain actions in the World of Darkness. Various things within the course of a game can cause Conditions. These include exceptional successes, supernatural abilities, and really any situation where the Storyteller thinks they can be used to heighten the drama of a game.

These Vampire: the Requiem 2nd Edition Condition Cards are a handy and elegant way to keep track of and incorporate Conditions into your Chronicle with each of the 44 cards featuring a single Condition.

173761.name: Telestrations After Dark
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 88 - If You Like Dead of Winter, Try...
Episode 41 - Viticulture Essential Edition BA Holiday Special
Vox Republica 094: The CR At Gen Con 2015 - Part 1
173761.description: This is an adult version of the award winning Telestrations. Gameplay is the same, but the word content has changed to more adult fare. Some of the word cards now include stuff such as "Anaconda", "Jackhammer", "Doggie Style", and "Human Centipede".

173762.name: Pass the Blame: The Party Game For Irresponsible Adults
173762.description:
This is a game of concocting the best excuse to get out of unfortunate situations. Players are presented with a Situation card, for example:

There’s a giant slice missing from the birthday cake, and the party hasn’t even started.
There are muddy footprints all over the new white carpet.
Your friend’s collection of vintage action figures was mistakenly donated to the holiday toy drive.




The player must then write down who is to blame and why. Then the answers are scored based on best and worst excuse.

173763.name: Chaos Tactics
173763.description:
Chaos Tactics is a dexterity game where skill and strategy are needed to defeat your opponent by using your army of eight units. Players battle over a series of rounds by flicking their units until one player claims the entire board. Each army contains seven different unit types with one type, the soldier, having two units per side. The six non soldier units have special abilities that can be used throughout the game. The constant action will create chaotic battles making each round feel like an entirely new game.
The player using the blue pieces starts the game by choosing one of their pieces and flicking it. Once the piece is flicked, resolve any special abilities if applicable. The red player then takes their first turn by doing the same. Play alternates like this until the round is over; with the goal being to knock all of the opponent’s pieces off the game board entirely. If any part of a piece is still on the game board, it is still in play.

A round is won when only one color remains on the board. With each round won, the winner claims a new row allowing them to place a piece or pieces in that row in the next round. For the following rounds, players may place their pieces in any of the spaces of the rows they own, with at least one piece in the row closest to their opponent.

The game is won when one color has claimed all eight rows.

173764.name: Conjure Ink
173764.description:
From publisher blurb:

CONJURE INK is a Game-Master-Only supplement to The Rogue Mage RPG by Spike Y Jones.

Leviticus 19:28 "Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you."

Tattoos are forbidden within orthodox society, and branding is a form of punishment, not adornment. None of the Most High's seraphs, nor any of the kylen of the Realms of Light, sport tattoos.

So why have the bodies of so many Dark mortals killed in recent skirmishes been decorated with tattoos? And why are there more of them on Dark mages than on Dark mules or humans?

Is it just another example of Dark mortals spitting in the face of the Most High and the orthodoxy? Or have the Dragons found another edge in the conflict with the forces of Light?

The Game-Master-only Conjure Ink PDF contains:

Provides rules for conjure tattoos, including their creation, use, and risks—especially risks (but the pain-wracked death of a few Dark mages is sometimes the price that must be paid for progress).
Includes a new conjure posing yet another threat to the stalemate between the forces of Darkness and Light.
Features a fully-statted Dark mage NPC illustrating the use of conjure tattoos and giving a Rogue Mage Game Master a ready-made evil plot to involve his players in.
Features "Pan-Elemental," a new Faith Hunter short story, revealing a new threat to Thorn St. Croix and the New Orleans Enclave.

173765.name: Druid
173765.description:
Plagiary. Copy and paste of existing content.

From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

This class is available in Labyrinth Lord: Advanced Edition Companion. It has been modified slightly to fit the rest of the Classes of Fantasy series.

173766.name: Rockslide
173766.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 240th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a rockslide on the slope of a hill.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

173767.name: Savage Serenity
173767.description:
From the Introduction:

This setting and rules conversion assumes ownership and familiarity with both the Savage Worlds rules (2nd printing preferred) and the Serenity Role-Playing Game. All setting material in the latter game is considered canonical. If you want to play a game where the movie never happened, very few adjustments will be necessary.

Some of the rules printed below were adapted from or inspired by various sources, including J.L. Herbert's version of Firefly for Savage Worlds and several Great White Game/Pinnacle products, including the Adventure Deck rules, Necessary Evil, 50 Fathoms, the 50 Fathoms Companion, and Deadlands Reloaded. Other sources are Jamie Chambers' Serenity RPG published by Margaret Weis Productions, Ltd. and GURPS Traveller, written by Loren Wiseman and published by Steve Jackson Games. This work is not intended to be a challenge to anyone's trademarks; if you're unfamiliar with any of these games, you should go buy them. They're really good.

173768.name: The Empires of Steam & Rust
173768.description:
From the Introduction:

The world of Steam & Rust is a steampunk fantasy setting involving the inter-dimensional collision of a world similar to our own at the start of the 20th century - the world of Steam - and a world rife with entropy and decay - the world of Rust.

Players take the roles of archeologists, explorers, treasure hunters, scientist–inventors, military men, spies, or similar adventurous characters from the world of Steam. (The world of Rust remains largely unknown and unexplored at this point.) Because the world is a very wide place, this setting chapter focuses on Russia.

Step into a world that smells of oil and wood smoke, of gunpowder and ozone, of lush forests and unspoiled seas, of fresh-baked goods and drying herbs. It's a world filled with locomotives and airships, with spies and military conquest, with exploration and adventure!

173769.name: Dark Fagara: Age of the Orc
173769.description:
From the Introduction:

The world of Fagara has fallen to the orcs and their kindred. Humankind has been driven underground or into the wastelands. Elves and dwarves have been hunted to near extinction. Some few dwarves, elves, and humans are kept as slaves of the Orcish Empire. It is a dark age. Will you face it as conqueror or conquered?

173770.description:
Swamped is a semi-cooperative game of adventure, peril and treasure in which players move through a swamp searching for a rare herb that can cure diseases. Each player takes a turn steering the boat to find the herb. But the swamp has many other treasures as well, so players may try to steer the boat away from its intended goal to increase their own wealth.

Swamped is a game for 2-4 adventurers that plays in about 30 minutes and expands the vibrant world of Antidote. In addition to a one-of-a-kind theme, there are five core elements that make Swamped incredibly fun and a surprisingly unique gaming experience:

1. Player-shared pieces: All players share ownership of the same tiny boat in the swamp, so the actions of any one player impact every other player directly.

2. Secret and shared objectives: Everyone knows the main objective, but each player also has a hidden goal that might lead the whole expedition into deadly peril!

3. Player controlled game-length: Players can speed-up or slow-down the game down depending on their preference. Some will try to get out of the swamp quickly, while others will delay until they've collected precisely the right combination of treasures.

4. Surprise ending: It is unlikely that anyone can know with 100% certainty who has won the game before each player's secret objective is revealed, leading to an exciting reveal at the very end!

5. Efficient use of physical components: Despite its small size (35 cards and two pieces), most cards have multiple uses and orientations leading to a surprisingly deep set of decisions each player can make. Furthermore, as players move deeper into the swamp, the swamp expands from the action card deck, opening up greater adventure, while at the same time triggering a built-in game timer.
173770.name: Swamped

173771.name: Cultus Sanguineus
173771.description:
From publisher blurb:

AaWBlog Presents: Cultus Sanguineus takes four to five 8th-9th level PCs through wondrous Mohkba, capital of the Klavek Kingdom in Aventyr, in pursuit of a dark and insidious organization—before the party is caught up in the cult's fell schemes!

This series of products from AdventureAWeek.com are compilations of our monthly themes, packaged together in a handy, bookmarked PDF!

Within AaWBlog Presents: Cultus Sanguineus you'll find:

4 magic items, including the items Sanguineus themselves (as well as the corrupting sanguine chalice)!
3 quests that can be used in any game (an alleyway chase, an elitist ball gone awry, and a ritual bloodbath)!
3 new maps, one for each quest!
2 armies for use with the Mass Combat rules: one of unlikely nobles, the other rabid cultists!
4 devious traps like the false coffin and sanguineus mirror!
4 blood drenched haunts: the alleyway of blood, blood vortex, rain of blood, and sanguine avarice!
3 GM articles to smooth over all the neck wounds!
10 NPCs and new creatures!




A plot most foul brews in the gem of the Klavek Kingdom, but GMs and PCs alike are sure to find something to love in AaWBlog Presents: Cultus Sanguineus!

173772.name: Big Time One
173772.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each set in the Dungeons in Blue Big Time series contains twelve brand-new geomorphs featuring extra-wide hallways and cavern passages, along with the usual assortment of rooms, chambers and caves. Check out the convenient preview to see exactly what your getting in Big Time One.

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes twelve unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. The set includes two versions of each tile, one for players and one for GMs. The GM's version shows additional features, tricks, and traps. This set includes (BT1-BT12):

Six 100x100 foot tiles.
Six 50x100 foot tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

173773.name: Compendium Arkanum Volume 05: 4th-Level Spells
173773.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compendium Arcanum Volume 5: 4th-Level Spells continues where volume 4 left off! This book includes 113+ pages of 4th-Level spells for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, now with Heightened and Diminished effects!

A multi-variable spell is a spell which, once learned, you can cast as a spell one level higher or lower than the original spell. This mechanic was first introduced in Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved. Multi-variable spells give spellcasters great flexibility and so Tim decided to begin by adding the Heightened and Diminished qualities to Pathfinder spells.

So, in addition to the normal Pathfinder spell details, you will see one or two new bits of text, specifically, either a “Diminished Effects” line, a “Heightened Effects” line, or both. This is the first book of a set intended to include all spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, Advanced Player’s Guide, Ultimate Combat, and Ultimate Magic, now with heightened and diminished effects.

DIMINISHED EFFECTS

This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level lower than normal. You must be able to cast a spell at its regular Level before you can use the diminished effects. If you use a diminished effect, treat the spell as one Level lower than listed for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on. Spells that are 0-level (or 1st-level alchemist-, paladin-, or ranger-only spells) have no diminished effects.

HEIGHTENED EFFECTS

This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level higher than normal. If you use a heightened effect, treat the spell as one Level higher than listed, for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on, regardless of what Level slot you use. Spells that are 9th Level (or 6th-level alchemist-only spells or 4th-level paladin- or ranger-only spells) have no heightened effects.

173775.name: VA-11 HALL-A Prologue
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
173775.description:
VA-11 HALL-A: Cyberpunk Bartender Action is a booze em' up about waifus, technology, and post-dystopia life.

"In this world, corporations reign supreme, all human life is infected with nanomachines designed to oppress them, and terrifying White Knights ensure that everyone obeys the laws.
But, this is not about those people.

You are a bartender at VA-11 HALL-A, affectionately nicknamed "Valhalla." Although it is just a small bar downtown, it attracts the most fascinating people this side of dystopia. Keep your clients lubricated and you will be made privy to the most interesting stories."

Features:
-Interact with cool, alcohol-deprived characters!
-Learn way too much about their daily lives.
-Make them happy, with or without chemical help.

Source: The Game Website.

173776.description:
Battle for Biternia combines the aesthetic of classic role-playing video games with the gameplay of the wildly popular Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) genre.

Take control of a team of four heroes and do battle with your opponent. Take down their defensive towers and destroy their Elemental Crystal to win! Each of the 12 heroes is different, with unique powers that they can gain over the course of the game.

Each turn, you will play cards in secret to determine what each of your heroes will do. If you can anticipate your opponent's moves and play the right cards, you will come out on top.
173776.name: Battle for Biternia
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina

173777.name: Round We Go
173777.description:
Round We Go is a strategic family board game.

The goal is to race to the center of the board. First person to get both of their player pieces to the center wins the game.

The trick is that pieces are unable to turn on their own, which can cause you to go round and round on the circular board, unless you plan accordingly.

Players must strategically place arrow pieces on the board to either help them advance or force opponents to backtrack. However, it is important to remember, in a game of circles, sometimes what goes around comes around.

173779.name: Sikarra: Volcano Island
173779.description:
Sikarra, a volcano island rich in a rare resource that could launch your corporation years ahead in their research…or one of the multiple other companies that are racing to find it before you. Extracting the resources from Sikarra will not be an easy job; it is rife with dangers; cannibals, pterodactyls, and the volatile volcano itself. The slopes of the volcano are covered in a dense jungle that is very difficult for modern machinery to penetrate. The only people able to move through this difficult terrain easily are the local tribe…rumor has it they may even be able to travel on the backs of the great winged pterodactyls that circle the volcano. Befriending the tribe may be the only way for your corporation to be the first to reach the rare resources and come out on top.

“Jungle power rules Sikarra. In the jungle the tribe is king…”

The game is playable by 2-4 players.

Players vie against one another for control of the 6 territories of Sikarra attempting to harvest its rare resources while making use of favors traded by other players for much needed equipment. Players will need to stay a step ahead of the deadly volcano, cannibals and circling pterodactyls all the while trying to befriend the ruling tribe through completion of tasks in the tribes name if they want to succeed let alone stay alive.

Winning Conditions: Players must gain support of the tribe (10 support) or have enough forces to overpower the tribe (10 pieces of equipment. The way players gain the support of the tribe is by completing tasks that support the tribe from the tasks list.

Task List:


Build a tribute to the tribe on a territory you control. Cost: 2 Resources & 1 Equipment
Give back to nature. Select one free area and keep it clear of harvesting for one round.
Slash and Burn. Destroy a section of jungle in a territory you control. Gain 3 Resources. Move down one spot on tribe support track.
Bribe local officials. Move once for free at any time this round. Cost: 2 Resources. Move down one spot on tribe support track.


Players move through the following phases each round while trying to show the tribe they are most worthy of their support to control each resource rich territory:

1. Purchase/Place Equipment
2. Cannibals Attack.
3. Politics/Tasks.
4. Lava/Ash Track.
5. Harvest.
6. Intrigue.
7. Move.

Can you lead your corporation to success? Can you harvest the power of the jungle and rule Sikarra: Volcano Island?

173780.name: Mishpuchah & Mishegoss
173780.description:
Microgame submission for 2015 Geekway to the West Design Competition. The game is a two player card game that takes about 30 minutes to play. It utilizes a deck of 18 cards.

When the mishpuchah get together, it should be a time of nachas, but there are always some tsouris. Such mishegoss! (Translation for the Yiddush impaired: When the relatives get together, it should be a time of joy, but there are always woes. Such craziness!)

Deal out the guests for the family get-together, then seat them one at a time. Gain points by making your guests happy. Some members are particular about whom they sit with, while others have family members whom they wouldn't be caught dead next to. For most rounds, there will be one branch of the family who is offended and won't score any points at all. The game is over when everyone has been offended at least once.

173781.name: Fidelitas: The Hunting Lodge Promo
173781.description:
Set up: Place this location off to the side of the play area, apart from the regular locations.

Special Location Ability: Discard a card here to steal a card from any player with more than 2 cards. Do not draw at the end of the turn. Cards played here are not added to the discard pile before reshuffling the Virtus deck.

173782.description:
A strategic cycling parlor game for 2-4 players, 8 years and above

Will your team win the tour?
Going for the yellow or do you choose for the team? Climbing the hills or pushing it on a flat stage?
Keep in mind you’re not the only one cycling the road… A small steering error, misjudgment or a ‘cycling strategy’ can cause a sensational collision.
Let your cycling team ride as fast as possible and win the bike race!

Introduction
In this parlor game you play within the stages as a cycling team. A team consists of three riders. The basic game can be played with 2 to 4 players. The duration of a one stage game with 4 players is 1 to 1.5 hours.
. The results of your team and players standings are recorded. A Tour consists of several stages, with the fastest rider over several stages wearing the yellow jersey. You decide for how long and which stages you want to play.
The game is played with cards. By placing a card on the table you decide how fast you are moving your riders on the trail. You try taking tactical moves and benefit from wind advantage by letting your opponent do the hard work. Cast or save your good cards to démarrage when you feel that your opponent cannot. In short: “Linkeballen”.

Note:
If you have the additions as well, you can play up to 24 players.
173782.name: Linkeballen

173783.name: Spoiler Alert
173783.description:
User Summary:

A "Backer's Choice" 16-page PDF story that is centred around Therkla the half-orc ninja.

Released to backers of The Order of the Stick Reprint Drive on 20 February 2015.

173784.name: Five Seals of Magic
173784.description:
Explore the dungeon of the Arcana Tower in Five Seals of Magic to find powerful spells! Magical seals of four elements block your way to the scrolls. Use the dice of four matching colors to break the seals and clear a path to the scrolls.

You should also keep an eye on your opponents. Use your powers at the right time and at the right place! Manipulate dice and other elements of the game with scrolls, which you've collected. This way, you can break stronger seals and open your way to more powerful scrolls. The player who collects the most powerful scrolls wins.

173786.name: Ninja Guy
173786.description:
From a peaceful training village to a hell-like demon world, you become Ninja Guy, in his bizarre and epic quest to prove himself to the Holy Cow Sensei and bring down an evil gargantuan Minotaur!

You are Cow Sensei's last hope, and final student .. Will you finally attain your Ninjaness? Ninja Guy will have you laughing along to his almost never-ending supply of dim-witted Ninja catchphrases, such as the classic "2 + 2 = NINZAAA!" and "Ninza Sense, Tingring!!"

.. Oh, and don't forget, "Gun's don't kill people, Ninja Do!"

Source: The Game Website.

173787.name: Forced
173787.description:
One- to four-player co-op arcade adventure with puzzles and tactical elements. You are cast as slaves in the toughest fantasy gladiator school of them all, condemned to fight as a gladiator and eventually win your freedom. You will face deadly trials and huge creatures, but Balfus, your Spirit Mentor will guide you in your quest for recognition.

Source: The Game Website.

173788.name: The Legends of Sinbad
173788.description:
From the publisher
This is not a genre piece!

The Legends of Sinbad is a new sword-and-sorcery campaign set on Earth in the year 801 C.E.

Inspired by the Harryhausen Sinbad trilogy but based on real-world mythologies, histories, and legends, as well as the tales of the Arabian nights, the game is more than a Prince of Persia tale. As you can see from the map below (which is not yet complete--more cities will be added as development continues), a wide variety of cultures are represented. In this one era, you can find every RPG setting imaginable. You have the Vikings in the Norselands; feudal Europe with the Anglo-Saxon Kingdoms and the Carolingian Empire; wild, druidic barbarians in the Celtic Kingdoms; a classical feel with the Eastern Roman Empire; savage nomadic hordes with the Kazar Khaganate; and Arabic with the Abassid Caliphate.

And each culture brings with it its own monsters from mythology--kraken, gray dwarves, and frost giants in the Norselands; dragons and centaurs in the Carolingian Empire; trolls and ogres in the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms; brownies and banshees in the Celtic kingdoms; gorgons and hydras in the Eastern Roman Empire; and djinn in the Kingdom of the Moors; just to name a few!Of course, there is a lot more to this setting than just the above. This is just a quick note to point out that this setting is not just another Arabic genre piece, but a vibrant, versatile, and unique sword-and-sorcery campaign setting!

The campaign book will be made available in Savage Worlds, and you won't need to buy the Savage Worlds book to play! This will be a complete set!

173789.name: Galloway
173789.description:
This is a card deck & game system with multiple suits, inspired by little ponies, and designed with young players in mind.

Unlike a standard deck of cards, this deck features six "mane" suits: Generosity, Honesty, Kindness, Laughter, Loyalty, and Magic.

The deck also features three other suits: Earth Pony, Pegasus, and Unicorn. The mane suits of Honesty and Laughter are adorned with the Earth Pony suit. Kindness and Loyalty are adorned with the Pegasus suit. Generosity and Magic feature the Unicorn suit.

Furthermore, another pair of suits split the deck in half: the Moon and Sun. Honesty, Laughter, and Loyalty lie under the Moon. Generosity, Kindness, and Magic under the Sun.

The deck is available as a print-and-play game.

173790.name: Old War Horses (Issue 2 - Apr 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Close the Wall Up with Dead
173790.description:
From the Introduction:

Last issue, I talked about my inspiration for a Serenity/Firefly setting using the Deadlands Reloaded Savage Worlds rules plus some PDFs. This issue I'll mix the Serenty 'Verse with the Deadlands setting. In no way should any reader expect a complete mixing of the two (as my knowledge of both is about a d6) without some parts missing from both.

173791.name: Old War Horses (Issue 3 - Apr 2009)
173791.description:
From the Introduction:

A nice bit of fiction last issue explaining who the Reckoners are and what they want. This issue, I'll deal with what that means to the game and to the players/PCs.

173792.name: Old War Horses (Issue 4 - Apr 2009)
rpgissuearticle: I Am Part of All I Have Met
173792.description:
From the Introduction:

This 4th issue of Old War Horses continues with my Serenity/Firefly Deadlands Reloaded game. Since I've briefly outlined the mix between the 'Verse and Deadlands, as well as the PC power level and magic in the solar system, this issue I'll talk about the characters' place in that world.

173793.name: Old War Horses (Issue 5 - Apr 2009)
173793.description:
From the Introduction:

Continuing my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded setting, this issue I'll be going into the population of the garrison and background of the leaders of the 479th Mule, Gravedigging and Support Unit on Ita.

173794.name: Crack the Code
173794.description:
Crack the Code with three levels of challenge is a brain testing game of logic and mental concentration. The object of the game is to crack the secret code of your opponent by means of simple logic and deduction. Players challenge each other in turn by setting out a row of three, four or five coloured code counters according to the level of skill and difficulty to be played. The game can be made even tougher by allowing the code maker to use any number of the same coloured counters, and or leave spaces, to make up the code.

The code maker sets up the sliding screen so that it is placed directly in front of them just allowing space to place and hide their secret code in the spaces provided. The code breaker must try to duplicate the exact colours and positions of the secret code. Each attempt is marked with a tick for an exact colour and position match or a cross for the correct colour but incorrect position.

Players swap roles and the winner is the one who breaks the code in the least number of attempts.

173795.description:
This is Paizo's Free RPG Day 2015 promotional character card set for the Pathfinder Adventure Card game.

Ekkie, like her compatriot Ranzak, likes to eat, stab, and steal, not necessarily in that order. She comes with a character card, a token card, and a role card, and she can be played with any Adventure Card Game Base Set.
173795.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – "Ekkie" Promo Character Card Set
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Character Mats
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

173796.name: Lebanon. New Scenario for Arab Israeli Wars
173796.description: Published in The General 21/6, add new counters ( MBT Merkava, T-72, Gazelle helicopters, and MRL artillery) and 5 new scenarios for arab Israeli Wars.

173797.name: Fantasy Dice Combat Primer
173797.description:
From the intro:

This is a one page primer for the Fantasy Dice roleplaying game
combat system. This primer assumes the reader has already read
the Fantasy Dice One Page Primer.

173798.name: Fantasy Dice One Page Primer
173798.description:
From the intro:

This is a one page primer for players of Fantasy Dice roleplaying.

This is in no way a complete representation or summary, but
intended to explain – briefly – the most fundamental concepts
that everything builds on. It is assumed that the reader is familiar with roleplaying games.

173799.name: Smuggler's Guide to the Rim
173799.description:
From publisher blurb:

Does your Crew have what it takes to fly the Good Shepherd’s Run?

SMUGGLER’S GUIDE TO THE RIM is a supplement for the FIREFLY RPG that is designed for both players and GMs. The third supplement in the line, the SMUGGLER’S GUIDE TO THE RIM introduces Reputation rules for Crewmembers, 12 new archetypes, the Good Shepherd’s Run, more Chinese translations, more rules, new in game aids, a pair of Episodes, and more!

We think you’ll appreciate the following:

Reputation Rules: Find out how to earn your Reputation, how to lose it, and how to make it count. While Reputation rules are player-facing, Gamemaster characters will employ Dispositions to guide interactions with the Crew. In addition to the new Reputation rules, you’ll also dive into plenty of examples, read about the four Factions in the ’Verse, and get an overview of Dispositions, too!
New Crewmember Archetypes and Boats: You’ll read about the suggested Reputation die ratings for the Serenity Crew and discover twelve, brand new archetypes along with new ships. They are: Alliance Contractor, Alliance Dogfighter, Alliance General, Folk Hero, Freedom Fighter, Roving Medic, Corporate Broker, Corporate Lackey, Corporate Researcher, Friendly Face, Lone Hood, and the Shady Entrepreneur.
Good Shepherd’s Run: Each location in the Blue Sun and Kalidasa Systems is presented like a brand new Episode for you to dive in and explore with new story ideas, ship rules, adventure ideas, new Antagonists, new Chinese phrases, and a whole lot more! In the Good Shepherd’s Run, you’ll fly to places like Deadwood, Ghost, Kuan Lo, and strange locations like The Nest!
All in the Family: Written by Margaret Weis. Nothing’s more important than family, ’cept maybe a big ole strongbox of gold coins. Bao-Huang Qin, the leader of the Dragon Tong, has tasked your Crew with recovering his loot, thought lost after it’d been confiscated by the Alliance. Qin ain’t askin’, though—he’s holding Jayne’s momma as collateral and his daughter, Fang-Hua Qin, is accompanying the Crew on this job. Easy, right? Problem is it’s on a wreck floating in Reaver space, and four mercs sent by Qin’s unlikely rival Agnes Pierce will be racin’ your Crew to the prize—and they don’t give a damn about Jayne’s momma.
Circling the Wagons: Written by Greg Stolze. Folk in the Core think they can put a leash on damn near everyone else in the ’Verse, and one of their leashes is named Special Independent Investigator Garth Mandrake. But a leash matters less to them what love power than who’s holdin’ it. Mandrake’s found himself caught between two political cliques within the Alliance. Their tiff strands him on an uncharted rock facetiously known as Barry's Kingdom, with each side hiring a ship—the Crew and their greatest rivals—to pick him up and get him under their control. The Crews got to deal with double-dealing, rampaging wrecks and the namesake of the planetoid to get the SII in hand while he’s still breathing. And that’s before the Reavers show up.
Expanded Appendix: We’ve included a brand new FAQ, Chinese translations, more Distinctions, maps for the Kalidasa and Blue Sun Systems, and a set of brand new tools for players and GMs—an Advancement Sheet that includes Reputation die ratings and a GMC Sheet to take the guesswork out of building GMCs, too!

173800.description:
Your goal (both in life and in this game) is to have the most adorable pandas. However, the fickle Panda Laws of Adorableness change often, and with them which pandas are adorable. Playing your pandas cleverly and navigating the Laws well will reward you in bamboo! You want that.

The gameplay of Adorable Pandaring is easy to learn. The deck consists of four copies each of ten pandas, numbered 1-10, and four Panda Law cards [High(6-10), Low(1-5), Even, Odd]. On your turn you will play one hidden panda face down, and one panda face up. Your face up panda uses a special ability to do something -- steal a panda, change the Panda Law, or even gain bamboo!

The Red Panda sits in the middle of the table, ready to award bamboo. If your turn starts and you can see four currently adorable pandas (by the Panda Law), scoring happens. You take the Red Panda card, and follow the instructions on the back. All hidden pandas are revealed, and everyone with at least two adorable pandas in play gets a bamboo. The player(s) with the most adorable pandas get a second bonus bamboo. Then, all adorable pandas are shuffled back into the deck (Other pandas remain). You choose a new Panda Law, and play continues. When someone gets to five bamboo, they win!

Games last 5-15 minutes, and Adorable Pandaring can be played with 3-5 players.
173800.name: Adorable Pandaring
boardgamepodcastepisode: Vox Republica 076: The Giant PAX East 2015 Recap

173801.name: Outpost of the Humanoids
173801.description:
From publisher blurb:

FQ3- Outpost of the Humanoids is the third adventure for the Filbar Quest Series. As you make your way to a meeting with the Baron of the Knolls you come across a roadside inn and a pair of old adventurers that have a small task for you near some old abandoned ruins. Sounds easy enough right? For some reason it never is easy, especially in Filbar!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a low level party of adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

173802.description:
When gods fight, the blood of simpletons flows freely. Teomachia lets you become one of the ancient gods and spend one hour playing the lord of a group of devoted followers. You have one goal and one goal only: Annihilate your foe's believers and thereby move yourself one step closer to absolute power.

Drafting prayer cards and power cards allows you to slowly build your might. Using those cards, you send your followers into battles, build temples, and inflict terrible curses on the unfaithful. You face a tough decision in every single hand: Should you put your own power on the line to help your believers win their battles, or should you turn your back on them, sending them to a certain death? If no god yields, hurricanes will face off with deathly plagues, tempests will extinguish walls of fire, and the ranks of the faithful will grow smaller every second. Once you get rid of your opponent's last prophet, it's time to rest and listen to the cheerful song of your people. You have won the clash of gods.

Teomachia: Mitologia słowiańska (Theomachy: Slavonic Mythology) is the first expansion. It introduces the Slavonic pantheon to the game previously consisting of four mythologies: Celtic, Greek, Norse and Sumerian. The expansion provides three new gods of Slavonic pantheon (Mokosh, Perun and Veles), as well as four additional gods to previously existing pantheons (one to each). Also in package are new Slavonic myth cards, myth cards from basic edition reprinted using improved graphics, a player aid card and a small expansion Priests, consisting of ten wooden discs representing priests with special abilities (for all 5 pantheons).
173802.name: Teomachia: Mitologia słowiańska

173803.name: Vengeful Curses
173803.description:
From publisher blurb:

Powerful Magic to Punish Those Who Wronged You

In folklore and mythology, and often in more modern fantasy media, curses are powerful things, and not to be taken lightly, and there are few things that have as much potential to ruin your life than a witch or wizard who feels that you have wronged them in some way. In Pathfinder, however, curses often lack much bite to begin with, and are quickly dealt with by casting remove curse. What is it that makes the curses in the fairy tales so much more powerful than the curses you have access to in the game? There are many answers to that question, but one of them, is the power of vengeance.

The eleven spells contained within this book are far more powerful—and much harder to get rid of—than most curses in the game. Inflict the target with an instant and all-but-incurable magical form of leprosy. Steal his ability to speak entirely. Have each harmful spell he casts turned back upon him (at a three-for-one ratio)! Fill him with an endless, insatiable hunger, or taint his seed, so that all of his progeny are horrifying demons. This magical power has a catch, however: each curse in the book functions only if the target performed some specific action to wrong you (or someone else), thus leaving themselves open to the curse’s power. What exactly it takes to be vulnerable to the curse varies from spell to spell: for some, simply casting a harmful spell, or attacking a flat-footed creature is enough. For others, the target might need to mock a god or religion, to be unfaithful to their lover, or to tell a lie. Whatever the crime, this book has a powerful curse dedicated to punishing those who performed it.

boardgameintegration: Gruff: Clash of the Battle Goats
Gruff: Clash of the Battle Goats
boardgamehonor: 2016 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Multiplayer) Nominee
173804.description:
Gruff is a tactical "Expandable Card Game" about mutated monster goats. Players create a customized team of monster goats called "Gruffs" led by a shepherd. You win the game by crushing through the enemy line of gruffs and killing the opposing shepherd.

Players take turns playing ability cards and declaring attacks. After an attack is declared your opponent takes his turn and may dodge or block your attack then declare his own attack. Your attack resolves at the beginning of next turn.
173804.name: Gruff
boardgameexpansion: Gruff: Clash of the Battle Goats
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game of Crowd Funding Brent Critchfield Interview 05-13-2015
The Good, The Board and the Learned: Episode 16 “Teaching”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 66!!

173805.description:
Take the role of escaped mental patients in this fully cooperative board game for 1 to 5 players. Enter the abandoned mental hospital from your worst nightmares. Each player controls a different crazy character with their own story and phobias which can become reality in any moment. There is one goal: to escape. But it is not easy when you think that all the staff are the evil monsters and the warden is the worst of them.

Lobotomy is a scenario based adventure/dungeon crawler game. Lobotomy introduces such features as:


big (yes very big) modular board where each module is a different part of the hospital (including outside areas like garden or chapel)
completely different characters, with their own stories and mental illness which define their skills and powers
different monsters, mostly based upon the old pulp horror movies
fight, explore, or learn about your past, but you don't have much time until the warden finds you, and you must be prepared to face him


All characters and monsters have their own awesome miniatures (with over fifty in the base set).
173805.name: Lobotomy
boardgamepodcastepisode: 4. Devon Dice podcast, review of 2015 part 2

173806.name: Trivia On the Go: America
173806.description: Card game answering trivia about America.

173808.name: Twirk
173808.description:
Twirk is a game of spelling quickly for 2-7 players who race to make five letter words from dice and cards.

Each round, players race to make words using cards that have a single letter and a two-letter pair on them, and dice that have vowels and wilds. Each card can be used as either its single letter or pair of letters. Each player has two cards in hand to use, as well as three community cards in the middle of the table.

The first to find a five-letter word wins the round, and the first to win five rounds wins the game!

173809.description:
Dhex (from Dual-Hex) is a Hex derivative that is played with the same components.

Players in turn place 2 adjacent discs on the board, one of each colour.

Whenever a 1-cell hole is created, the player that created it places a disc of her colour on it. Notice that several holes can be created at once, but none as a result of filling.

First to connect his sides wins.

The games are shorter than in Hex, so large boards are recommended (14x14).
173809.name: Dhex

173810.name: Lexicon
173810.description:
From the introduction:

The basic idea is that each player takes on the role of a scholar, from before scholarly pursuits became professionalized (or possibly after they ceased to be). You are cranky, opinionated, prejudiced and eccentric. You are also collaborating with a number of your peers — the other players — on the construction of an encyclopedia describing some historical period (possibly of a fantastic world).

The game is played in 26 turns, one for each letter of the alphabet.

173811.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (January 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Caves & Caverns: The Last Nail (EL 8; XP 4,800)
GM Advice: How and Why To Say “No”
173811.description:
Publisher blurb***




Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

GM’s Monthly Miscellany: January 2015 presents:

Player Advice: Clever Uses for Mundane Items

Edgewood At a Glance (from Village Backdrop: Edgewood)
Mystic Ruins: Dressing (from Alternate Dungeons: Mystic Ruins)
Port Town: Sights & Sounds (from Urban Dressing: Port Town)
Gloamhold: At A Glance (from Gloamhold)
GM Advice: 6 Moral Dilemmas for Your PCs

173812.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (February 2015)
rpgissuearticle: GM Advice: Why A GM Should KISS As Much As Possible
Player Advice: Inventive Uses For Mid-­‐Level Spells
173812.description:
A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible GM's Resource by Christian Aliponarian, Creighton Broadhurst, Andy Glenn and Jacob Trier

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

GM’s Monthly Miscellany: February 2015 presents:


Player Advice: Inventive Uses For Mid-Level Spells
Henchfolk & Hirelings (from Henchfolk & Hirelings)
Aldwater At a Glance (from Village Backdrop: Aldwater)
War-Torn Town: Sights & Sounds (from Urban Dressing: War-Torn Town)
Gloamhold: Rivengate (from Gloamhold)
GM Advice: Why A GM Should KISS As Much As Possible

173813.name: Ruins of Gilead
173813.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for three to four 4th or 5th level PCs.

The expedition to Gilead has been shattered from within. Mad with greed for a golden idol, the explorers turned daggers on their peers, murdering one another in paranoia and rage. The victorious killers show signs of demonic possession, and now stalk the jungle in pursuit of their missing treasure. Sent to discover the fate of the expedition, the PCs find themselves deep in the heart of madness far from any civilization. Can they unravel the secrets of Gilead and find the golden treasure before an ancient evil is brought back into the world?

Also included in The Ruins of Gilead:

A branching storyline where mercy, greed, and pride will have severe and sometimes unintended consequences.
Exciting and challenging combats where quick thinking and creativity are needed to survive.
Five new monsters, including the crawling anklegrabbers, blood elementals, and the demon aravax.
Four new traps including the disfiguring poison trap and the drowning blood trap.
Two new magic items, the enigmatic sphere of many answers and the brutal aravax’s sacrificial dagger.

173814.name: Big Time Two
173814.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each set in the Dungeons in Blue Big Time series contains twelve brand-new geomorphs featuring extra-wide hallways and cavern passages, along with the usual assortment of rooms, chambers and caves. Check out the convenient preview to see exactly what your getting in Big Time Two.

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes twelve unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. The set includes two versions of each tile, one for players and one for GMs. The GM's version shows additional features, tricks, and traps. This set includes (BT1-BT12):

Six 100x100 foot tiles.
Six 50x100 foot tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

173815.name: An Unexplained Journey
173815.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Unexplained Journey is the fifth book (of seven) in The Uncommon Commoners campaign series. In this semi-epic campaign, the uncommon commoners will fulfill their destiny. Or die trying. Or both—if their destiny is to die trying.

Long ago, the pornography loving dragon Smut descended on the Sticky Mountains and laid waste to the humans of the lake and the dwarves under the mountain. Since then, people have trembled in the shadows of the Sticky Mountain. But, there is hope—a prophecy says that someday the dragon will be slain and that the King Under the Dirt will return to shower the people with gold.

Long after the dragon took up residence in the stickiest of the Sticky Mountains, Nimblee’s family was slaughtered after being expelled from their home city. On that day, Nimblee vowed revenge. This pledge of vengeance will place the uncommon commoners on a collision course with Smut. To reach the dirty dragon and exact revenge will require an unexplained journey that will pit the heroes against such foes as Joe Bitey, cave crickets, and talkative trolls.

The Uncommon Commoners #5: An Unexplained Journey is a Pathfinder Role Playing Game compatible adventure. It is intended for a party of 5th-8th level uncommon commoner characters. While the adventure is written to be humorous and fairly light, it is also designed to be suitable for serious game play.

Here are some of the features of the adventure:

Detailed color maps.
Fully developed NPCs, complete with detailed descriptions, backstories and motivations. And loot.
Full statistics are included for all encounters—no need to look up monsters.
New Magic Items (Dwarven Cooler, Ring of Visibility, Burglar Book, Burglar Mask, and Sneaky Pants).
Hero Lab Portfolio (free download).
66 pages of adventure (includes maps)!
Joe Bitey!
Ted talking.

173816.name: CHOMP!  A Survival Horror Roleplaying Game
rpg: CHOMP!  A Survival Horror Role Playing Game
173816.description:
from the PDF

Welcome to the world of CHOMP! A quick paced and simple Role Playing Game where you try to survive the Zombie Apocalypse. CHOMP! has quick character creation and game development to allow you to play with little prep time needed. Grab some friends, grab some weapons, and see if you have the skills and wits necessary to survive.

173817.name: Platoon (2002)
173817.description:
Platoon is a real-time strategy video game developed by Digital Reality and published by Monte Cristo for the PC Windows in 2002. It was also published by Strategy First as Platoon: The 1st Airborne Cavalry Division in Vietnam.

Source: Wikipedia, "Platoon (2002 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

173818.name: Patron's Protege
173818.description:
In Patron’s Protégé, you are a lord or lady in the Middle Ages and the time has come for your wards to receive higher education. You will attempt to give them the best education possible by sending them to classes where they will eventually gain proficiency and use their knowledge to teach their own classes.

Patron's Protégé is a two to four player worker placement micro-game. The game consists of 12 cards, which are: 7 class cards, 4 player credentials cards, and one Core classes card. Additionally, there are three punch cards that contain various markers for tracking resources and player pieces.

173819.name: Neanderthal
173819.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

173820.name: Ayoayo
173820.description:
Ayoayo is a Nigerian mancala game, which is played by the Yoruba. It should not be confused with Oware, which is also sometimes called "Ayoayo" when played in Nigeria. Related games are Andada in Eritrea and Endodoi in Tanzania.

Ayoayo is played on a board of two rows, each consisting of six round pits that have a large store at either end. Each pit contains four seeds at the start.

At his turn a player takes the contents of one of his smaller holes and distributes it, one by one, counterclockwise into the following holes, but not in the stores. If the last seed falls into a non-empty hole, its contents including the last distributed seed is continued to be distributed.

The move ends when the last seed falls in an empty hole.

If the last seed falls in an empty hole on the player's own side, the seeds in the opponent's hole directly across and the seed effecting the capture are captured and placed into the store. If the emptied hole contains twelve or more seeds, it is skipped.

When the opponent has no seeds in his holes, he must get some seeds in the next move, if possible. Otherwise the game is over and the remaining seeds are captured by the player who moved last.

The player who captured most counters wins the game.

Description taken from Mancala World.

173821.name: Bird's Eye View
173821.description:
Rather clever party game.

The box contains 18 pictures and 12 answer cards.

Pablo, always wearing his sombrero, (represented by thick black rings) is a man of many parts. Our artist has drawn his impressions of some of Pablo's activities as seen through a bird's eye from above.

Distribute the pictures about the room and give each player an answer card. They should then be allowed abouf 20 minutes in which to write down their guesses as to what Pablo is supposed to be doing in each picture. The most correct answers, wins.

173823.name: Das bunte Alphabet
173823.description:
A word game for children.

In his turn, a player draws a card which will have a letter on it. He can now move one of his pawns on to a coloured space if he can think of a word that begins with the letter on his card.
On a purple space he must name an object.
On a red space he must name an animal.
On a blue space he must name a fruit or plant.
On a white space he must name a boy or girl's name.
If a correct answer is said, the player keeps the card.
Eventually, both of a players' pawns will reach the middle of the board. Everybody now tries to make the longest word they can, using the letter cards they have collected during the game. The player with the longest word, wins.

173824.name: Picture Puzzles: Familiar Phrases
boardgameversion: Party Games Publishers yellow box edition
173824.description:
Party game. The box contains 18 Picture Cards and 12 Answer Cards.
Each picture has some noticeabie feature and the words expressing it generally convey, in everyday usage, quite a different or wider meaning.
Example — 'TO SIT ON THE FENCE'
The usual Interpretation of this phrase is ' to be neutral' or ' not to take sides.' In the picture the expression is conveyed by showing hens (and boy) sitting on a fence.
Distribute the pictures about the area of play and give each player an answer card. A time limit should be fixed and the player who writes down most correct expressions is the winner.
Answer cards should be interchanged for checking.

173825.name: Towns and Cities
173825.description:
Party game with delightful cards.

The illustrated cards are placed around the room where they can easily be seen. Give each player an answer card. Set a time limit. The player who has the most correct answers when 'Time' is called, wins.

The cards feature a number of different illustrations and they are numbered. Players have to look at these images in number order and extract a number of letters from each answer to form the name of an English town or city. They give an example card. There are 5 pictures on that card.
The 1st is a Seal - use the ES
The 2nd is a Step - use the ST
The 3rd is a Bottle - use the BO
The 4th is a Nurse - use the UR
the 5th is a Net - use the NE
Thus, the answer is EA-ST-BO-UR-NE, which is a town on the southern coast of England.

173826.name: Mob Tower Promo Pack
173826.description:
Mob Tower Promo Pack was a Kickstarter cross promotion between Tower and Mob Town. The 10-card promo pack has some Tower-inspired cards in Mob Town, and some Mob Town-inspired cards in Tower.

Specifically, for Tower, two black market cards representing the law, where you can team up with undercover cops in the black market to momentarily have a conscience and thwart crooks!

And then, in Mob Town, an alternate set of cash cards, a camel law card, and a destination card featuring the wonderfully obscure city that Tower takes place in!

173827.name: Bubble Dizzy
173827.description:
Bubble Dizzy is an arcade style action video game developed by the Oliver twins and published in November 1990 by Codemasters for the Amstrad, Spectrum, DOS, Atari ST, Commodore 64 and Amiga.

The game involves Dizzy being forced to walk the plank of a pirate ship and from the sea bed use bubbles to float back to the surface and dry land. Like Dizzy Down the Rapids, this game derived from a mini-game found in The Fantastic Adventures of Dizzy.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bubble Dizzy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

173828.name: Dizzy Down the Rapids
173828.description:
Dizzy Down the Rapids is an arcade style action video game that was published in 1991 by Codemasters for the Amstrad CPC, Spectrum, DOS, Atari ST, Commodore 64 and Amiga.

The game involves Dizzy riding barrels down a river avoiding obstacles and enemies. This was another game derived from a minigame game found in The Fantastic Adventures of Dizzy like Bubble Dizzy. The game was based on the game play from an arcade game titled Toobin'. The C64 version was developed first by Paul Black. The C64 version was originally a clone of Toobin called 'Toobin Turles'. When the game was taken to Codemasters for consideration, it was rebranded to take advantage of the Dizzy character.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dizzy Down the Rapids", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

173829.name: Guess My Story
173829.description:
An English party game, loosely based on a long forgotten television show.

12 cards are provided, each of which contains a different personal “ story,” all of them famous in the sense that the Daily Press has, or would have, given them headline publicity. They are modern, historical, legendary, or fiction.

One player to be Chairman. He takes all the cards; no one eise must see them yet. He selects one card and chooses a player (the Challenger) who will answer questions as though he were the person about whom that story was made. The Challenger and the Chairman sit together facing the other players, who become the “ panel.” The Chairman announces to the panel the free information, as printed at the top of the card. This is the only “ free ” information given. The panel have to discover what the Challenger’s story is by questioning him (or her), and they ask any questions they wish, one at a time and in turn. The Challenger gives the answers, Consulting the information provided on the card about “ his own ” story. The Chairman may help and advise the Challenger in his answers. In answering questions, the Challenger should use the first person “ I.”

It is the story which has to be discovered, not necessarily the name of the person concerned, though it is usually simpler for the panel to find the name first, which will lead them to the story quickly.

The Chairman may announce a time limit, say 5 minutes, after which the panel if still unsuccessful have been defeated, and the Challenger announces his story. A new Challenger is selected for each story.

173830.name: The Book of Unwritten Tales 2
173830.description:
Like its predecessor, The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 takes place in the fantasy world of Aventásia. It’s an homage to role-playing games and fantasy worlds, and banks on the same humor as BoUT 1. Once again you play the gnome mage Wilbur, the adventurer Nate, the elf princess Ivo, and Nate’s furry companion, the Critter – alternately or simultaneously.

The game offers classic point-and-click adventure gameplay, and we are guided by the successful BoUT1 formula: Whenever possible, we offer you, the players, parallel problems to solve, so that you can alternate between puzzles. There are tons of puzzles, objects, characters and locations to discover (as a matter of fact: BoUT2 offers even MORE of that than the first part).

In short, The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 offers:


A massive, multifaceted story with about 25 hours of playtime
The trademark BoUT-Humor, lovingly spoofing WoW, LotR, Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, Discworld, The Hobbit and many more
Hundreds of weird, yet oddly logical puzzles and our well-proven “Multi-Character-Gameplay”
The established *four playable characters* Wilbur, Nate, Ivo and Critter
*Numerous beautiful locations*, improved through today’s computer alchemy
An *ensemble of quirky characters*, both well-established and hot off the drawing board
An *epic soundtrack* with many new compositions


The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 is available now for *PC, Mac and Linux*.

Source: The Publisher Website.

173831.name: Variety Quiz
173831.description:
English party game.

A quiz for your party guests. Up to 12 may play. The host or hostess will read out the questions and the players write down their answers on their answer card.

As the title suggests, the questions will fall into 5 different categories;
Proverbial Last Words: Players must name the proverb just by being told only the last word.
Car Cavalcade: Players must name the manufacturer of the listed car models.
Sur Me: Players are given eight Christian names and eight surnames. Match them correctly to make a list of eight writers.
Triangulation: Players are given a pyramid shape triangle with lines criss-crossing and must write down the correct number of triangles in the image.
Chop and Change: Players are given a statement and the answer must be two words that are anagrams of each other.

The guest with the most correct answers, wins and, hopefully, gets a small gift from the hosts.

173832.name: Dark Pyramid of Sorcerer's Isle
173832.description:
From the front page:

Long unoccupied, the pyramid on Sorcerer’s Isle now flows with strange magical energy, warping creatures and the landscape around it. The Cult of the Dragon and Red Wizards of Thay have taken notice, and it’s up to you to keep whatever power dwells there out of their hands. An adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

173833.name: Raiders of the Twilight Marsh
173833.description:
From the front page:

A black dragon’s treasure horde has been located in the Twilight Marsh, and within it are secrets that hold interest to the factions. With the dragon marauding over the countryside, the horde is left unguarded. Now is the time to plunder its lair! An adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

173834.name: Pool of Radiance Resurgent
173834.description:
From the front page:

Vorgansharax rules Phlan, using the Cult of the Dragon to extend his noxious gaze. But the green dragon seeks far more than control of the beleaguered town – ultimate power is nearly within reach. Will he reactivate the Pool of Radiance and ascend to greater prominence amongst his kind? A sequel to DDEX1-10 Tyranny in Phlan and Part Two of Under Emerald Claws. An adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

173835.description: Special Study Nr 6 of 120 pages where Kevin Zucker analyzes and presents Orders Of Battle of the different campaigns. In this one, the Danube Campaign is described in deepth and the different nations oob presented from the break of hostilities till the pursuit of Eckmühl, in April 1809. Ideal for miniatures games where OOB are needed for the recreation of different battles
boardgameaccessory: The Last Success: Napoleon's March to Vienna, 1809
173835.name: 1809 A Fatal Necessity: The companion to the Last Success

173836.name: Melee in the Mines
173836.description:
Melee in the Mines is a print-and-play microgame that pits two players against one another. The dwarves’ silver mine has cut into the tunnels of a monster lair, and now a band of adventurers is fighting for their lives in the narrow confines of the mine against a band of monsters. Each player starts with 7 of 18 characters (18 Monsters or 18 Adventurers). The winner is the party that drives the other from the mine!

Only the first character in each party can use hand-to-hand combat. Other party members can use ranged weapons or special attacks -- provided they have a clear line-of-sight over their companions’ heads. In these tight quarters, jostling for position is important. It’s great to have your troll at the head of your party, given his strength, but then no one behind him can see past him to use a ranged attack. If your halfling is at the front, everyone taller can fire over him, but he himself won’t be doing much damage.

Each turn you can either battle (roll 2 six-sided dice) or take an action (see below) and attack with 1 die. Each die roll is assigned to a character whose abilities match that roll – each card has die faces on it, with corresponding attacks: 1 = Rush, 2 = Strike, 3 = Panic, 4 = Fell, 5 = Do, 6 = Kill.

You can download the 4-page PDF from the Files section. You will need two 6-sided dice.

This game was created for the 2015 BGG Microgame Prototype Design Competition.

173837.name: Old War Horses (Issue 6 - Apr 2009)
173837.description:
From the Introduction:

Continuing from last issue, here's more info on the Family Zook and the plan that got them going on Ita for my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded game.

173838.name: Dora the Explorer Let's Go! Adventure Game Book
173838.description:
Five basic Dora the Explorer Games, to teach color and number recognition, sequencing, patterning and game play skills.

Included games are "The Race to Abuela's House", "Vines & Logs","Catch the Stars!", "The Nutty Forest Maze" and "Beach day!"

Short description per game:

The Race to Abuela's House: players spin the spinner to race to Abuela's house, but if they land on an obstacle, they need the spinner to land on the corresponding tool before moving on.

Vines & Logs: shortened version of chutes (logs) and ladders (vines).

Catch the Stars!: the game board shows a pattern with six different colours. Players spin the spinner (that shows colours now) to spin the required colours for their next step, in a race to the other side of the board, where te stars await.

The Nutty Forest Maze: players spin the spinner to race to Tico's treehouse. They have to choose the right way through the maxe, and can loose turns (when encountering Swiper the fox) or getting extra moves (when encountering stars).

Beach Day!: players spin the spinner and move to the first next square showing the same picture as the picture shown by the spinner to race to the beach (candy land variation).

173839.name: Old War Horses (Issue 7 - Apr 2009)
173839.description:
From the Introduction:

Last time, I covered the Zook brothers and now I continue with other members of the crew of the Ning Po.

boardgameimplementation: Clash Along the Psel: The Battle of Kursk 1943
173840.description:
Clash Along the Psel I: A brand new take on the Battle of Kursk, with Tigers, a contested river crossing ... and Russian counter-attacks. A titanic struggle, recreated in detail down to the last tank ... squad ... and forward observer!

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included, along with ALL NEW FOLIO STYLE packaging.
IMPORTANT NOTE: This product contains ALL the combat counters you need to play -- IT IS NOT A COMPLETE GAME. You need small and large marker counter sheets and the ATS Rules Binder/Play Aid set to use this product.
173840.name: ATS Core Module: Clash Along The Psel I

173841.name: Skæg med tal-spillet
173841.description:
Det er skægt at tælle med Hr. Skæg.
I dette spil for førskolebørn lærer de små børn at genkende tallene fra 1 til 10, at tælle fra 1 til 10 og at øve sig på at skrive tallene.
Drej pilen, flyt brikken på spillepladen og udfør opgaven på kortet. Børnene skal tælle ting, skrive tal, hente ting og pege på ting med forkerte farver. Desuden skal de hoppe forskellige slags hop. For hver opgave barnet klarer vinder det en Skægbrik til sin samleplade.

IN ENGLISH:


It is fun to count with Hr. Skæg.
In this game pre-school children learn to recognize, write and count the numbers from 1 to 10.
Turn the arrow, move the gamepiece on the board and do the task on the card. The children must count, write numbers, find things og point at objects with wrong colors. And they get to jump different kinds of jumps. For each task the child does, it wins a Skæg-token for the pointboard.

173842.description:
Clash Along the Psel II: A never before presented battlefield -- the push north out of the Psel River crossing .. and the Russian response? Also includes 2 BRAND NEW never before published maps, Central Stalingrad I and Tin Pan Alley, Sevastopol -- with and exciting and detailed scenario to play (and replay) on each!

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included,
173842.name: ATS Core Module: Clash Along The Psel II

173843.name: Old War Horses (Issue 8 - Apr 2009)
173843.description:
From the Introduction:

Continuing with the crew of the Ning Po for my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded Campaign, here are the chief engineer and the cargo master. That makes five crew.

173844.name: Old War Horses (Issue 9 - Apr 2009)
173844.description:
From the Introduction:

So I've introduced y'all to the crew of the Ning Po for my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded game: Capt. Ramsey Zook, Xun Ren St. Cyr (Pilot), Taras Maksim Yan Sidorov (Cook), Caesar Briko (Cargo Master), and Prospero Jones (Engineer). Now here are their connections to the 'Verse.

173845.name: Old War Horses (Issue 10 - Apr 2009)
173845.description:
From the Introduction:

Again with the Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded game, I continue with more 3x3s for the crew of the Ning Po: Pilot Xun Ren St. Cyr and Taras Maksim Yan Sidorov the Cook.

173846.name: Undead States of America: The Zombie War Card Game
173846.description:
You aren't trying to escape a neighborhood filled with walking dead - that was weeks ago. This isn't about survival any more.

This is war.

The object of Undead States of America is to gather survivors and hold off the undead masses. It is up to you to rally refugees, build safe zones and lead your rag-tag forces through a psychological nightmare. In the end, you will find your army of men, women & children surrounded. Only then will you learn if you've prepared well enough to secure a future for the human race... (from the back of the box)

Players attempt to build a cadre of fellow survivors, giving them a place to stay and supplies. There are cards for survivors, supplies, military action (even a nuke!), and even for antagonists (used to fight against you). The winner is who has scored the best after surviving 4 years.

173847.name: Terraria: Otherworld
173847.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game is announced but has not been released yet and is NOT sold yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




Set in an alternate dimension within the Terraria universe, Terraria: Otherworld places the player in a life-and-death struggle to restore a once-pristine world – now overrun by a malevolent force that has corrupted nature itself – to its original splendor.

Combining elements of sandbox gameplay with role-playing and strategy elements, Terraria: Otherworld explores the Terraria experience in an innovative and unique way - providing a fresh approach to the "open world" genre.

Source: The Game Website.

173848.name: The Demon Shaman
173848.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter the demon shaman, a blasphemous class so dedicated to the ideals of the wicked outsiders that he slowly morphs into one over time. With his equally sadistic babau cohort, the demon shaman is a dark force to be reckoned with.

Inside:

The Demon Shaman!
Sixteen demonic morphs!
Favored class options!
Nine feats specifically for the new class!
A gorgeous painting of a demon shaman and his babau buddy!
Ten demon shaman archetypes! [Babau Master, Doomed Shaman, Plague Shaman, Servant of the Rakshasa Lord, Shaman of the Apocalypse, Shaman of Baphomet, Shaman of the Nine-Tailed Fox, Shaman of Orcus, Shaman of the Ravager, and Shaman of Vampiric Blood]
Two demon shaman NPCs with statblocks, ready to run villains or interesting allies!

173849.name: February 2015 Free Monster of the Month: Chaos Ape
173849.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presenting the Chaos Ape an all-new free CR 6 monster for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

The chaos ape is a violent, rage-filled demon with massive arms and a horned bird skull head.

173850.name: Deadly Missions: Operation Breakout
173850.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take part in Operation Breakout and try to rescue downed pilots captured by rebels.

Operation Breakout provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting game set in modern times (or near future). It consists of GM’s notebook as well as stylized handouts which can be printed and presented to players

Please note that the supplement is stat free and can be used in any modern/future game.

The supplement consists of two sections:

Documentation (GM section):
Area map;
A Location map;
A rebel camp map
and more

Intel files ( Players handouts):
Briefing files;
Intel maps,





Please note that Intel files are sometimes slightly different than material for GM. This is not a mistake - simply secret service couldn't get accurate data.

173851.name: Sewer Hideout
173851.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Sewer Hideout is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Sewer Hideout comprises 2 rooms that would be the ideal location for thieves, smugglers or anyone else that has cause to hide in the sewers. One room serves as a dock and warehouse, full of crates and barrels near a small boat. The other room contains two simple beds, some chests and a table where a game of cards is in session.

Also included:

A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.




This set is compatible with the 2.5D crafting system, a crafting technique for making dungeon tiles more than 2D but not quite 3D. The 2.5D system was created by DM Scotty (Google his forum for tips)

173852.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (Compendium 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Caves & Caverns: The Last Nail (EL 8; XP 4,800)
Freelance Advice: Are YOU A Pixie Dust Designer?
Gaming Advice: 6 Ways To Help New Players
Gaming Advice: How to Build Your Own Gaming Kit
Gaming Advice: What Has Gaming Done For Me?
GM Advice: 4 Reasons To Have A Barroom Brawl
GM Advice: 5 Ways to Improve Your GMing
GM Advice: 6 Lessons in Adventure Design From Bond Films
GM Advice: Designing Unique Magic Items
GM Advice: How and Why To Say "No"
GM Advice: How to Deal with GM Fatigue
GM Advice: How to use the Slow Advancement Track
GM Advice: Why I Love the Slow Advancement Track
GM Advice: Why Urban Adventures Are Different
GM’s Advice: 8 Tips For Beginning GMs
Player Advice: Principles of Successful Adventuring
So What's The Zombie Like Anyway?: Zombie Templates
Star Run Falls At a Glance
