The Sunken Pyramid: New Magic Items
The Twilight Demesne At A Glance
Tribes Most Foul: Goblins of the Black Fur
173852.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible GM's Resource by Christian Alipounarian, Alexander Augunas, Aaron Bailey, John Bennett, Creighton Broadhurst, Robert Brookes, Alex Connell, Eric Hindley, Greg Marks, Eric Menge, Brian Wiborg Mønster, David Posener, Marc Radle, Jacob Trier, Josh Vogt and Nicholas Wasko and Mike Welham

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s own Borderland of Adventure campaign, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM. GM’s Monthly Miscellany: Compendium 2014 collates the material presented in the first eleven instalments of the line as well as new material including backdrops and new advice articles, all designed to make running your game as simple and easy as possible.

This is a compilation product and features all the material presented in the first 11 GM’s Monthly Miscellany (which are all available for free here in this store). There is no need to buy this product if you own all the previous line instalments. However, if you do buy GM’s Monthly Miscellany: Compendium 2014, know your generosity helps me to not only run my blog but also to keep writing daily gaming advice articles.

173853.name: The Pellinen Islands
173853.description:
From the Back Cover:

The Pellinen Islands - The rocky shores, soaring peaks, fertile valleys, and above all, the grasslands teeming with the tribal herds of ancient nations. Here the fates of nations play out in the most dangerous ways. Courts of intrigue, ruthless traders, secret societies, and a rift between churches that may never heal. The Pellinen Islands are not for the faint of heart; they are the lands where legends are sung, and passed down through the generations. The Pellinen Islands are where the ancient tribes fight for survival (and conquest) against the usurper kingdoms who have continually pushed their boundaries as their populations have grown. The Pellinen Islands are a seafaring land full of traders plying the worlds’ seas, and returning with the riches of many lands to fill their own coffers.

What buried secrets lie in the mountains? What intrigue in court will cause today's favored councillor to fall? What fortune will be lost or won in a shrewd deal on the Kfanelaw? And where will your next adventure take you? The Pellinen Islands await!

The Pellinen Islands include:

84 pages filled with new lands and places for your characters to explore 
A full-color map of the islands, loaded with reference data and additional maps of languages, politics, and other information
Over a two dozen sidebars with notes on the culture and lifestyles of the Pellinen Islands
Over 15 new countries, half a dozen new cities, and over a dozen new characters to meet on the way
More than 20 location maps to give the characters somewhere to start

173854.name: Firefly Cortex
173854.description:
User Summary
Combination advertisment/news app/account manager for Firefly Online and two minigames. The minigames require paying a one-time fee. Payment on one platform unlocks it on all platforms.

Minigame 1: Navigation
Quickly find three bodies in the 'Verse. The "Practice level" is always available, and has no timer. The daily and weekly are once per, and are timed; finding the bodies in the allotted time earns reward crates.

Minigame 2: Card Collection
Collect sets of virtual collector cards to unlock goodies which will be available in Firefly Online. Cards can be purchased with in-app purchases as well as by playing the navigation minigame, by reading news blurbs, using the app to go check the facebook and twitter feeds, and reading the description text for each world in the navigation area.

173855.description:
The game represent race of sailboats. They start from the shore. There are different paths between many islands. Players roll dice and move figurines from field to field in direction of paths.

The first who reach finish gets the most points, but points are also received by collecting counters along the path, by standing on marked field next to counter. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.
173855.name: Regata

173856.name: Viteška trka
173856.description:
Knight race. The game presents racing of knights. There are different paths. Players roll dice and move figurines in direction of paths.

First who reach finish gets the most points, but points are also received by collecting counters along the path, by standing on marked field next to counter. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

173857.name: Šmizling
173857.description:
Šmizling is a game for girls. On the board is presented a shopping center. In stores can be purchased (collected) different clothing items (counters), by standing on marked field next to counter.

The task in not to collect as many counters, but to make certain outfits. The first player who succeed in that is the winner.

173858.description:
Tiger in hunt is a simple game for children. Each player has one figurine representing a tiger. On the board are counters where are pictures of various animals that are food for tigers.

Players collect counters by standing on marked field next to counter. Players need to collect as many counters as possbile.
173858.name: Tigar u lovu

173859.description:
World of Silence is an educational game. Playing the game children learn about animals that live in the sea. Animals are divided by groups: fishes, mammals, reptiles, birds, soft shells, crabs ...

Each player has one figurine, which represents a diver. Divers swim and take photos of a variety of animals, by standing on field with counter. Each photograph (counter) brings one point. It is important to collect as many counter, but it is more important that the counters are in different colors. Each color represents one group of animals.
173859.name: Svet tišine

173860.description:
Photo Safari is a simple game for younger players. Each player has one figurine. The figurine represents off road vehicle in which are visitors of safari park. There are different paths.

On the board are counters with pictures of different animals. Players collect counters (photos) by standing on marked filed next to counter. During the game, players need to collect as many counters.
173860.name: Foto safari

173861.name: Arcana Journal (Issue 69 - Feb 2015)
173861.description:
From publisher blurb:

The true wonders of Arcana are explored in the monthly journals. Each issue focuses on a hex within the game world, offering rumors, hidden lore, and detailed descriptions of all the important sites and people of that area. Full color maps (also offered in print-easy black and white) are provided on the hex itself, plus all sites of worthwhile note, such as towns and major adventure sites. Floor plans of castles and other location are also offered.

In addition to this detailed write-up of the hex, each issue will also focus on other aspects of the game world, its history, important people, the Magi and gaming classes. When you add it all up, these journals take the mundane and make it magical. It is through the journals that the Arcana game world will grow, expand, and become a living place of adventure.

This issue of the Journal will cover the following aspects of the game world.

House Foxlight
School of Mystisim
Dress of the Elves

173862.name: Ninja
173862.description:
From back of the box:

Object of the game:
Ninja warriors attack the Fortress. The defenders inside the Fortress walls must prevent them from stealing the treasure.

Ninja is a simple game of movement and dice combat. One player is the attacker while the other player is the defender. Each player's ninja pieces show its movement, range, and attack properties. When two pieces battle, each player adds the attack number of their battling piece to the roll of two dice, with the highest total winning the battle. Eventually, the defender will either have prevented the attacker from stealing the treasure, or the attacker will make off with the treasure, winning the game. It is suggested that two rounds are played, with players switching roles and comparing the points that they gained when they played the attacker in order to determine a winner.

173863.name: Big Time Three
173863.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each set in the Dungeons in Blue Big Time series contains twelve brand-new geomorphs featuring extra-wide hallways and cavern passages, along with the usual assortment of rooms, chambers and caves. Check out the convenient preview to see exactly what your getting in Big Time Three.

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes twelve unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. The set includes two versions of each tile, one for players and one for GMs. The GM's version shows additional features, tricks, and traps. This set includes (BT1-BT12):

Six 100x100 foot tiles.
Six 50x100 foot tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

173864.name: Arrezzo
173864.description:
Arrezzo is played on 8x8 board with a green and a red set of 16 playing pieces with symbols on top. Each set has 2 monks (a cross ), 2 ladies (a circle), 2 lords (a star ), 6 farmers (a square) and 4 knights (a triangle).

These symbols hint on the direction of the slides and jumps every piece is able to make.
Slides are towards a free square in any ortagonal or diagonal direction.
Jumps are combinations ortagonal or diagonal jumps across your own or opponents pieces, depending on the type of piece. Multiple jumps are possible.

Starting from your own two base lines object of the game is to move all your pieces off the board on the opposite side and prevent the opponent from doing so.

173865.name: John Doe - Gioco di Ruolo
173865.description:
publisher blurb
Il gioco di ruolo di John Doe nasce dall’omonimo fumetto pubblicato dall’Eura Editoriale.

L’ambientazione vede un mondo del tutto simile al nostro, in cui piccole divinità e leggende urbane vivono dissimulate dagli esseri umani e nel quale le Entità (personificazioni di concetti come Morte, Tempo, Guerra, e altri ancora) fanno sì che ogni cosa vada come deve andare secondo il volere delle Alte Sfere, i sostituti in carica del Grande Capo, che ha deciso di prendersi una bella vacanza dalla sua Creazione...

Il sistema di gioco utilizzato è il d100 System della Chaosium, lo stesso del Richiamo di Cthulhu e Stormbringer. Sono state però introdotte alcune sostanziali modifiche in grado di renderlo più fedele al fumetto e di permettere ai giocatori di sentirsi maggiormente calati nell’atmosfera ideata dagli autori, che hanno supervisionato e approvato il lavoro finale. Un’atmosfera che mescola gli elementi più disparati: dal gotico moderno ai film d’azione, al noir o al citazionismo filmico e telefilmico, passando per tinte ora ironiche ora decisamente più tese.

Il tutto confezionato con immagini originali del fumetto, tre tavole inedite illustrate da Alessio Fortunato e la copertina creata appositamente da Massimo Carnevale.

Idea originale di: Roberto Recchioni e Lorenzo Bartoli
Autori: Francesca Guidi, Cristiano Brignola e Giovanni Di Pietro
Illustrazioni: Alessio Fortunato e Massimo Carnevale

translation by Google
Il gioco di ruolo di John Doe nasce dall’omonimo fumetto pubblicato dall’Eura Editoriale.

L’ambientazione vede un mondo del tutto simile al nostro, in cui piccole divinità e leggende urbane vivono dissimulate dagli esseri umani e nel quale le Entità (personificazioni di concetti come Morte, Tempo, Guerra, e altri ancora) fanno sì che ogni cosa vada come deve andare secondo il volere delle Alte Sfere, i sostituti in carica del Grande Capo, che ha deciso di prendersi una bella vacanza dalla sua Creazione...

Il sistema di gioco utilizzato è il d100 System della Chaosium, lo stesso del Richiamo di Cthulhu e Stormbringer. Sono state però introdotte alcune sostanziali modifiche in grado di renderlo più fedele al fumetto e di permettere ai giocatori di sentirsi maggiormente calati nell’atmosfera ideata dagli autori, che hanno supervisionato e approvato il lavoro finale. Un’atmosfera che mescola gli elementi più disparati: dal gotico moderno ai film d’azione, al noir o al citazionismo filmico e telefilmico, passando per tinte ora ironiche ora decisamente più tese.

Il tutto confezionato con immagini originali del fumetto, tre tavole inedite illustrate da Alessio Fortunato e la copertina creata appositamente da Massimo Carnevale.

Idea originale di: Roberto Recchioni e Lorenzo Bartoli
Autori: Francesca Guidi, Cristiano Brignola e Giovanni Di Pietro
Illustrazioni: Alessio Fortunato e Massimo Carnevale

173866.name: Kovlyn Hide
173866.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kovlyn Hide wasn't always called Kovlyn Hide, but the original name of the stronghold is long lost. Whatever it was called, the name became irrelevant when it was overwhelmed, the garrison slaughtered, and the site abandoned. Over the years the locals came to know it as Kovlyn Hide. Kovlyn Hide has a new garrison - but now it is goblins and their King Garmog, who sits in his dark throne room, greedily hording treasures his soldiers have found in the ruins of Kovlyn Hide.


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A small stronghold dungeon, built into rock. The entrance doors have been broken down, but there is evidence of habitation. Sections of corridor and rooms are blocked with rubble from roof collapses, but there are still several routes that lead to the throne room of the Goblin King.

Uses: Sneak into the dungeon and steal the most treasured possession of the Goblin King; Play as the goblins and protect your home from marauding knights intent on destroying your family; Explore the ruins and vaniquish ancient evils; seek the wisdom of the spirits of the original inhabitants of the stronghold.

Also included is a 300dpi full size jpg, for poster printing or VTT.

173867.name: The Blacksmith's Burden (Pathfinder)
173867.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the party arrives in the small village of Goldendale they find a shortage of metal goods and a community upset with the lack of production. Despite their admiration for the village blacksmith, folks grow concerned about his inability to complete the simplest jobs even though they hear the ring of his hammer throughout the night...

This 26-page sidetrek details the various NPC's and features in the village of Goldendale as well as the areas (and opposition) the party must investigate to unravel the mystery of the blacksmith’s burden.

This adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game is intended for characters of levels 2 - 4 and can be incorporated into any setting. It features hooks at the start and finish to draw the characters in as well as to spur on further adventures. The encounters feature maps and stat blocks for creatures not found in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiary and guidelines for supplemental encounters.

The Blacksmith's Burden is well suited for those times when adventurers go "looking for excitement" when they stop off in a backwater town on the way to their next quest.

173868.name: The Blacksmith's Burden (5E)
173868.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the party arrives in the small village of Goldendale they find a shortage of metal goods and a community upset with the lack of production. Despite their admiration for the village blacksmith, folks grow concerned about his inability to complete the simplest jobs even though they hear the ring of his hammer throughout the night...

This 24-page sidetrek details the various NPC's and features in the village of Goldendale as well as the areas (and opposition) the party must investigate to unravel the mystery of the blacksmith’s burden.

This adventure is compatible with the 5th (and earlier "classic") editions of Dungeons & Dragons. It is intended for characters of levels 2 - 4 and can be incorporated into any setting. It features hooks at the start and finish to draw the characters in as well as to spur on further adventures. The encounters feature maps and stat blocks for all of the party's foes.

The Blacksmith's Burden is well suited for those times when adventurers go "looking for excitement" when they stop off in a backwater town on the way to their next quest.

173869.name: The Blacksmith's Burden (4E)
173869.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the party arrives in the small village of Goldendale they find a shortage of metal goods and a community upset with the lack of production. Despite their admiration for the village blacksmith, folks grow concerned about his inability to complete the simplest jobs even though they hear the ring of his hammer throughout the night...

This 25-page sidetrek details the various NPC's and features in the village of Goldendale as well as the areas (and opposition) they must investigate to unravel the mystery of the blacksmith’s burden.

This adventure for Dungeons & Dragons, 4th Edition is intended for characters of levels 1 - 3 and can be incorporated into any setting. It features hooks at the start and finish to draw the characters in as well as spur on further adventures. The encounters feature maps and stat blocks for all creatures to minimize flipping between rulebooks.

The Blacksmith's Burden is well suited for those times when adventurers go "looking for excitement" when they stop off in a backwater town on the way to their next quest.

173870.name: Sheeplike
173870.description:
Sheeplike is a Theocratic Card Game for family worship based upon going out in the ministry and finding Sheeplike ones and starting bible studies while avoiding Do Not Calls. 2-4 players ages 9+ can play in 30-60 min using tools like the bible, pioneers, Jesus and even Jehovah to win the householders hearts over. The goal is the first player to 4 bible studies. You gain a bible study by finding the Sheeplike one out in the territory or be the last player still in the round.

Setup: The territory consists of 9 cards (houses) grouped in 3 piles hiding where the Sheeplike and Do Not Call cards are. Shuffle the Sheeplike, Do Not Call and 1 Not Interested cards and create 3 piles. Then deal 2 more territory cards on top of the 3 piles. Players are each dealt 1 card each from the publisher cards.

The game consists of 2 stages:

Door To Door: Players draw and play cards searching through the territory stacks for the Sheeplike one. There are 17 publisher cards that allow players to flip the cards in the territory and move cards around within the stacks. This allows for players to hide traps and uncover the Sheeplike card. If a Do Not Call is flipped without the protection of the Bible card, that player has to sit out of the current round. If the Sheeplike one is not found by the time that there is no more publisher cards to draw from then the next stage starts.

Return Visit: Once all cards have been drawn from the publisher draw pile. All players turns over their one card in their hand. Whoever has the highest value card, they get the first pick of where they think the Sheeplike card is at. Remember the players have had a few turns to deduce the most likely location of the Sheeplike one. So when the publisher pile is getting low, it is good to hold onto higher value cards.

173871.name: The Eternal Rest
173871.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Eternal Rest is an inn that treats its patrons to a most macabre experience. Staffed by animated skeletons and operated by an eccentric necromancer, the inn provides a complete, ready to use setting when the game master needs to serve up a quick meeting place or overnight stay for the party without resorting to "just another inn."

This 19-page supplement is suitable for any game system. It details the inn, its staff (both living and dead), and the unusual “regulars” found at the bar. The inn, the neighboring graveyard, and the catacombs-turned-private-rooms are all mapped in detail. In addition to plot hooks seeded throughout the profile of the inn, several more adventure hooks appear at the end, and all material can be easily placed in any fantasy setting you might choose to play.

The Eternal Rest can serve as a departure from the usual layover for adventurers, or it can become a base of operations for characters who like a little gloom with their drinks between quests.

173872.name: 5 Fantasy Barkeeps, Volume I: Sources of Knowledge
173872.description:
From publisher blurb:

Often, the barkeep is little more than a two-dimensional construct, a blank slate meant to deliver information that directs the heroes towards other action. Before long, the barkeep becomes The Barkeep, an interchangeable piece of furniture just like the stools, tankards, and tables. Instead, bring the barkeep into the foreground. Use the five unusual figures here to have a fleshed-out figure at the ready and use their story hooks to tie them to the characters or tease the party in new directions.

Each of the five barkeeps has a pair of hooks that could give them a direct, immediate connection to one of the PCs. Another pair of plot hooks attached to the barkeeps present quick story options to further develop the adventure for the entire party.

This 14-page supplement is suitable for any game system. It details the appearance, demeanor, and history of each barkeep along with information to add further depth and sow the seeds of potential storylines to invovle the PCs. All material can be easily placed in any fantasy setting you might choose to play.

Five Fantasy Barkeeps, Volume 1 can serve as a handy resource to serve up a unique NPC with only a moment's notice. There are also two handy tables for last minute information:

20 Things Barely Overheard
6 Drink Specials

173873.name: 5 Fantasy Barkeeps, Volume II: Suspicious Motives
173873.description:
From publisher blurb:

Often, the barkeep is little more than a two-dimensional construct, a blank slate meant to deliver information that directs the heroes towards other action. Before long, the barkeep becomes The Barkeep, an interchangeable piece of furniture just like the stools, tankards, and tables. Instead, bring the barkeep into the foreground. Use the five unusual figures here to have a fleshed-out figure at the ready and use their story hooks to tie them to the characters or tease the party in new directions.

Each of the five barkeeps has a pair of hooks that could give them a direct, immediate connection to one of the PCs. Another pair of plot hooks attached to the barkeeps present quick story options to further develop the adventure for the entire party.

This 14-page supplement is suitable for any game system. It details the appearance, demeanor, and history of each barkeep along with information to add further depth and sow the seeds of potential storylines to invovle the PCs. All material can be easily placed in any fantasy setting you might choose to play.

Five Fantasy Barkeeps, Volume 2: Suspicious Motives can serve as a handy resource to serve up a unique NPC with only a moment's notice. There are also two handy tables for last minute information:

20 Shady Conversations Overheard
12 Items Palmed into a PCs Hand by a Stranger

173874.name: Arc Threads
173874.description:
From publisher blurb:

Following on the heels of our popular universal supplements, Character Webs and Species and Societies, comes Arc Threads. This book is an invaluable resource for GMs of any game system.

Are you pressed for time or lack inspiration to create your story? Arc Threads has all you need to form the broad strokes of a campaign for any RPG in seconds. There's also a section on creating villains.

Like our other Background books, Arc Threads uses Thunderegg Publications' Generator pages that let you determine multiple data items with a single dice throw. You'll need a single D8 and 8 D6s in assorted colors.

173875.name: Superfight: The Loot Crate Deck
173875.description: This is a 100 card version of the viral card game superfight, designed by Skybound for sale on Loot Crate . These cards are only available in this exclusive deck. Create hilarious fighters with these cards, then argue over who would win in a fight between them.

173876.name: Old War Horses (Issue 11 - Apr 2009)
173876.description:
From the Introduction:

The final 3x3 installment for the last two crewmembers of the Ning Po for my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded game: Caesar Briko the cargo-master and Prospero Jones the mechanic.

173877.name: Old War Horses (Issue 12 - Apr 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Ita, the S & H are Silent
173877.description:
From the Introduction:

So, I've outlined the situation, the player characters and their connections for my Serenity/Firefly-Deadland Reloaded game. I've given them the sketchiest of bases, people to interact with and a general goal. Now I'll outline some more of the environment they find themselves in.

173878.name: We Have Goats!
173878.description:
Coming to Kickstarter May 26, 2015. Innovative tabletop game, with zombie kittens, goat drones, and internet trolls. We Have Goats is a tile-placement racing game that's easy to pick up. The goal is to get each of your goats to their home pen, while building the board with tile cards and obstacles. Goat-astrophe cards shift and rearrange the tiles (goat-nadoes, goat-quakes, goat-namis & goat-portals), and the "Goat Lab" cards give your goats special abilities.

Also, there's a chupacabrasaurus.

173879.name: Old War Horses (Issue 13 - Apr 2009)
173879.description:
From the Introduction:

This issue, I'll talk about what this campaign isn't going to include.

173880.name: Loonacy: Exclusive ThinkGeek Expansion
173880.description: An expansion for Loonacy containing five new cards featuring Timmy the Monkey, ThinkGeek's mascot. This expansion was included for free in many packages sent to ThinkGeek customers.

173881.name: Old War Horses (Issue 14 - Apr 2009)
173881.description:
From the Introduction:

So I've written 13 issues all about my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded campaign so far and I think they are going pretty well. Last issue, I wrote about some issues that I wasn't going to include in the game and here’s some info on what I am going to do.

173882.name: Old War Horses (Issue 15 - Apr 2009)
173882.description:
From the Introduction:

Here's information on the region of space around Ita. I've used the 'Verse map from Stellar Cartography.

173883.name: Old War Horses (Issue 16 - Apr 2009)
173883.description:
From the Introduction:

Last issue, I talked about some moons and asteroids nearby Ita. This issue, I'll cover some people that the crew will meet during their journeys.

First, the PCs need a good bad guy/crime–boss to go up against. I'm not going to have the game be about beating down an underworld Don but I figure that if I have one in the works, then I can pop him in anytime I want. And he's gonna be a good foil for the PCs.

173884.name: Old War Horses (Issue 17 - Apr 2009)
173884.description:
From the Introduction:

In this issue, I continue my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded setting info, adding info on a moon near Celena (rim–ward from Ita) that has an interesting contact group and a hidden treasure!

173885.name: Old War Horses (Issue 18 - Apr 2009)
173885.description:
From the Introduction:

I'm still working on my Serenity/Firefly campaign using the Deadlands Reloaded system. This issue of Old War Horses includes a list of items and situations that can be found in the Black.

173886.name: Old War Horses (Issue 19 - May 2009)
173886.description:
From the Introduction:

Not quite 20 issues of Old War Horses and I'm still going strong on my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded campaign. This issue I'll add some characters that the PCs will encounter playing poker.

173887.name: Don't Explode
173887.description:
It is a glorious, shining moment for the National Space Program: launch day is finally here. The crew is suited up and looking dashing, journalists are lined up for miles, and the sky is clear and inviting. There's just one problem: due to a bureaucratic mishap, the rockets aren't scheduled to be assembled until next Tuesday.

You and the other players are high-ranking scientists at the National Space Program, competing to put together the best rocket you possibly can in the final ten minutes before launch. Whoever builds the rocket that gets closest to space, without exploding or suffering a similar fatal catastrophe, wins the game and keeps their job. If every rocket is destroyed, the winner is whoever got the closest.

Don't Explode takes place over two phases, Construction and Launch. During Construction, players will draft cards from the construction deck and add components to their control module, in order to build the best rocket they possibly can in the limited time available. During Launch, players will see how well they did, by using the components which make up their rocket to advance their pawn from the Earth to space (or as close to space as they can get).

173888.name: Il Richiamo di Gatthulhu
173888.description:
From the back of the book:
Il Richiamo di Gatthulhu è il gioco di ruolo in cui i gatti salvano il mondo e gli umani servono i croccantini.

English translation:
Il Richiamo di Gatthulhu is the role-playing game where cats save the world and humans serve cookies.


publisher blurb
Nel Richiamo di Gatthulhu i giocatori assumono il ruolo di gatti dall’apparenza normale che si oppongono ai disegni del caos cosmico. Potenti entità come Sgnaulathotep, il viscido Ghranranothoa e Haspurr dall’Occhio Giallo istigano i loro cultisti a distruggere la civiltà umana – l’origine di tutte le comodità per il felino moderno! Un giocatore ricopre il ruolo del Gattaro, che prepara i piani segreti, le sfide e le ricompense e guida gli altri nel loro progresso attraverso la gattavventura. Le regole sono semplici e veloci e pongono l’accento sull’astuzia dei giocatori e sulla gioia dell’essere felini. Il mondo è minacciato dall’oscurità e dal caos, ma i nostri eroi pelosi sanno come difenderlo... quasi sempre.

Questo manuale contiene la versione Deluxe del Richiamo di Gatthulhu (Call of Catthulhu)

translation by Google
In Recall Gatthulhu players assume the role of normal-looking cats who oppose the designs of cosmic chaos. Powerful entity as Sgnaulathotep, the slimy Ghranranothoa and Haspurr dall'Occhio Yellow instigate their cultists to destroy human civilization - the origin of all modern conveniences for feline! A player has the role of Gattaro, which prepares the secret plans, challenges and rewards and guide others in their progress through the gattavventura. The rules are simple and fast, and place emphasis on subtlety of the players and the joy of felines. The world is threatened by the darkness and chaos, but our heroes hairy know how to defend it ... almost always.

This manual contains the Deluxe version of Call of Gatthulhu (Call of Catthulhu)

173890.name: Arcane Avventure
173890.description:
From the back of the book:
Scopri oceani dimenticati nella profondità della terra! Parti alla ricerca di leggendari tesori! Affronta creature perfide e malvagie!

English translation:
Discover forgotten oceans in the depths of the earth! Travel looking for legendary treasures! Fight treacherous and evil creatures!

173891.name: A Step to Victory
173891.description:
A bonus game with "kono simuge ga sugoi 2013".

This is a 2 pages leaflet game inside the book titled above.

This game covers the Bougainville campaign from American landing on Torokina to the end of war.

The rule is printed in first page with units, and the map is printed in second page. So, you must first make the units.

The game uses very basic land operation sequences, move and combat. This game uses differential CRT instead of usual combat ratio.

The game ends in 10 turns. And victory is decided by the number of locations the American side has captured.

173892.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Thousand Young
boardgameexpansion: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)
173892.description:
Deep in the bowels of the fetid swamps and shadowed woods of Louisiana, evil lurks. Dark Priests of hidden religions make blood sacrifices in the name of the All Mother, The Black Goat of the Woods, the mighty and terrible Shub-Niggurath. Soon this darkness will cover all of the city of New Orleans, for her thousand young are spreading and ready for flesh…

The Thousand Young is the ninth deluxe expansion for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. Its 165 cards (three copies each of 55 different cards) add new depth and resilience to the Shub-Niggurath faction. Nearly two-thirds of the expansion’s cards bolster the All Mother’s ranks with Ghouls, Dark Young, Monsters, Mi-Go, and Cultists. You’ll also find ghastly new Locations, foul Curses, and a new version of the Villainous Dark Mother, herself.

Still, the Black Goat of the Woods is not the region’s only corrupting influence. In the heart of the Big Easy, Nyarlathotep’s many Avatars play a deep and complicated game, manipulating human agencies and monstrous cultists, alike. These Avatars infiltrate every one of the game’s eight factions, even as the factions all gain mysterious new Locations that afford players new interactions with the top cards of their decks.

173893.name: Fotbollsspelet
173893.description:
Fotbollsspelet (“The Soccer Game”) is a two player game where your soccer knowledge decides the outcome. The rulebook also provides rules for playing the game with more players, in teams, making it a cooperative game.

You play as in real soccer, with passes, clinches, shots, penalties, and offside. Eventually you will discover how important cooperation between the single players are for teamwork. Dice rolling and event cards will bring in randomness, just like in a real game of soccer.

Situation cards with questions about soccer rules are an important part of the game. If you know the rules, it will give you advantages in the game. If you don’t, you will learn the rules playing Fotbollsspelet.

173894.name: Eldorado: La grande corsa all'oro
173894.description: A game set in the Wild West at the time of the gold miners. In the first part of the game players turn to the cities to equip, after facing the journey to the mountain to climb and reach the large deposit of gold. During the journey will find gold and dangers such as Indians and bandits, who can overcome only with equipment cards collected before. Upon reaching the summit of the mountain by a player what he found most gold is the winner.

173895.name: Parasite
173895.description:
Parasites have invaded a zoo in a small town. They are moving from host to host trying to exploit all the different animals. Players will take on the role of parasites and their respective hosts in an attempt to gain or steal the most points by the end of the game.

The game is played with a deck of cards containing a set of colored host cards for each player numbered 2,3,4 and 5. The deck also contains special action cards, one for each player.

Players will also receive four parasite tokens of their selected color valued 1,2,3 and 4. The players colored host cards and parasite tokens represent potential points.

The game starts with one card turned face up next to the draw pile. Drawn cards will be placed next to this card. A new row will start after five cards have been drawn.

On your turn players can (1) place a parasite on a host card, (2) move a parasite to an adjacent host or action card, (3) draw a card to place in play or (4) pass.

Drawing a card will activate a scoring phase. All previous cards are then evaluated for scoring condition. Cards of your color without any parasite tokens score the full value for the player. Cards with parasites where the value of the parasites are of less than value that the host card it is on will score points for the owner of the parasite and card owner. EXAMPLE: A three green parasite on a five blue host card will score three points for green and two points for blue.

Cards where the total of the parasites is equal to or more than the host card total, will NOT score for either player. Action cards allow players to perform a special action like move other players tokens or look through the deck.

The game is over when all the cards have been drawn and placed into the play area. The player with the highest point after all the cards have been drawn is the winner.

173896.description:
Two additional adventures for use in Castle Ravenloft, including one concerning the Sunsword—which may well prove instrumental in the hunt for the nefarious count Strahd.

Zombie Guards of Castle Ravenloft

The Heroes are trapped in the crypts of Castle Ravenloft with a horde of zombies. They must find the exit and escape with their lives!
Goal: Find the Secret Stairway and escape the crypts.
Number of Heroes: 2 to 5 Heroes (group adventure).

Search for the Sunsword

The Heroes seek a magic sword's missing piece. Once assembled, the legendary Sunsword becomes a powerful weapon against the evil threatening Barovia.
Goal: You must recover the last piece of the Sunsword from the crypts below Castle Ravenloft.
Number of Heroes: 2 to 5 Heroes (group adventure).
173896.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game – Bonus Adventures
boardgameexpansion: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
boardgamefamily: Dungeons and Dragons Adventure System Board Games

173897.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game – Contest Adventures
boardgameexpansion: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
boardgamefamily: Dungeons and Dragons Adventure System Board Games
173897.description:
The winning fan submissions from the Castle Ravenloft Board Game contest. Scenarios designed by Dwayne S., Kevin G., and Greg F. and published by Wizards of the Coast.

Curses!

The Heroes, with Thorgrim at their lead, head back into Castle Ravenloft for revenge. They must defeat the werewolf that killed Thorgrim’s brother.

Goal: Defeat the werewolf.

It has been days since you were last in these crypts with your brother Hargrinn. You and Hargrinn had set out to stop a werewolf that had been terrorizing the locals. Hargrinn was armed with a silver blade to kill it, but he underestimated the werewolf's strength and died at the jaws of the werewolf. After seeing that, you retreated. Now you have come back with a band of adventurers to kill the werewolf and avenge your brother.

A Hero Lost

The Heroes must find the infected Hero in the lower levels of the dungeon and locate the dark fountain. Combine its water with the vial of holy water to cure the infected Hero.

Goal: Cure the infected Hero.

One of your party has been captured and infected by Strahd’s minions. The infected hero is now stranded deep in the crypt. An elixir made by combining holy water with the water from the dark fountain can cure the hero of the disease. Can you make it before the infection overwhelms the lost hero?

The Skull of Necromancy

The Heroes must enter the dungeons of Castle Ravenloft to obtain a powerful artifact and escape with it so that it can be destroyed.

Goal: Recover the Skull of Necromancy and escape the dungeon.

Using divination, you have learned that the Skull of Necromancy, an evil artifact of terrible power, is in Strahd’s dungeon. You have volunteered to explore the dungeon to find the Skull and bring it out to be destroyed.

173898.name: Kult - Guida dell'Invocatore
173898.description:
From the back of the book:
La Realtà in cui viviamo è una menzogna, una prigione creata dal Demiurgo e mantenuta dai suoi Arconti per mantenere l’umanità cieca e schiava. Ma ora che il nostro carceriere è scomparso, sempre più persone iniziano a risvegliarsi e a intraprendere il tormentato cammino della Magia.

English translation:
The reality we live in is a lie, a prison created by the Demiurge and maintained by its Archons to keep humanity blind and slave. But now that our jailer disappeared, more and more people begin to awaken and to take the troubled path of Magic.


publisher blurb
La Realtà in cui viviamo è una menzogna, una prigione creata dal Demiurgo e mantenuta dai suoi Arconti per mantenere l’umanità cieca e schiava. Ma ora che il nostro carceriere è scomparso, sempre più persone iniziano a risvegliarsi e a intraprendere il tormentato cammino della Magia. Cavalcando la Passione e la Follia, controllando lo Spazio-Tempo, muovendosi attraverso i Sogni o sfidando la Morte, ogni mago s’inoltrerà tra le vette e gli abissi della sua stessa sanità mentale, rinunciando poco a poco a parti sempre più consistenti della propria umanità.

La Guida dell’Invocatore è un’espansione per il sistema di gioco di ruolo di Kult e descrive dettagliatamente il mondo della Magia e delle Sette Scienze Occulte. Utile per creare avventure e personaggi connessi all’esoterismo, presenta undici nuovi Archetipi, nuove Capacità e Artefatti, oltre alla descrizione del sistema per lo sviluppo degli incantesimi.

Le Dottrine: In questa sezione vengono descritte le cinque Dottrine, gli aspetti dell’Illusione che è possibile influenzare tramite la magia: Passione, Sogni, Follia, Morte, Tempo e Spazio.

La Sette Scienze Occulte: Le “Chiavi” che permettono di comprendere la Prigione e di infrangerla: la Kabbala, l’Alchimia, l’Astrologia, la Numerologia, il Simbolismo, i Tarocchi e il Voodoo.

translation by Google
The reality we live in is a lie, a prison created by the Demiurge and maintained by its Archons to keep humanity blind and slave. But now that our jailer disappeared, more and more people begin to awaken and to take the troubled path of Magic. Riding the Passion and Madness, checking the Space-Time, moving through the Dreams or defying death, every magician s'inoltrerà between the heights and the depths of his own sanity, giving up little by little to increasingly large parts of their humanity.

Help dell'Invocatore is an expansion for the game system role Kult and describes in detail the world of Magic and the Seven Occult Sciences. Useful to create adventures and characters related to esotericism, presents eleven new Archetypes, new skills and artifacts, as well as the description of the system for the development of the spells.

Doctrines: This section describes the five doctrines, aspects of Illusion that you can influence through the magic: Passion, Dreams, Madness, Death, Time and Space.

The Seven Occult Sciences: The "keys" that allow you to understand the Prison and break it: the Kabbalah, alchemy, astrology, numerology, symbolism, the Tarot and Voodoo.

173899.name: The Sherlock Holmes Puzzle Case
173899.description:
Step into the shoes of Doctor Watson

A quiz game where players take turns attempting to answer puzzling questions in order to earn points.

On their turn, a player chooses a card from one of four piles each representing a different difficulty level. The player then turns a sand timer and if they can correctly answer the question in time they score points. Either way, play then passes to the next player.

More difficult questions are worth more points and each player has a single Moriarty card and a Sherlock card which can each be used once per game to score in additional ways. A Moriarty card is used at the start of another players turn as a bet that they will not answer the question correctly (or in time). If the bet is correct, the Moriarty player earns the points for the question. A Sherlock card can be used on your own turn to make the question worth double the points. However, it must be played before reading the question!

173900.name: Kult - Schermo e Avventura
173900.description:
publisher blurb
Il Velo
Un quartiere condominio, in grado di ospitare migliaia di persone. Un gigante di muri e stanze con una reputazione difficile, un mucchio di cose che non funzionano e gente divisa tra chi le farà funzionare a tutti i costi e chi invece non si fa troppi problemi. Un mostro di scale e cemento. Tra quelle pareti, oltre ai problemi di tutti i giorni, ce ne sono altri di cui nessuno parla volentieri. C’è Maria, una bambina di pochi anni dall'immaginazione senza freni; c’è una comunità di Rom, odiati da buona parte degli altri inquilini e tacitamente accusati di un crimine terribile. Ci sono le voci che circolano a proposito del fantasma, di un ragazzo morto per amore; ci sono persone come Paride che ha ventitré anni e ha ricevuto con terrore le stimmate. Infine ci sono persone ambigue e misteriose come il Signor Tic-Toc, che sembra esserci sempre quando nel condominio accade qualcosa di strano.

La Macchina
Il Serpente è un'avventura studiata per essere giocata sia da gruppi di giocatori esperti che da quelli che si apprestano ad esplorare per la prima volta il mondo di Kult - Oltre il Velo. La struttura dell'avventura non segue un percorso rigido, ma si può adattare alle esigenze del Gamemaster in modo da essere il più possibile free-roaming. Tutte le trame proposte in questo volume sono legate da una storia centrale più complessa e ne sono le naturali conseguenze. A seconda delle scelte dei giocatori, alcune storyline avranno più spazio e altre meno. Sarà anche possibile rigiocare tutto, per avere un'esperienza di gioco da una prospettiva differente.

Oltre all'avventura, troverete anche un lussuoso schermo in cartonato rigido, a quattro ante, angosciante e inquietante come è giusto sia.

translation by Google
The Veil
A neighborhood building, which can accommodate thousands of people. A giant walls and rooms with a poor reputation, a lot of things that do not work and people divided between those who will run at all costs and those who do not do too many problems. A monster of stairs and concrete. Between those walls, in addition to the problems of everyday life, there are others that nobody talks willingly. There's Maria, a girl from the imagination of a few years without brakes; there is a community of Roma, hated by most of the other tenants and tacitly accused of a terrible crime. There are rumors circulating about the ghost of a boy who died for love; There are people like that Paris has twenty-three years and received the stigmata with terror. Finally there are people ambiguous and mysterious as Mr. Tic-Toc, who always seems to be in the building when something strange happens.

The Machine
The Serpent is an adventure designed to be played by both groups of experienced players from those who are preparing to explore for the first time the world of Kult - Beyond the Veil. The structure of the adventure does not follow a rigid path, but can be adapted to the needs of the Gamemaster to be as free-roaming. All plots proposed in this volume are linked by a central story more complex and are the natural consequences. Depending on the choices of the players, some storyline will have more space and others less. It will also be possible to replay all, to have a gaming experience from a different perspective.

In addition to the adventure, you will find a luxurious screen in hardcover drive, four doors, distressing and disturbing as it should be.

173901.name: Wipeout
173901.description:
From the back of the box:
"Surf's Up! It's a fast-paced, wave-riding race! You'll ride the waves, race against other awesome surfer dudes, and avoid wiping out in a fast-action, excellent surfin' experience! But beware! If you don't boogie fast enough you'll be swallowed up by the wildest wave you've ever seen! You gotta' be quick. . . or wipe out!"

Wipeout is played on a vertical plastic tower with rows and columns of slots into which plastic surfers can be inserted. Each player starts with one surfer at the top edge of the tower. A "wave" made of green goo is loaded into a "regulator" at the top of the tower, which dispenses the goo to pour down the tower at a preselected speed. Players then race their surfers down the tower by rolling a die which controls movement. They try to reach the bottom of the tower first while avoiding being engulfed by the wave of goo and "wiping out."

173902.name: Brändi Ahoi!
173902.description:
With Brändi Ahoi! you can go on an exciting adventure, travel the oceans, visit far away countries and experience strange encounters. Every player gets to be a captain!
Are you anxious to reach numerous harbors with as many passengers as possible in order to collect points? Can you smuggle stowaways past coast guards? Can you navigate your ship trough the forces of nature?

How to play:
First you will spread the chips with the hidden side on the harbor-cities.
Every player choses his harbor , receives passenger-chips and catering cards at random to start into the game.
The game is split into 2 phases. The action-phase and the movement phase.
In the action-phase the player will throw 2 dices and has 2 choices.
He makes one action or both actions that correspond to the number on the dices or he chooses to make one action that doesn’t match the number on the dices.
All other players can then choose from one action which the active player hasn’t chosen.
This will give the active player a little advantage but the other players have still a lot of choices.
The player will then make the action he has chosen.
These actions will be released by cards, which you got initially in the action phase.

You can also get event cards. But they aren’t always positive.
A food-inspection can make you lose points. There can be stowaways under the passengers on board, which will make you lose points on a coast guard control.

When all actions have been done you will proceed to the movement phase.
All players move their ships on the beautiful wooden board.
The active player has again a little advantage.
He can move the ship equal the total number of both dices.
The other players can move their ships with the number of the higher dice.
You will get points when you deliver your passenger(s) to the target harbor on you card and when you have enough food to take care of them.
The game can be won by two ways:
1. Be the first to reach 40 victory points.
2. During the game the player receives a personal goal which he keeps secret. In most cases the player has to reach at least 30 victory points as well as special conditions.

173903.name: 1, 2, 3 bunter Papagei
173903.description:
Craok! Croak!
Colorful parrots are waiting to fill their plumage with chips of the correct color which can be found in the eggs.
The player who completes his parrot with all the color chips first, has won the game.
Have fun with this thrilling seeking/searching game!

How to play:
At your turn you take an egg and open it.
Hopefully you will find a chip that isn't already on your board.
If this is the case, you can add it to the board.
If not, you put the chip back into the egg and withdraw it with the other eggs. Then it's the next players turn.
The first player who has filled his board with all colored chips has won the game.

173904.name: Old War Horses (Issue 20 - May 2009)
173904.description:
From the Introduction:

Here's the twentieth issue of OWH and this time I'll be adding to the various moons and planets the PCs can visit for fun or profit.

173905.name: Old War Horses (Issue 21 - May 2009)
173905.description:
From the Introduction:

I've had twenty issues so far in the Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded 'Verse game and I'm going to discuss sandbox versus linear adventure game and how each is different to me. Which I run will simply depend on the choices of the players.

173906.name: Old War Horses (Issue 22 - May 2009)
173906.description:
From the Introduction:

This issue I'm going to continue filling my Serenity/Firefly-Deadlands Reloaded campaign setting with interesting characters, situations and locations for the PCs to interact with. This is under the belief (however mistaken) that the players will choose goals that will allow these items to be added with little work on my part.

173908.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 1 - Jun 2009)
173908.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to Princes in the Tower, just a 'zine about gaming. If you aren't familiar with my previous 'zines, be sure to check them out. In this one, I'll be covering some of the RPG campaigns that I've been interested in running (or have run).

173909.description:
Description from the publisher:

"The Underway is a funky, chaotic, and eclectic mix of architecture and ethnicities. What unifies it is a general counterculture vibe – the sense that they are pioneers and iconoclasts. But this independent spirit paved the way for the rise of Los Muertos."
–Exposé on The Underway: Part IV – Days of the Muertos

The Underway, the fourth Data Pack in the SanSan Cycle for Android: Netrunner, explores the meat space, culture, and residents of the megacity SanSan. The cradle of high-end tech, home to beautiful beaches, and the host of the World Expo, SanSan is also still recovering from "The Big One", the cataclysmic earthquake that opened up the San Andreas fault and redefined America's western coast. However, this event that was disastrous for many was an opportunity for others, some of whom quickly moved their homes and businesses into the new space that was created.

Accordingly, the sixty new cards in The Underway (three copies each of twenty different cards) explore this new space and its motley assembly of different architectural styles, ethnicities, and cultural influences. They also explore the pervasive influence of Los Muertos, a street gang whose members are identified by their bioluminescent tattoos and who deal in illegal tech as much as they deal in flesh and drugs. Through the introduction of new resources, illicit hardware, and clever programs, the gang’s criminal influence pervades every aspect of this Data Pack, starting with a new Criminal Runner identity, then reaching outward as other Runner factions are supplied with the sort of tech you don't normally find in America, and finally rippling into every aspect of every card as Corps are forced to deal with the gang’s members in one way or another.
173909.name: Android: Netrunner – The Underway

173910.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 2 - Jul 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Who Made Them & Where Did They Go?
173910.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 2 of Princes in the Tower outlines the Fringeworthy setting and my PC in the game that the first GM ran.

173911.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 3 - Jul 2009)
173911.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 3 of Princes in the Tower is all about the campaign idea - rather than use the Mellor, a shapeshifting race that is pretty tough, I chose a little known Fringeworthy foe for the PCs to fight.

A Fringeworthy foe that are pretty rough and tumble.

173912.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 4 - Jul 2009)
173912.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 4 of Princes in the Tower is all about the Fringe Pirates, presenting a bunch of different companies of these evil-doers, their abilities, and their trade-in-theft specialties.

173913.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 5 - Jul 2009)
173913.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 5 of Princes in the Tower continues the various Fringe Pirate companies that the PCs may encounter.

173914.name: Trzęsienie Danych
173914.description:
Game is about learning how to safety use computer and handle your digital data and personal information.
Players spent "time" to buy available cards that can be used to handle specific bad events.
Example of cards that can be bought:
"Secure Connection"
"Encrypted Emails"
"Privacy settings"
Example of bad events:
"Data leak"
"Stalker"

Good cards help prepare for bad events that will damage players. Player who received the least damage wins the game.

173915.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 6 - Jul 2009)
173915.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 6 of Princes in the Tower introduces two of the PCs in the game, Vigo and Peyton.

173916.name: The Advanced Edge
173916.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Advanced Edge is a companion sourcebook to The Advanced Arsenal and The Advanced Armory. The Advanced Edge focuses on futuristic melee weapons, as well as muscle-powered ranged weapons.

In addition to futuristic weapons, some relatively lowtech weapons from exotic cultures are introduced, as many of these exotic cultural weapons are wielded by the heroes and villains of Otherverse Games’ signature campaign worlds.

This sourcebook also standardizes and collects a wide variety of exotic and ultra-tech melee weapons originally presented in several different sourcebooks and campaign worlds, and consolidate their information in one place, in one format.

173918.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 7 - Jul 2009)
173918.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 7 of Princes in the Tower covers a new Edge that allows a non-spellcaster to cast a spell, a new alien race and house rule from a kind fellow Savage Worlds fan.

173920.name: Warlock
173920.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the name implies, the OSR Warlock is a new class for old school versions of the world's most popular fantasy role-playing. It is not the official version from third or fifth editions, but instead largely inspired by a third party supplement with some ideas of my own based on the warlock from my favorite fantasy series.

The warlock is a character so imbued with magic that he can use it to blast his opponent with arcane bolts, replicate a limited number of spells, and manipulate objects with his mind.

Although primarily intended for first advanced edition, it also contains tables for other popular versions: original edition, basic and expert editions, and cyclopedic editions.

173921.name: iO
173921.description:
User Summary

iO is an abstract action platformer. Change your size (you are a ball or a disc) in order to move faster or slower, change trajectory or momentum.

Get to the end as fast as possible. Seems easy?

173922.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 8 - Jul 2009)
173922.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 8 of Princes in the Tower outlines two more PCs in the game, Bill and Sgt. Clem.

173923.name: Beginning Sounds 3-in-a-Row Game
173923.description: Beginning Sounds 3-in-a-Row Game is a bingo-type game designed to teach the recognition of beginning letter sounds. Players have 3-by-3 cards marked with pictures. Like Bingo, in order to win, a player must complete a row of three across, down or diagonally. Unlike Bingo, each player takes turns spinning a spinner marked with five letters. They must then find a picture that starts with the letter spun. Only the player spinning may mark his or her card. The game comes with four separate sets of cards to cover the entire alphabet.

173924.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 9 - Jul 2009)
173924.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 9 of Princes in the Tower outlines a bunch of minor Fringe Pirate companies and a new aspect to the Fringepaths - Fringetowns!

173925.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 10 - Jul 2009)
173925.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 10 of Princes in the Tower has more minor Fringe Pirate companies and two different Fringetowns.

173926.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 11 - Aug 2009)
173926.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 11 of Princes in the Tower contains the last two PCs from the Savage Fringeworthy campaign, Ezra and Marcus.

173927.name: Princes in the Tower (Issue 12 - Aug 2009)
173927.description:
Author's Description:

Issue 12 of Princes in the Tower is the final issue and includes a monster the PCs faced during the adventure and a write-up of the campaign.

173928.name: Innløsning: A Rune Casting Game of Redemption
173928.description:
Rise again, noble Völva! You are being given a second chance for Glory!

As you walk the grey and barren lands of Helheim, songs of Valhalla fill your heart and empower your very soul.  However, you are Völva, a seer or ‘wand carrier’. Unlike warriors that got to fight and die in battle to be carried off to Valhalla, you were only an adviser and tactician who assisted by drawing upon the power of the Runes to help your fellow warriors in their battles.

However, Freya smiles upon you and offers redemption to the Völva who can prove their abilities. By using the runes to create gateways, you must work your way up from Helheim to Asgard. By being victorious in challenges and tests of strength, you gain valour and come one step closing to being accepted in Valhalla!

OVERVIEW
Innløsning is an abstract 2 player rune casting game where players are fallen Völva souls in Helheim looking for redemption so that they may enter Valhalla, the hall of the Chosen. Players must create gateways, starting in Helheim, and sequentially working their way up to Asgard. By casting the runes, they will generate power to create those gateways and activate them. However, this is not enough to gain entrance to Valhalla. You must also gain enough valour by using the runes to overcome challenges, or to defeat your rival, by drawing upon the strength provided by the gateways. When you have earned enough valour and opened all the gateways, only then will you be allowed entrance to Valhalla!

GOAL
The first player to have gateways in each of the 9 realms, open all their gateways and have 11 valour wins.

173929.name: Box O'Cats
173929.description:
Box O'Cats challenges 3 to 5 players to fire up their imaginations solving bizarre dilemmas. Each round, players creatively convince the others that their unusual items best solve the presently perplexing predicament.

Giant robots are attacking. Do you whip out the dynamite or the magic spells?

Or maybe you're pulling the ultimate prank. Will you choose the rubber chicken or the warped time machine? Or maybe... the Box O'Cats?

173930.description:
The second volume in the Huzzah series concentrates entirely upon the Wilderness Campaign. It will consist of 8 scenarios.

May 5th Scenarios
1 Opening Guns North. Warren's Fifth Corps temporarily punctures Ewell's center, only to be hurled back by a vicious Confederate counter-attack led by the inestimable John Gordon.
2 Sixth Corps Joins the Fray. An extension of scenario 1, as reinforcements from Sedgewick's Corps descends upon Ewell's left flank. Hay's Louisiana Tigers help stem the blue flood.
3 Hill to the Attack! Two divisions of A.P. Hill's 3rd Corps rattles up the Orange Plank Road and attempts to cut Grant in half by capturing the Brock Road intersection. A single division, commanded by VIth Corps George Getty, stands in his way. Hancock's II corps arrives just in time to save the day. Or will he?

May 6th Scenarios
1 Lee to the Rear! Early in the morning of may 6th Hancock strikes Heth's and Wilcox's divisions of Hill's 3rd Corps. Both divisions have been strung out and exhausted from the previous days fighting. They expected Longstreet's early arrival, and so neglect to fortify their line. Hancock initially drives them almost handsomely, and nearly captures Lee's HQ at the Widow Tapp farm. The engagement witnesses one of the most dramatic moments of the war, when the Marble Man himself proposes to lead the Texas Brigade of Longstreet corps in a counter-charge.
2 Like a Wet Blanket. Now fully arrived, Longstreet strikes the over-extended flank of Hancock's corps. In a swift and dramatic reversal it's now the Yankee's turn to run. Will Longstreet capture the ever important Brock Road intersection?
3 Gordon's Assault. John B. Gordon, ever the thorn in Grant's side, jumps the VI corps and nearly shatters the Yankee's right. Only the coming of darkness brings his assault to an end.

The Campaign Games
These games implement Custom command rules simulating the problems of controlling armies over vast broken terrain. Lee struggles to coordinate his widely separated wings, while Grant whittles away the days, goading reluctant subordinates to action.
1 The May 5th Mini-Campaign game. Combines scenarios 1, 2, and 3, and provides additional units and player options.
2 The full Campaign Game. Play the entire 2 day battle. The ever-frustrating Burnside provisions both the Yankee crux and the Rebel hope. Will you dare achieve better than the historical stalemate?

Projected Contents:

8 11"x17" maps that mate together to form various portions of the battlefield, or all together for the entire campaign.
560 half inch die-cut full-color counters
1 Rules booklet
1 Scenarios booklet
2 Sheets of charts and tables
2 Ten-sided dice
1 Game box




(source: One Small Step website))
173930.name: Huzzah! 2: Dark Woods, Dreadful Fields (the Wilderness Campaign)

173931.description:
Holy Roman Empire is a political and military game of the 17th Century struggle for empire that plunged Europe into one of its longest and most destructive wars. Up to six players control the major dynasties of the era, fielding armies, navies, and engaging in diplomatic intrigue, bribery decide who will wear the crown of the Holy Roman Empire.

The year is 1619. Matthias, emperor of Germany, has gone to his grave. A year-old rebellion in the imperial province of Bohemia had divided the empire along religious and political lines. Bohemian rebels have elected a minor German prince, Frederick, elector Palatine, as their king. Protestant princelings rally to Frederick, elevating his status to that of a rival to Em­peror Ferdinand II, Archduke of Austria, for the imperial throne. As mercenary armies are raised against Ferdinand, the Catholic King of Spain and Duke of Bavaria rally to his side. France and Sweden turn their attention to Germany in eager anticipation of the dismemberment of their great rival, the Holy Roman Empire.
173931.name: Holy Roman Empire: The Thirty-Years War
boardgameexpansion: Holy Roman Empire Expansion 1: Battles of the Thirty Years War
Holy Roman Empire Expansion 2: Battles of the English Civil War
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 71: Mutants, game studies, and 2015 in review

173933.name: Agents of Change
173933.description:
From publisher blurb:

This player supplement expands upon the Corporia RPG with 5 new character archetypes, 10 new character-building assets, 2 new special weapns, 9 new pistols within 3 new weapons categories, and 2 new heavily armored vehicles!

173934.name: The Perspective (Volume 2, Issue 2 - Feb 2015)
rpgissuearticle: New Race for Sojourner’s Quest II, Alternative Edition: Demar
173934.description:
From publisher blurb:

Contained within this FREE issue happens to be:

Gaming News
New Sojourner's Quest Race
New Sutlharian Deity
Creature Feature

173935.name: Operation Lightning
173935.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is the fall of 1944 and the Allied Forces are making strides in the liberation of Europe. The Nazis are desperate to find anything that they can use to slow the advance of the Allies as they march across France.

The OSS has received troubling reports from Basque fighters as well as French Resistance members in Southern France. North of the small town of Albi, a contingent of German soldiers and scientists have taken up residence in an abandoned home on one of the region's many hilltops. It has been reported that Werner Heisenberg himself has visited the site and oversaw the creation of a small laboratory. However, more troubling than that is the strange report of balls of light coming from the grounds of the compound. Allied Intelligence fears that the Germans are working on a super weapon.

Your group is tasked with infiltrating the compound, stealing the technology if possible or destroying it if not.

“Operation Lightning” is an adventure with supernatural elements for 4–6 players using Fabled Environments’ “Victorian Style Mansion” and “Craftsman Style Bungalow” maps and the Savage Worlds core rules, suitable for an evening’s play. The premise of this adventure requires characters that possess military skills, but not necessarily members of the military. Seven pre-generated characters are provided at the end of the module for your convenience as well as small copies of the Victorian Style Mansion and Craftsman Style Bungalow.

173936.name: Sectors Thirty-Three - Thirty-Five
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
173936.description:
From publisher blurb:

The exploration of “Unexplored Space” continues with Sectors 33-35.

You'll find more new colonies for your group to explore, and lots of places that have not been explored by any of the current eleven species. The remnants of the Glikth-machine wars litter two of these sectors, and there's a new species that has not reached interstellar space. Will they survive, or will someone like the Culthan come along and exploit them?

173938.name: Jigsaw Commando
173938.description:
Build the map. Invade it. Watch out for land mines.


December 22, 1944. Allied troops are trapped behind enemy lines. Time for the Jigsaw Commandos to rescue them!


Jigsaw Commando is the newest game from MJD Game Studios that combines Tetris and wargames into fast, addictive, tense and thematic gameplay where building the map is as fun as invading it. Play for 5 minutes or 15, stop, and come back later. Jigsaw Commando is the perfect play-while-standing-in-line or on the train game. BUILDING A MAP AND DESTROYING IT HAS NEVER BEEN MORE FUN.

"Finally, a puzzle game with a THEME."

Jigsaw Commando is played over 2 phases:

PHASE 1: RECON. In the Recon phase, the player places Tetris-like puzzle pieces to explore the map, locate missing troops, avoid minefields, and find enemy tanks and snipers in an effort to prepare for the imminent rescue attempt of allied forces. But beware, careful placement of supplies, weapons, and buildings may be the only chance you have to ensure a successful rescue.

PHASE 2: ASSAULT. In the Assault phase, the player takes charge of leading the rescue attempt by invading the map just built in the Recon phase. Again, the player places Tetris-like puzzle pieces to eliminate the enemies they just placed, avoid minefields, destroy tanks, and attempts to leave all trapped comrades open for rescue. Miss a sniper, and your entire rescue attempt can fail. Step on a land mine, and craters will start filling up the battlefield and stop your troops.


Offering 4 levels of difficulty, Jigsaw Commando provides hours of addictive fun as the battlefield becomes more and more complicated between each wave. Players will discover tanks, bunkers, minefields, snipers, bomb craters, medical supplies, churches, and more, in an attempt to save as may allied troops as possible.

Also available is a special mini-expansion, Treacherous Blockades, which adds Barbed Wire, Hedgehogs, Rivers, Narrow Chasms, and Highways to the battlefield to make rescue attempts even more challenging.

Source: The Game Website.

173939.name: Urban Legends
173939.description:
User Summary

You play a journalist named PJ who is trapped in an abandoned hospital. You must discover your past while escaping Jeff, a killer from legend.

173940.name: Holidays in Malaysia
173940.description:
From the rules:
"Holidays in Malaysia is a fun and enjoyable game that showcases the beauty of Malaysia. Plan your perfect vacation to Malaysia; you can experience the unique multicultural heritage, sumptuous cuisine, eclectic arts, and architecture of Malaysia. Discover its natural wonders; from some of the most beautiful islands and beaches in the world, to lost tropical jungles that have been wildlife for millions of years. With a little luck and clever planning, you might just outwit your fellow travelers. The first traveler to visit 6 landmarks, collect at least 2 souvenirs, taste 2 cuisines and arrive at the final square wins the game."

Holidays in Malaysia is a roll-and-move game where players move along a track, accumulating vacation experiences in Malaysia. Players roll a die to move along a multi-path track. Spaces may gain them vacation experiences or souvenirs, move them to other places on the board or cause them to gain or lose turns. After a player gains all the necessary experiences, they proceed to the finish to win the game.

173942.name: Virtual Empire
173942.description: In Virtual Empire, players try to create a business empire and amass a fortune by moving along a track, collecting various cards that represent ideas, assets and business developments, collecting income along the way. Spaces or cards may send you to court or help or hinder the development of your business. In order to finish the game, players must collect one each of nine different types of cards and land on the Empire Money Chest at the end of the track. Players get bonus money for finishing before other players. At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins.

173943.name: Catching Fairies
173943.description:
Every year, the Royal Society for Folklore Studies, holds a meeting where its members can impress their fellows by showing the result of their efforts. To do so you will try to document the existence of fairies and leprechauns, supplying proof to support your claims. But be careful, for the rest of ladies and gentleman will do whatever it’s on their hands to debunk you and harm your reputation at the club while increasing their own.!

The basic mechanic consist in assembling sets of “proof cards” of the same type in order to get “recognition points” at the end of the game. Players can also try to debunk other player’s sets of cards.

This game entered the 24 hour contest - February 2015

173944.name: Micro-manage
173944.description:
Microgame for 3 - 5 players lasting 20 - 30 minutes. Game components are deck of 24 cards, although sheet of paper and writing implement are needed for scoring.

You and your opponents are city managers trying to improve the quality of your municipality in terms of Arts, Environment and Industry. During each of the four rounds you draft three cards to improve one of these qualities with one round devoted to improving an omnibus combined score. Player with the highest score at the end of the fourth round wins.

173945.name: ifWHATthen?
173945.description:
ifWHATthen? is the non-stop fun, action-packed party game for friends and family, old and young alike.

ifWHATthen? is the sentence creation game that starts with an "if..." statement and ends when you choose the funniest "...then" statement.

If I wonder which pants to wear...
...then I have a party for one.
...then we decide to call the band 'Mighty Hat'.
...then you oversleep and miss your first day of BEING AWESOME.

If your card is chosen as the funniest...
...then you win that round!

ifWHATthen? invites everyone at the table to use their imagination to find the more than 50,000 card combinations right out of the box.

IF… you are ready for fun,
THEN... this is the game for you!

173946.description:
The Barnyard Legions March to War
From the frigid north to the arid Sahara, the Barnyard Legions march forth to claim their place in history. In Barnyard Legions you, the general, have been given a mission to keep the other Legions from ever completing their goal of lining up a proper battle line or two. Will you command the Sheep Legionnaires under the rule of Julius Sheepsar? Or will the hoof of Auroch the Red Boviking crush the Celtucky Chickens?

How do you play?
Each player takes their choice of Barnyard Legion and mixes some of their cards into a common deck. The rest of their cards are kept as their own deck. Each turn, players take 2-3 actions, attempting to complete a battle line of five cards from their Legion. To keep the game moving, every player draws a card from their deck at the start of each round, hoping to not run out of cards, causing elimination, before the battle has been won.

What is unique about it?
The game has built in subtleties that will appeal to gamers, while the unique decks and humorous tongue-in-cheek art make Barnyard Legions a great gateway game for players who are not familiar with more complicated card games. Families will be able to sit down and follow the very simple rules and start playing immediately.
173946.name: Barnyard Legions

173947.name: King of the Jungle
173947.description:
Publisher's description:
Who will be the first predator to reach the top of the food chain? It could be you. . . if you can answer questions about life science correctly!

King of the Jungle is an educational game designed to test and improve students' knowledge of life science. Players move pawns along a track. In order to move, a player must draw a card and answer the question on the card correctly. He or she may then roll the die and move along the track. Along the track, spaces may take away or grant extra turns, send the player back or forward along the track or allow the player to trade places with another. If a player lands on another player's space, the first player there must move back along the track to the closest space marked with an animals. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

173948.name: Mix & Match ABC
173948.description:
Mix & Match ABC is a self-correcting matching game designed to teach the alphabet and reading. It consists of a series of matching cards, one side with a letter and word printed on it, and the other with a corresponding picture. The cards have a puzzle piece edge, and each card only fits its pair.

There are two possible ways to play. One is called Match Out. In this game, cards are placed face-down and each player draws an equal number. The first player places the top tile on their stack face-up. Each player in turn then turns up his or her top tile. If it matches any of the turned-up tiles, the player matches them, puts them aside, and turns up the next tile in his or her stack. This continues until no matches are made, and play passes to the next player. The first player to eliminate his or her stack wins.

In ABC Rummy, letter and picture tiles are places in separate piles. Players take turns drawing from either stack until they all have four tiles in their hand. If any players have matches, they may lay them down immediately. Each player then draws a tile from either pile and tries to match it to tiles in their hand. If there is a match, they are put aside and the player may draw again. If not, the player may keep up to four tiles and must discard any others face-up in the middle of the table. Further players may draw from either the piles or the face-up tiles, making as many matches as possible. Play continues until one player has five pairs.

173949.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier MG42 Team expansion
173949.description: The German Fusilier MG42 Team offers devastating sustained automatic firepower, capable of keeping the enemy pinned down. Featuring a MG42 and Ammo bearer, this team is a welcome addition to any assault or defense. These soldiers come with their basic playing cards but also 8 new Specialist cards that may include Story, Command, React and all new Equipment cards.

173950.name: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier STG44 Leader expansion
